reviews.text: I don&#39;t have a ton of experience with this location, but our experience last night (10/2/20) wasn&#39;t great. I totally understand that COVID makes everything a lot more difficult and they looked swamped with takeout orders, but they seemed to lack any type of concrete plan for distributing takeout orders. We arrived a few minutes after our quoted time for our order time and we kept getting several different directions on how to get our order. No one seemed to know what was going on. My biggest complaint was how rude the host was (there was a temporary switch to a very nice host, but then the rude one came right back). We didn&#39;t end up receiving our order for about 20 minutes, the food was cold, and was missing an order of fries. I appreciate everything they are doing and I&#39;m sure this situation is overwhelming, but they definitely need to figure out a better takeout system.

Cannot express the night I had... What a worldwin of a night. Today at approximately 12:17 I received a text from my deathly ill friend Raphael who asked me to spend one of his last meals with him. Raphy explained to me that he had been craving some TCF recently and let me tell you... I LOVE a good dinner at the factory... I had to pick Raphael up because he can no longer drive. When I picked him up, he had the worlds brightest smile on his face, it lit up my life. That smile alone made me know that both God AND Jesus are looking down on us now (Isaiah 43:2). Anyway, we arrived at the factory and were granted the most luxurious handie capped spot right front and center, as it should be. We entered the premises and were immediately greeted by the most wonderful and kind hostess. She seated us immediately (I can only assume she did this because she saw the condition of my good friend Raphael). We sat down on arguably one of the most comfortable booths I have ever sat at, with a lovely view of the parking lot. Funny enough, I watched a lady drop her pasta while eating my dinner that I will get to now. I ordered a fettuccini Alfredo and my friend ordered a loose soup. He loves loose soup. The dinner was delightful and to die for. Good thing Raphael is in the condition he is in right now.

Verdict: Cheesecake or not, this factory is calorific!<br><br>How does one make almost everything on the menu 1,600 or more calories? Pasta? Sure. Cheesecake? Not surprised. But a salad? Shoulda made a left turn at Albuquerque. The only chance you have here is to order from the light menu, minimize the damage elsewhere, or spend a couple extra hours at the gym.<br><br>I chose the minimize damage menu option for this visit. The Southwestern chicken sandwich was surprisingly good and filling. The salad was nice and light alongside the slightly heavier and spicier sandwich. I&#39;d get this again.<br><br>I enjoy the food at the Factory. It&#39;s popular so I&#39;m not the only one. All things considered, we&#39;d better enjoy the food because it&#39;s going to be with us a little while.
Got take out since we just had a baby and someone gave us a gift card. We live minutes away so we were disappointed that our food was ice cold.

My family and I decided to come here for lunch. We waited 45 minutes to be seated. We waited an hour after being seated and ordering before our meal came. The appetizer came about 20 minutes after being seated. To my surprise, I got potato bites that I didn&#39;t order along with crab bites that I did order. I ordered baked potato soup. My food was lukewarm at best while the others had hot food. It doesn&#39;t take a rocket scientist to know that you don&#39;t cook the items that won&#39;t take long first. That&#39;s cooking 101. One family member got herb crusted salmon that was bland.  The teriyaki chicken breast still had the skin on it and enough rice for four people. The waitress wasn&#39;t very attentive. To be honest, this was like being served at McDonald&#39;s that service and food were so poor. When the server went to get freshly made crab bites, they arrived after everyone else had finished eating. Might I add, the potato soup is loose and watery. <br><br>Would I recommend this location? No<br><br>Do the cooks and servers need some additional training? Absolutely<br><br>After waiting almost two hours between getting the table and food, I expected to have better service. <br><br>Hopefully, the corporate office will take a look at the poor service provided to customers at this location. I won&#39;t be back here or any Cheesecake Factory location. Now, we have to go somewhere else to get a meal.<br><br>FYI... I asked for a manager and the so-called manager never came, so we left. I see where the customer service breakdown is. It starts at the top with the manager and has worked its way down.

Whenever I think of the King of Prussia Mall, one of the first things I think of is the Cheesecake Factory!! Granted it is pricey, a tad bit cramped and there is always a wait, but I can overlook those things as it is one of my favorite restaurants!! I usually park in the parking garage right across from it, it&#39;s a 2 minute walk and you are right there! There are a few different areas to eat at indoors and an outdoor section as well. Any one of them is great to eat at, even the outdoor section if you don&#39;t mind the cars driving back and forth (I usually don&#39;t mind if the weathers nice and I got good food). <br><br>The bread here is amazing, definitely on the same level as Olive Garden Breadsticks for me (something I hold in the highest regard for bread, which I love). As for the food itself, there are many, many drinks and entrees to choose from!! Pastas, Pizzas, Sandwiches, Steaks, Chicken, Fish, brunch on the weekends you name it!! They also have lunch and dinner portions too for those who want a smaller or higher portion. I have had the Chicken Parmesan sandwich which I liked but my all time favorite is the Four Cheese Pasta which is Penne Pasta with Mozzarella, Ricotta, Romano and Parmesan Cheeses, Marinara Sauce and Fresh Basil, which can come with chicken too! I keep telling myself I&#39;ll try something else but it is so fantastic i fail each time and get the same thing (not a bad thing). <br><br>Overall, I love the Cheesecake Factory and I enjoy coming here when I get the chance. It is a positive experience each time and I know will keep coming back, and I hope others will too!

I don&#39;t get the hype! went there once and never wanna go back since. The cheesecake was so so( The vanilla overpowered the cheese and it&#39;s over sweetened.)<br>My friend went there last year(2018), had a Caesar salad(might be the lettuce) and a margarita and got sick from it, that didn&#39;t help to change my mind.

The Cheesecake Factory is always a good go to. This one in particular almost always has a wait time on the weekends. It&#39;s in a super large busy mall so that is no surprise. We went on a Sunday Night and needed a table for two, it was only a 20min wait. There was a nice large menu on the wall outside so we were able to look at selections before being seated (which helps speed up the process of getting our food once seated).<br><br>Our server was super attentive but not overbearing. Food came out hot and in a food amount of time. The brown bread is to DIE for. Overall it&#39;s your typical Cheesecake Factory visit. No complaints here.

The Cheesecake Factory in KOP is so good! The wait for the food after ordering was not long at all and it was super delicious. The waitress Betty was very attentive and friendly! She is a great waitress. I recommend coming here.

Just as a warning this location is extremely busy as it&#39;s within the King of Prussia Mall. Once you&#39;re seated though, it is just the same as all the other branches of Cheesecake Factory, which is exactly how I expected it to be. Even in the busy time, service was pretty quick and friendly. The food was great, same as the other locations. We were a table of six. We ordered the calamari app, Jamaican black pepper shrimp but opted out the shrimp for chicken, Louisiana chicken pasta, and chicken and biscuits. All were delicious and all three of these entrees are definitely my go-to&#39;s at the Cheesecake Factory. We also ordered the chicken fingers with fries for my younger cousin which came with honey mustard, ketchup, and ranch dips. For dessert, we had the oreo and vanilla bean cheesecakes and as always, the restaurant&#39;s cheesecakes were decadent and divine.

I think it&#39;s called the &#34;cheesecake&#34; factory for a reason, and the next time I go I plan to stick to just that - cheesecake. It reminds me of an overpriced diner, because they have a huge menu with just about every kind of option possible.<br><br>The complementary bread prior to my meal and the cheesecake at the end were the highlights. Between the three of us we ordered the following entrees: 1) Truffle honey chicken 2) Chicken Riesling 3) Chicken and biscuits.<br>The food was NOT hot! Really affected the overall quality of the meal. It was bland &amp; lacking in flavor.

The Cheesecake Factory has good customer service! My boyfriend and I had terrible service on our anniversary, so they sent us a gift card to compensate after reading my Yelp review. We have tried them again since. My go-to order is the chicken quesadilla. I&#39;ve tried other menu items such as the Factory Burrito and Skinnylicious White Chicken Chili, but now that I&#39;ve found the quesadilla, I don&#39;t foresee myself getting anything else! It&#39;s consistently wonderful and cheesy. I wish they&#39;d put it on the 1/2 price Happy Hour Menu! As for the cheesecake, you really can&#39;t go wrong. I&#39;ve tried 12 different ones so far! Here&#39;s my Top 5:<br>1. Toasted S&#39;mores Marshmallow Galore<br>2. Oreo Dream Extreme <br>3. Ultimate Red Velvet<br>4. Salted Caramel<br>5. Godiva<br><br>I only wish I had a location closer to my house, the prices were more reasonable, and the service would improve. These are my only critiques. The Cheesecake Factory is (and always will be) my favorite restaurant!

I&#39;ve been to this location a dozen times, with some visits better than others, but will base this review on our most recent experience. <br><br>My husband and I went at 6pm on a recent Friday. We were prepared to wait hours, since they don&#39;t take reservations, but walked right in and were seated immediately. Simply unheard of, I know! We were even able to request a different, more private booth than the table we were initially led to.<br><br>Our waiter was fantastic -- very friendly, good sense of humor, answered a couple questions and made some recommendations. We ordered appetizers, drinks, an entrée, and dessert, as well as an extra slice of cheesecake to go. He remained attentive and upbeat throughout our entire meal. <br><br>Everything was good, from the warm complimentary bread, to my Passionfruit Mojito, and of course the cheesecake (Godiva Chocolate  Cheesecake for me).  The Shrimp Scampi was admittedly a bit disappointing. Shrimp was slightly overdone and had shells left on most of them -- an unpleasant surprise. Flavor was otherwise all right. I really enjoyed the delicious Korean Fried Cauliflower bites!<br><br>As usual, portions were huge, so we packed up about half of it all and enjoyed it the next day!<br><br>All around it was a positive dining experience. Prices are decent, considering the generous sizes they offer for mostly everything on their 21-page menu. Restrooms were clean. <br><br>I&#39;m a fan. If you aren&#39;t under any time constraint, it&#39;s a great choice.

Surprisingly our first time! It was my 17 year olds birthday and she always wanted to go. I&#39;ve been inside one over 15 years ago but never ate. Our food was fantastic, our server Devan was great she went over the top! We will definitely be going again!

Delicious per usual.<br>Menu is always so overwhelming, but I know what I like and pretty much get the same 10 things every time I visit TCF. <br>Orange chicken is always a favorite, grilled steak tacos are so good. The chicken enchiladas are extra good.  Even the &#34;Glamburgers&#34; are good. <br>Can&#39;t forget about the cheesecake at the end.

This is the first subpar experience I have had at any Cheesecake Factory chain. The drinks came out after the appetizers, half the dinner guests received their entrees 25 minutes after the other half, and the waitress rolled her eyes when told the food delivered was cold. In total, there was a 75 minute wait to get our dinner. We were never given napkins or utensils, and weren&#39;t given a copy of the receipt to discuss with a hostess. What had previously been my go-to restaurant has been delegated until further notice.
Took my favorite meal off the menu (Thai Salmon) said it wasn&#39;t popular. It was hard to find on the menu. Don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going there as often. So disappointed!

Decor/service: it has the classic decor of a Cheesecake Factory. The bathroom is the only area that was not clean. They deff could clean it more often. The service was good and attentive but almost to attentive. It felt like they were asking if we were okay every 2 minutes.<br><br>Food: the fried Mac and cheese was delicious. Some of the best I have had. The pasta carbonara left something to be desired as there was just an overwhelming amount of sauce and not nearly enough chicken and peas.

I do NOT recommend ordering curbside... <br>Been sitting here 20 minutes after the time my food was to be out here... When I called the number to tell them I was here, the girl told me to hold on... 5 minutes later, I hung up and called back. She then gave me an attitude, and told me its bc we were waiting for the bakery bc of our large order and they were waiting on someone else which is why we were still holding. Wait what??!! You couldn&#39;t pick the phone back up to tell me why I was holding? She gave us loads of attitude and shouldn&#39;t be in customer service of any kind. After the 20 minutes, we called agaiN and luckily got someone else... FUNNY bc within 2 seconds of that call, he was out the door with our food! Which was cold... So must&#39;ve been sitting there to spite us. Rude as hell. I&#39;m only giving 2 stars bc the guy was very nice and apologetic.
Always love food here but this time i found this in my salad dish ($15.95). So disgusting!!

26 reviews · 11 photos<br>6 minutes ago<br>The Cheesecake factory was one of my favorite restaurants to go to. So it was to my surprise when I choose this restaurant for my birthday dinner that we were treated so badly. Not only did we wait two hours to get seated when they told us our table will be ready in one hour and 20 minutes, we are seated at a table that was not cleaned, they were not following the CDC guidelines.<br>When our waiter finally greeted us, we gave him our drink orders. He came back with our water but told us the drinks at the bar will take sometime, at that point I told him to cancel my drink order and just bring my husbands beer. He said let me go back and do that. He proceeded to come back with our drinks and said that he couldn&#39;t cancel my order that I would have to not only drink it but pay for it as well. Then left and  never came back letting us sit there for  20 mins while he deliberately ignored us. We finally got up and went to find the manager while our waiter saw us and said &#34; good bye&#34; in a very Condescending  way then told us it was a waste of time complaining about him that it wouldn&#39;t do any good. We explained to the manager what happened,  he didn&#39;t seem to care as well so we left and went over to the  Yard House restaurant where they took us right away and we were treated with respect. They also followed every CDC guideline as well. We felt very safe and our waiter was fabulous and the food was amazing and fresh. Little did that snarky waiter at the Cheesecake Factory know that I give a 25 to 30% tip, he would&#39;ve made $20-$25 in the tip that night but instead I gave it to the waiter at the &#34;Yard house restaurant&#34;. He deserved it more than the other waiter anyways!!

Ordered a to-go meal for curbside pick up only to get all the way home to find out they did not put any Parmesan cream sauce on the pasta dish I ordered which totally ruined the meal for me. I was not about to drive back there from Philadelphia. The food was not edible and extremely dry, called and spoke to management who stated they could send me a voucher in the mail for their mistake. Fast forward to this week I received the gift card in the mail for 10$. Like seriously??? That barely covers a drink in that establishment. That is completely ridiculous, at least give me enough to get another identical meal. I expected better from this place.

I have ordered multiple full cheesecakes over the year and they were always kept in the refrigerator until pickup. Today, I ordered a full Cheesecake with strawberries and whipped cream. Instead of placing the Cheesecake back in the refrigerator, they left it sit on the counter fir over 3 hrs. Strawberries and whipped cream was both warm and when I questioned the woman behind the counter, she was very rude. Good thing the cheesecake was frozen. In a nutshell, if you are ordering a cheesecake, go in and get it.

You can never go wrong with the Cheesecake Factory! I only wish I lived closer. And I wish they took reservations. <br>We decided to go for lunch on Mother&#39;s Day, as expected the wait was 75-90 minutes. Thankfully you&#39;ve got plenty of shopping that can be done during your wait time. <br><br>Given how crowded it was, the service was still acceptable. We waited a little longer for service/food, but not to the point that it was unbearable. <br>It wasn&#39;t until we were half way through our meals did I realize that I had ordered chicken sliders for my daughter and not meat. The server was apologetic and brought out a chicken slider immediately. <br><br>The portions are gigantic! Enough to satisfy anyone&#39;s appetite. Even the kids meals are well portioned. Large menu, plenty of choices and difficult to choose! My eyes are always bigger than my stomach when I&#39;m here :)
I had dinner plans for my birthday tonight and they wouldn&#39;t take me because the mall decided to close early a phone call about my reservation would have been nice . Disappointed

I&#39;ve been going to this cheese cake factory for years now and was very impressed with my most recent visit. Went there for a late lunch/early dinner around 3 with my girlfriend and we felt that our waitress did not great us the same as other tables around us. She was very polite to a table of young women next to us then barely gave us any attention when she came to or table.. we felt very unwelcomed. The only time we received fast service was when she brought back the check and my card. It was not busy and since we were seated by the booth were most waiters/waitresses prep things we knew she wasn&#39;t busy.. <br><br>Wish it could have been a more pleasant visit.. not sure if we&#39;ll return after such a negative experience.

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. Tyler was our server and he took excellent care of us. <br><br>Hubby got El Diablo to drink and he enjoyed it. For dinner, we stuck to our classic favorites. Hubby always loves the Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp and he truly enjoyed it this time as well.<br><br>I got my favorite, Miso Salmon and loved it. I asked Tyler for a little more rice and he happily got it for me. <br><br>For dessert we went with our most favorite, Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake and it was sinfully delicious as always.

Another great meal at the Cheesecake Factory. Dinner was a margherita flatbread and dessert was none the less, CHEESCAKE! I had the s&#39;mores one and it was delicious as per usual!  This restaurant never disappoints and I&#39;m sure I will be back soon!

No complaints about The Cheesecake Factory today. I have been to this location many times. Definitely try to come at off times or else you may have a bit of a wait though I&#39;d imagine all the places at KOP could say the same. The service is generally pretty good here and it was today. You have your standard expansive, overwhelming menu. We started with the Korean Fried Cauliflower which could probably stand alone as a meal on it&#39;s own. I had the (huge) lunch portion of the Sheila&#39;s Chicken and Avocado Salad. The dressing was very light. Prices are reasonable, especially considering portion size. Best chain ever, change my mind.

This is my favorite American restaurant hands down! The portion is large and the food is consistent. I have tried so many items on the menu (which there is A LOT to choose from) and have to say the pasta da Vinci is my all time favorite dish here. Their teriyaki chicken dish is also up there on my list. Of course the cheesecakes are amazing and I would recommend trying as many different flavors as you can. (: The service is also consistently fast. No complaints here!

The food was really good, but the server wasn&#39;t all that friendly. It took her longer than 5 minutes to bring over some ketchup. I had to ask about three times for a straw. It&#39;s a really nice vibe, but definitely a place where you would go if you had a lot of time.

A fun evening with just a few disappointments.  When we arrived, we were seated within 5 minutes and the hostess brought us drinks.  I went with two companions.  We started with stuffed mushrooms that were delicious.  My one companion had the chicken Marsala over bow ties.  He said the flavor was excellent.  It was a plentiful serving with three chicken breasts.  My other companion had the stuffed burger which overflowed with cheddar.  I had the all American burger, with two complaints that cost the review a star.  They insist on putting condiments on the burger rather than the side, which gave me unwanted mayo.  Second, I ordered it medium and it was rare.  I did not expect blood running down my hand.  The cheese cake was awesome.  Our server, Charles, was friendly, professional and quick.

This place has never let me down! The portions are always great and the food is packed with flavor. My go-to dish is the bang-bang chicken and shrimp but this time I got the Thai chicken special and it did not dissapoint. :-) pretty much anything you get here is gonna live up to the hype. <br><br>On top of having an awesome dinner you can always top it off with one of the signature cheesecakes. No matter what you choose it will leave you wanting more. <br><br>Definitely come here and treat yo self to a meal. :-)

The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t my go to restaurant simply because they severely lack in the breadbasket department *take a page out of Longhorns book* and the menu is a headache waiting to happen. But tonight was my kids birthday and he like TCF, so we went! <br><br>1) My Caesar salad had a bite to it, kinda spicy (from what? I have no clue) and tasted like meat was previously in it.. disgusting<br>*the very nice waiter, Tyler? Took it back and the manager comped it! I appreciated that* I was trying to be &#34;healthy&#34; and my fat ass got a messed up salad  should&#39;ve just ordered fries!<br><br>2) The sliders I ordered lacked flavor, so I wouldn&#39;t order them again<br><br>3) My mom and my kid had burgers which they liked. My moms order was wrong she received fries instead of the salad, but I happily ate those and all was well!<br><br>In the end the wait staff came and sang happy birthday to my kid which made him happy and he got a huge piece of Oreo cheesecake which he enjoyed! Thank you TCF staff for taking time to make an 8yr old smile  <br><br>I appreciated the service I received tonight, Tyler? (I hope that&#39;s his name) was very nice and attentive. Resolved my 1 issue quickly, He needs to be working in Fine Dining!! Will I be visiting TCF in the future for anything besides cheesecake and drinks? Probably not but as I stated before, I did like their service!!

Disappointed. Been a long time customer of the Cheesecake Factory, unfortunately my latest experience at the KOP location is BS. It took 15 minutes before the server even approached our table and over 30 minutes to receive the 2 salads we ordered. Oddly enough, the table across from us being waited on by another server (and sat after us) received their meal, dessert and check well before we got our food. And to add salt to the wound, one of our orders arrived incorrectly and it took 10 minutes before we ever saw our server to correct the order. I&#39;m not quite sure what the issue is, server or kitchen, but it will be difficult for me to decide to return.

Sat at bar area because wait was long. 1.45 hour wait!!!<br>Had delicious drinks and phenomenal appetizers. Then we seated.  Small tables. Get to know your neighbor. <br>My husband got a pasta dish that had a huge piece of plastic in his meal. The manager said it was from a bag of cheese. <br>At first he kept saying it was an artichoke piece, finally when he looked at it you could see it was plastic. No asking if they could make him something new. Just an apology and took a % off the bill. <br>Was not thrilled .

Not impressed with the service here at all<br>It was so slow <br>And they were very rude!<br>It took 20 minutes for<br>The server to come<br>To our table and before even asking us for our drink order <br>Or saying hi <br>We got .. are you ready to order food?<br><br>Then 30 min later<br>Food came out and all though half<br>My meal<br>Was fine the other half was so dry and hard ..<br><br>Another thing was the silverware on table<br>Was dirty and I never got a new set <br>Until I got up and got<br>It from another table ...

Horrible, rude, unsmiling store manager- John Miller. I&#39;ve been here about 5 times (45 mins away from home) and each time this place is out of stock on the popular entree &#34; fried Mac and cheese balls&#34;. Is it that hard to upkeep on inventory based on the customers?! Then on top of it, each time this rude manager has nothing to say but &#34;it&#39;s a popular dish&#34;. Really? Absolutely horrible place.. I will be taking this to the corporate. I don&#39;t know how in the world this man can even be in the customer service industry. Pathetic

Huge fan of this restaurant!! The entrees are always really good, but obviously the cheesecake is where it&#39;s at. I can never decide which kind I want and always take a piece home with me for the next day! <br><br>I wish I could remember our server&#39;s name last time we came but we came pretty late and she got stuck with us right when her shift was supposed to end but instead of rushing us or being annoyed about it, she was SO friendly and helpful. So great!

The manager was great for seating 20 of us during the Saturday night rush. Our server was as good as he could have been given the circumstances of a packed restaurant. Friendly, prompt, and a great memory.<br><br>I&#39;ll still never understand restaurants that don&#39;t take reservations. But that&#39;s not part of my review. Just a rant.<br><br>The issue with this restaurant is the back of the house, not the front.<br><br>The Beet and Goat Cheese salad was tasty. I liked it a lot. Thought the dressing a tad too sweet, however.<br><br>I ordered the Crispy Chicken Costoletta and subbed broccoli for the mash and asparagus. Let&#39;s start with the fact that I was deep inside the large booth. So I took the plate from the server so he didn&#39;t need to reach. The bottom of the plate was filthy (I don&#39;t want to think what was under my food). The food cold and tasteless. And the entrées for our two booths came out at completely separate times over 15 minutes. We had three tables and three checks, two different servers. I would have expected each individual table to be served at the same time. Not over 15 minutes start to finish.<br><br>I get it. Large short order restaurant at a mall. Menu way too large for any potential efficiency. Get as many people in and out of the restaurant as quickly as possible to boost head count and revenue. Here&#39;s a thought... Serve 75% of the head count properly with a slimmer menu and great quality to protect your brand and increase your per capita. Or have the back of the house serve everyone that comes coldly with poor quality and boost your short term revenue killing your brand. I know what Cheesecake Factory chose.<br><br>My first experience with Cheesecake Factory was over 20 years ago in the Inner Harbor of Baltimore and great experiences. Since they&#39;ve opened a few in the Philly area, I was a promoter. My last few visits to King of Prussia and Willow Grove leave me avoiding altogether. The only reason I was here was because someone hosted a birthday dinner. I won&#39;t be back unless there&#39;s another occasion planned by someone else.

The Cheesecake Factory always has delicious food and so many different options to choose from, but I almost dislike this since they can&#39;t really focus on 1 or 2 items to perfect. Very nice style and design, good for any occasion, groups and family. <br><br>We got dessert tonight. I got the Linda&#39;s chocolate cake and my buddy got the Reece&#39;s cheesecake. Both very rich but we absolutely loved both. I had mine with a cold glass of whole milk. One of the best chocolate cakes I&#39;ve eaten. <br><br>Not my favorite restaurant and no item is too memorable, but it&#39;s the perfect place to go if you really don&#39;t know what you&#39;re in the mood for. One downfall is the lights a very low which isn&#39;t fantastic with groups and there is no WiFi. If you have anything but Verizon you&#39;ll suffer with no service.

I was trying to order some items online but I have encountered unknown errors on their site multiple times so I was unable to do so. I tried to call to place the order to a person instead and a lady picked up. I told her I would like to order and she put me on hold for around 15 minutes... then another lady picked up and once again asked me the same question. I told her again that I would like to order, then she put me on another hold once again for an extra 10 minutes. I am not sure how they communicate on their end, so wasted 15 minutes waiting earlier for nothing ? While waiting, I tried to place an order online, hopefully it will go through since enough time had been wasted. While I was almost finished, a lady finally picked up. I asked her to please gave me a second as I am almost done filling out the order as there are multiple items and don&#39;t want to repeat my list all over again. She just hung up on me. I have been waiting for almost half an hour and you can&#39;t even wait for a minute or two ? Absolutely terrible ! Order did not go through again, and forget it, I am done with this.

Our server Charles, was great. He gave us ample time to order, made sure our water glasses stayed filled and overall made our experience pleasant. My daughter was disappointed that they no longer have &#34;Fire Cracker Salmon&#34;, we specifically came here for that item.  She ordered the &#34;Tex Mex Egg Rolls,&#34; she said they weren&#39;t very good and they were not hot. My son ordered the &#34;Americana burger&#34; he said it was good but the burger didn&#39;t fit the bun. The bun was two sizes bigger than the patty but overall it was good with the exception of the fries because they were room temperature. The crab bites were delicious and the sauce was perfect. The fried  macaroni and cheese was good, nothing exceptional, they were the only item that came out HOT! I  used to like the food but for a $90.00+ bill, I won&#39;t be back for a meal again.  Cheesecake Factory has the best cheesecake and a large variety, if I could give 5 stars for cheesecake and 1 star for food, that would be an accurate assessment of my latest visit to The Cheesecake Factory.

Hey guys....Would you PLEASE extend your deadline for using Slice of Joy coupons??!! I was just at CF in KofP Friday trying to redeem my TWO coupons and was told they could not.   Terry, the manager I spoke with, was very nice and took the time to discuss and explain the situation to me, and explained he did not have the ability to override the exp date.   He Explained it to me they had already extended and the deadline by 90 days, however, I live over an hour away from my closest CF, and in the state of Pennsylvania we were closed down until June 26, leaving me a total of four days to get there.  Terry explained to me that they were open all during that time for takeout, however, I explained to him I was not going to order takeout when I lived over an hour away and our governor told us to stay home and especially not go in the hot spots of which that region was one of them.   So now I&#39;m sitting here with two unused slice of joy coupons.  I am sure I am not the only person in the situation. Please consider extending the deadline on these so that we may use our coupons - it&#39;s only fair-not all of us live a short distance away from a CF.

Good: server and manager was nice, cheesecake is good<br><br>Bad: <br>Food is high in calories <br>Long weight times<br>I told the waiter and the person that dropped off my food that I&#39;m a vegetarian multiple times and I had little chopped up pieces of chicken in my salad and realized after I ate almost half of it<br><br>If you have a dietary restriction or a food allergy skip this place, they don&#39;t take instructions well

Great service from Kyle and Kevin! Kyle started out with us he was attentive w a great sense of humor then his station was moved and Kevin introduced himself to us. Another bangin meal at The Cheesecake Factory! I&#39;m so hooked on that miso salmon, my friend ordered the grilled salmon! Both prepared expertly- succulent and juicy with the perfect flavor. Choc chip cookie dough cheesecake for me and vanilla bean for my friend. My friends cheesecake I thought would be kind of plain. Wrong wrong wrong! It had oodles of crushed vanilla beans throughout. It looked amazing. So amazing in fact I brought a piece home with the hopes that my family would give me a taste!

Hello everyone, <br><br>This is me the local Cheesecake Factory consumer. I have my masters in educational leadership, but that has nothing to do with cheesecake. I found myself at this establishment on a Sunday with the clock saying 6:15. Gang, let me tell you it was PACKED. I&#39;m not sure if this jawn takes reservations or not but most people did not have one. Men, women, and at least 2 children were willing to sit on dirty floors to wait for food. Personally, I went in to get take out cheesecake. It took 30 minutes to get me one piece of vanilla bean cheesecake from behind the counter. As my friend was waiting for his keylime I devoured mine. As I am writing this review my stomach hurts. 3 stars

Had a very early Sunday brunch with usual options on their lunch menu. Since I did not specify I wanted the &#39;lunch portion&#39; (even at 11 AM) I was served a full dinner size which is $4 up-charge. Huh?! <br>I guess next time I will need to ask for a LUNCH portion from their LUNCH menu during LUNCH hours.

Had lunch there today. <br><br>Waitress was super nice and very attentive to us. <br><br>Dining room seemed cleaner. The wood and tables still look beat! <br><br>The 17 years is really showing now. <br><br>-----<br><br>This is an update. Still fun. Still packed <br><br>However <br><br>Finishes are getting old and worn. Tables are chipped and pealing. The marble is rough. The bathrooms (men&#39;s at least) smell like bus stops. <br><br>Walls in the dining area are filthy and need attention. <br><br>Overhaul time.

Okay here&#39;s the deal.  Like others I don&#39;t like reading very long reviews so I&#39;ll get to the point.  Took my father there for his birthday.  Like others I heard great things about this place.  So I decided to give it a try.  I was not impress. Appetizers were good. Fried macaroni cheese balls and mini fried chicken sandwiches was good. <br><br>Waitress we had was okay.... The place was packed and I understand she can&#39;t give us all attention. She did okay I thought.. But not enough for a big tip.  <br><br>Main course I had. Chicken fettuccine....which was very tasteless and water. NASTY... NASTY.... NASTY.... had like 5-6 pieces of small chicken. I mean tiny pieces of chicken.. All for $19...SERIOUSLY.. A RIPOFF. Worst I ever had... Should of complained and got a refund. At least outback steakhouse gives you alot and lots of chicken. This one was sad. Again... Who&#39;s the cook..I posted pics. Didn&#39;t enjoy it at all.<br><br>My father really didn&#39;t enjoy his meal. He had shrimp pasta. Told me to taste it. It did seem kind of undercooked. No seasoning at all on either dishes.  It was his birthday so I didn&#39;t raise hell.  But again,  chicken pasta  shouldn&#39;t be watery.  For the price it could of been more on them big horse plates they serve you on.<br><br>The bread was hard and not hot.  Um!  Nothing like nice hot bread.... Guess they forgot.<br>Almost like bringing out water with no ice or bringing out a slice of carrot cake with no icing on top.  <br><br>Cheese cake factory in my opinion gets a 2 stars out of 5. I just wasn&#39;t impress. Maybe we could of pick something different and I would of had a better review. Next time I want watery pasta... I&#39;ll stay home make my own.... And add water.  <br><br>After we left my father said..... He didn&#39;t feel that warmth welcome feeling as we do at outback. I felt the same way. Meaning at outback there&#39;s people at the door greeting you and the manager sometimes come over  and talk to you. Here it&#39;s more like  come in, sit down, order, eat and get out. Probably won&#39;t be back. Oh!  And order hot wings to go.... Nasty... Wings ever....... For the price I paid.... I could of went to Popeye&#39;s and got a box of chicken.<br><br>Worst birthday dinner day ever for my dad.... Should of stuck with my plan  and went to a all you can eat buffet.  Oh yeah.... the cheesecake is okay..... Nothing special. This is all my opinion. Watch what you order is all I&#39;m going to say.... And good luck. Last I ordered a cheese cake to take home because I had a gift card.  So when walking with the bag through the restaurant to leave out .... I notice people that worked there watching me like I stoled it. Eyeing me like I was shop lifting. Nasty food and racial profiling. At least food could of been good.<br>Again, what&#39;s the hype about this place again..... Believe the low reviews.... People don&#39;t lie.<br><br>Last....... Menu full of food.... But no pictures.... Manager here&#39;s an idea. Get small table computers that shows the whole menu.. With pictures... so people can see what they like and want to pick. Simple..... You can&#39;t go into McDonald&#39;s and order a Big Mac with out knowing what it looks like can you???  How you think people feel when they come to The Cheese cake  Factory. It&#39;s 2018 for goodness sake.

Chain restaurants are what they are, there&#39;s fair, good &amp; great. Can&#39;t remember the last time I gave a chain restaurant five stars, it&#39;s hard to get that. I&#39;ve been to this location twice dining in, 2 &amp; 3 years ago. Today it was delivery, which was just ok, fair. I had the spicy Caesar salad, shrimp Alfredo &amp; strawberry cheesecake. You can&#39;t really mess up a caesar, the romaine was fresh, they skimped on the croutons, no parm, dressing wasn&#39;t spicy but it was still good, I added red onions and salt &amp; pepper. The Alfredo was very bland, I added garlic salt when I got home &amp; it was much better. The Cheesecake Factory is great at cheesecake, the strawberry was delicious, the recipe is consistent as hell, many locations in different states and it&#39;s always great. While they have a vast menu, the food is just overall ok with a few standouts.

We only came here specifically for cheesecake. Three slices will cost you between $20 and $25  depending what you get. I ordered plain, chocolate cherry and birthday cake and all were served with whipped cream. Cheesecake was really good but I wasn&#39;t super impressed. Could find equally as delicious cheesecake cheaper...
Great food and good cheesecake. I had the stuffed cheddar burger which was super juicy. My kids had zero complaints about their meals including my daughter who is super picky.

Came in for lunch today and our server Diana was nice and attentive. We sat at a high top that was clean and properly distanced from other tables, the front, and bar! <br>The hostess outside of the main entrance was very nice and told me to go inside and someone would get me sat. I stood there in front of an empty desk for a little less than 10 minutes while a hostess was walking around and had been by the desk at least 3 times without acknowledging me. She didn&#39;t greet me or tell me someone would be right over to help me so I just stood there and waited and waited. Finally another hostess came over to get me sat. I told her I was still waiting for my friend and asked if I could wait for her but she told me with a bit of attitude that I would be seated right by the door anyways. She was probably tired after a long shift and knowing how large the restaurant is and how busy they usually are, I understand. Another guest may have not. <br>Food was fine, a manager ran my and my friends food over and he was very nice. Hope they figure out the seating process so it is more efficient and friendly for others.

Slow service and average food. It took 25 minutes for the guest check, and my guest and I were given wrong checks. I did not see a manager to ask for help. When I called after leaving and requested to speak witha manager, no one came on the phone after 4 minutes. Server didn&#39;t refill drinks and was 10 minutes behind what was requested the entire visit.

I guess certain foods are just not for take out.  The spinach mushroom pizza was great but the avocado toast was on the wrong type of bread and the avocado was not fresh at all.  Changed to 3 stars. The manager replaced the avocado toast with another appetizer.  It was ok better than what I had yesterday

Have been here for lunch several times in the last few months. We always order off the skinnylicious menu which features under 490 calorie entrees. I have enjoyed the turkey and avocado sandwich as well as the chicken salad sandwich previously. This time I enjoyed the Asian chicken lettuce wrap tacos. Also available as Mexican. We each got three butter lettuce leaf tacos with two dipping sauces and stuffed with <br>Grilled Chicken, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Cucumber, Cilantro and Rice Noodles with Spicy Cashew Sauce. A messy meal but definitely delicious!

3 take out orders in a row that have been significantly messed up. When I spoke to the manager the last 2 times he admitted the kitchen staff isn&#39;t reading tickets correctly. Sad to say that we have had numerous issues at this location with take out over the years and they flat out do not care at all about making it right. General managers are rude and dismissive- we are officially done with this location.

Wait is horrific here but they get you in and get you out after seating.  Food was good.  We had the lettuces wraps which were awesome.  The turkey burger was just ok and they ran out of chicken Mediterranean. My son likes the kids salmon.

We come here a lot, The cheesecake was great. The service is OK. Had a bad experience when we came in, but the manager Faith was awesome. She made sure we were taken care of right away and got stuff done herself. Food establishments need managers like her.

Had a pretty decent dinner here tonight! My boyfriend really enjoyed his bacon-bacon cheeseburger and I had the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic pasta. It was pretty good, but didn&#39;t have much prosciutto in it, which is debatably the best part. Our server, Melissa, was very nice and attentive. The Godiva chocolate cheesecake was amazing too, very mousse-y.
Need a quick place for last minute brunch? This is the place. It&#39;s always crowded no matter what time of the day or week it is but the food is always worth it

The Cheesecake Factory is probably one of my favorite big chain restaurants. Their menu is huge, as are the portions. I ordered the shrimp and chicken gumbo with brown rice and it was delicious! The chicken was extremely tender--like it had been sous vided--and the gumbo had a wonderful depth of flavor. Our server, Kayla, was also fantastic. My only gripe is the size of our cheesecake, which I had it packed to go. Both me and my boyfriend&#39;s slices were tiny- it was almost as if a normal slice had been cut in half. The table adjacent to us had ordered cheesecake and their slices were huge compared to ours. Not sure if this issue is consistent with those who get cheesecake to go, but if that&#39;s the case, I would rather dine in to eat my cheesecake and pay an additional $1-2 tip for almost twice the size.

My wife and I went last night and were extremely pleased.  We were shown to our seat promptly and greeted by an awesome server.  She was very pleasant, attentive and answered all of our questions.  Throughout the meal, she was very good at checking up on us and making sure we had everything that we needed.  The kitchen did a great job as well.  The eggroll sampler was packed with deliciousness and great dipping sauces.  My wife&#39;s Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi was delicious and cooked perfectly.  My Hibachi Steak was also incredible and cooked perfectly.  Our cheesecakes were amazing (can I have the recipe especially for the Very Cherry Ghirardelli one?).  Also kudos to the bar staff who wait a fantastic strawberry drink for my wife and the Guava Daquiri that I had was both creative and scrumptious.  All around great job and we can&#39;t wait to come back!

We came on a Sunday afternoon. It was about a 30 minute wait for our party of 6 which wasn&#39;t bad as the restaurant is in the mall. Our drinks take a lil longer than expected but our server seemed the be in the weeds so we just munched on bread until they came. I ordered the chicken and shrimp gumbo. I was a little worried because the chef decorated my plate with parsley however it was phenomenal. I would definitely recommend you visit the Cheesecake Factory.

Ordered cheesecake from the Togo station today arrived at 3:50 and did not receive my single slice of cheese cake until 4:28 after I made a request for it when people after me got theirs first. Got to the car no fork- ate it with my hands. Love the cheesecake, but not so much to go through the hassle

I know people love to bash on Cheesecake Factory, but I like the food here. The service is expected for a chain restaurant; it isn&#39;t always the best. It&#39;s usually slow and clumsy. The menu is extensive, probably too extensive. But since there are so many things to choose from, you&#39;re bound to find something for everyone. The plates are large and filling. And the breads are the best. Oh, and you can&#39;t leave without a slice of cheesecake of course!<br><br>However, if you&#39;re coming here on a weekend after a long day of shopping, expect a long wait. The longest I&#39;ve waited was over an hour. They do not take reservations. It&#39;s already hectic enough. Incorporating reservations would probably be more of a disaster for them honestly. For me, the wait is very expected. I just take my beeper and and wait outside on the floor with whomever I came to the mall with.
There was a piece of very sharp metal in my fettuccine Alfredo...it looks like a staple or piece of steel wool, very dangerous and unsanitary.

I wish there were an option for 0 stars...I am extremely disappointed with the service I received today. <br><br>Yesterday I put in an order through the Cheesecake Factory website, and I scheduled delivery for today between 12:30 and 1:00 at my office. This lunch was for a meeting, and our order was fairly large. I was worried about putting through such a large order through an online process (Door Dash), so I called the Cheesecake Factory to see if I could place the order online. The girl that I spoke with stated that she did not know how to do that and transferred me to the Bakery. After waiting on the phone for 15 minutes and no response, I decided to trust the online service and hung up. <br><br>This morning I called again to see if the delivery order was processed through the online site. I spoke with a different girl, and she was just as clueless. She said that if the order had a time on it that we would receive it. I again stated that I would just like to confirm. She transferred me to the Bakery, and I sat on the phone for another 15-20 minutes with no response.<br><br>At around 12:30, I received a call from our Door Dash driver. He said that he showed up at The Cheesecake Factory, and they did not have our order ready. They stated that they had no record of our order. The Door Dash driver said that he was having them work on it so that he can deliver soon.<br><br>After speaking with the driver, I called The Cheesecake Factory again to see if I could speak with a Manager and see what happened with our order. I was transferred to the Manager, who continued to explain that they just did not have our order. No further explanation...no solution...Basically just a &#34;whoops, sorry!&#34; He also stated that they still didn&#39;t have our order made. When I asked what the Door Dash driver was talking about then, he said he was not sure because they just don&#39;t have our order. He told me that Door Dash is completely separate from The Cheesecake Factory???? I then questioned why it is on their website and asked who was getting the money for our order. He explained that Door Dash gets all money from every delivery order coming out of The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I called the Door Dash driver back to see what he was delivering since the manager had no record of our order, and he said that the restaurant was extremely unorganized, and no one seemed to know anything. The driver ended up putting through the order in the Bakery, and apparently the Manager was not aware that he was back there doing that. <br><br>At around 1:45, our delivery driver showed up with the order. You would think that the plus side would be that the order was hot and fresh since it was just made and is literally 5 minutes from my office. Unfortunately it was cold, and everything was poorly prepared and thrown in boxes carelessly. To top it all off, the meatballs were not cooked- see picture.

I ordered food to be delivered I called in my order at around 12:30 PM. I realized that I had a gift card but the order was already placed mind you my order was not scheduled to be delivered to my home until 5 o&#39;clock I immediately contacted door Dash who stated that they contacted cheesecake factory and was told that I would not be able to cancel my order. Instead I could use my gift card on my next purchase. Needless to say there will be no next order my biggest issue is how they told door dash that they had already prepared my food so they couldn&#39;t cancel the order how did you prepare my food at 12 something but the delivery is not scheduled until 5 o&#39;clock. This is so unacceptable and cheesecake factory doesn&#39;t have to worry again because I will not be coming to this restaurant at all

It was my birthday dinner and I wanted cheesecake!! Saturday nights are really busy so it&#39;s good to show up an hour earlier than you would expect to eat so you can get on the list. It may have also been busy since it&#39;s the holiday season and the establishment is in the mall. It took about 50 min or so to get seated so we checked out a couple stores nearby for Christmas shopping in the meantime. Make sure you stay nearby since the buzzer doesn&#39;t have a very long range. I ordered the breaded chicken with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The chicken was cooked throughly and wasn&#39;t too greasy. The vegetables were nicely prepared as well. I was plenty full after the dinner so I decided to just purchase my cheesecake (Factory brand) from Costco instead. It&#39;s so pricey in the restaurant as you can get a whole cake for the price of two in the restaurant. I probably won&#39;t be back since the food wasn&#39;t super special.

We came here for my birthday and it was a good experience overall. The prices are a little high for the amount of food you get. Drinks are expensive. I would expect a small salad with the meal, for the price you pay. The salmon was only ok. I wouldn&#39;t get it again. The shrimp scampi was absolutely delicious! Appetizers were good too. The staff were very friendly and efficient. Who I think was one of the managers went above and beyond helping serve us.

I never have bad things to say about restaurants, as I&#39;ve worked in customer service before and I love this restaurant, but my experience last night was terrible. My friend and I got seated and ordered our food right away, only 2 dinners no apps.<br><br>A little over an hour and 2 bread baskets later a different waitress came to our table and said the kitchen lost a bunch of tickets so she needed our order again. We gave her our order again and ended up waiting another 30 minutes or so for the food to come. When the food came nothing was said to us, it was just dropped off at the table. We finished eating and waited again, for another 15-20 minutes for the waiter so we could ask for the check. At this point, we were 1 of 2 tables left in the entire section as larger tables seated after us ate and already left. When we got the bill, again nothing was said to us about the wait or the &#34;lost tickets&#34; and the waiter walked by 2 or 3 times to see if we had the bill ready (which was impressive considering we barely saw him the entire time we sat there). We just paid and left.<br><br>I&#39;ve had mistakes like this happen at restaurants before and you are at least given an apology for it. No one said or did anything while our meal took over 2 hours as we watched larger tables around us get apps, dinner and dessert.

We arrived just before the dinner crowd and were seated immediately. I ordered the California cheese steak with peppers, onions, and mushrooms on a toasted roll. Instead of fries I ordered the Caesar salad. The food was very good. Definitely worth a return visit in the near future.

Used to be a favorite, now it&#39;s just a relic of suburban debt. Still they do a good job in their own way. Lot,s of good choices from the massive menu. Cheesecake is actually as good as they claim! Corporate food at it&#39;s almost finest. Also run the nearby LUX CAFE which takes the menu up a notch. <br><br>Very busy on weekends. The same place everywhere in the U.S.A $90,000 median incomes are found.

I was just left on hold for more then 10 minutes to place a to go order,  extremely dissapointed, Iv called back twice and left on hold both times. Probably won&#39;t ever try to order to go again, service is usually better when dining in.

We really love the Cheesecake Factory and I hate having to write a bad review but this bad experience has prompted this post. First I went in to get a slice of cheesecake. Cheesecakes that were supposed to be refrigerated were not in the case. This should have alerted me. I ordered a piece of the celebration cheesecake which I&#39;ve had before at the Newark location without any problems as it tasted fresh and cold like a good cheesecake should. This one wasn&#39;t but I&#39;ll get to that. For starters, the crew was poorly organized, I had to wait over 10 minutes and my cake was on the counter for at least 4-5 minutes before the bakery assistant sloppily handed it over because she was having a conversation with a male employee who looked like a manager or supervisor. I finally got my cheesecake with the fork being tossed in the bag. Service was lackluster at best at that moment. It gets worse. <br><br>Then I tried it. Gross doesn&#39;t even begin to describe. We had eaten at the Newark location earlier without any issues this morning ($54 check). Service was exemplary. But here at KOP while we were running errands, grabbing a dessert was a nightmare with pisspoor service. So back to the cheesecake. The cake was warm and actually tasted not fully done or under-baked. It did not taste fresh at all. <br><br>My husband offered to take it back because I was taking care of our newborn outside and he came out saying the bakery manager Scott was rude and wouldn&#39;t return it claiming we ate half, which we didn&#39;t. He repeated himself 3 times unnecessarily, questioned my husband&#39;s character/integrity and showed no consideration or even listened as to what the problem was. <br><br>I mean seriously? You would think as a bakery manager that you would care about food not being up to par and care about the customer experience??? So thanks Scott for being the reason we will never eat there again. You really should learn better management and baking techniques. The least you could have done would have been to investigate the issue or treated your loyal patrons with respect and dignity. <br><br>Patrons don&#39;t eat the celebration cake today 10/13, there is something wrong with it.

I have never been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I will say that the cheesecake is excellent. As it should be from the name. The portions are nice and there are many flavors and varieties. A tad expensive but totally worth it. <br><br>The restaurant is usually pretty clean as well so that is a plus for places that are so crowded. <br><br>The wait is routinely 1 hour plus. <br>In my opinion not worth it. <br><br>The food is marginal at best. How can it be better when the menu is so huge. That usually means that nothing can be made<br>From scratch. <br><br>I find the prices high and the food salty.

Update: I received an apology letter and a gift card from #thecheesecakefactory . In the letter not only did the general manager apologize, he asked me to please stop by and see him.<br><br>So disappointed with my visit today. My husband and I were traveling and stopped there for dinner on our way home. We were starving! We ordered our food, it took 25 minutes to come out. My food was cold, like out of the refrigerator and my husband&#39;s was warm, not hot. The waiter(not ours) took my food back and 1min later returned with another plate, still cold. I complained to the manager, I said I didn&#39;t want to send it back again because I was concerned what someone might do to it. He then proceeded to take my food away and walk away! <br>He left me with nothing. The waiter said &#34;he took the meal off the bill&#34;! I am stunned and outraged. I told the manager and asked the waiter for a box, I would just hear it up at home. I wasn&#39;t looking for the meal to be comped, I just wanted them to know how bad the kitchenI was so hungry, I didn&#39;t eat all day. No question if that&#39;s what I wanted, or did we want to order (and pay) for dessert!<br>I will never go there again.
the cheesecake factory is a good restaurant.<br>with good price and good food.<br>I really like cheesecake factory.

We came here on Fri for their happy hour and had a great time.  We sat in the bar area on high tops.  It&#39;s self seating and luckily at 6pm there was no wait.  The happy hour is 4-6pm Mon- Fridays.<br><br>It&#39;s 5.99 per appetizers.  They are full size portions which makes it a good value.  My favorite is the chicken buffalo blasts, Tex mex egg rolls.  The curry cauliflower is also soo yummie.  Very interesting flavors and dipping sauce is two thumbs up.  The burger on happy hour is a double patty and cooked very nicely- juicy.<br><br>The drinks are also discounted.  Mojito is my absolute favorite.  So light and fresh.<br><br>The service is on point as usual.  Would definitely come back again.

Had a great meal here tonight with my best friend. Our meal:<br>Complimentary WARM bread: amazing, I love the dark brown bread which tastes like pumpernickel, it&#39;s served with a sweet butter.<br><br>Arnold palmers: my go to drink which I order almost every time I&#39;m out and let me tell you theirs is down to a science. The rim is lined with sugar and has the perfect consistency of half unsweetened tea and lemonade. Seriously my all time favorite.<br><br>Passion fruit mojitos: order these. Served in a tall glass, on your first sip it really tastes like passion fruit nectar, rum, lime, and mint-- which is my kind of mojito. I loved the tall sprig of mint in it.<br><br>Red sangria: this tasted like a true sangria. Nice red wine with hints of brandy. Apples and oranges which tasted like they had been soaking all day.<br><br>Spinach and artichoke dip: served nice and warm and sprinkled with Parmesan cheese. I just wish they served the dip with pita bread instead of chips <br><br>Roadside sliders- another all time favorite. I usually order these as a meal with a side of sweet potato fries but on this occasion, we ordered to split. The sliders taste like old school drive-in burgers [similar to Charlie&#39;s in Delco :) ] <br>4 mini burgers in total which are served with ketchup, diced onion, lettuce, and pickle. They are simply delicious and I suggest ordering them with cheese :)<br><br>Bistro Shrimp Pasta- Delicious as well. Fried shrimp tossed with spaghetti and arugula in what tasted like a creamy garlic-pesto sauce. I only wished that the there was a bit more sauce to the pasta.<br><br>We also ordered 3 cheesecakes:<br>The original with 3 large glazed strawberries- a classic<br>White chocolate raspberry- my ultimate favorite<br>Toasted marshmallow s&#39;mores: my friend ordered and it was to die for.<br><br>All in all, a great meal. For what we paid, our waitress seemed a bit to eager for us to be done our meal and I wish it didn&#39;t take as long for our drinks and appetizers to be served, because shortly  after, our meals arrived. The drinks and meals are a bit pricey but the justification in my opinion is they are larger than most and I love taking home left overs :)

Ahhh this place is extremely busy in the evenings. Just ordering once slice of cheese cake to go took over 30 mins. This was our first time at a Cheese cake factory location in PA, normally I go to the one in Michigan...but something was different. I always get the Godiva cheesecake, this time the presentation wasn&#39;t as nice and the cake tasted like it was frozen, defrosted, frozen and then defrosted again. It&#39;s weird to explain. It just didn&#39;t taste as fresh as I am used to.

Fresh Vegetable Salad, Skinnylicious . It had asparagus, green beans,tomatoes, cucumbers, roasted beets, apple, edamame, radicchio, romaine and white cheddar, all chopped.  The difference between the regular and Skinnylicious is the dressing   I love this salad and the skinny dressing is good.  Plus I love the dark bread. This is a good healthy salad

I called to book a reservation for 18 people and they told me they don&#39;t take reservations.  They also told me they really aren&#39;t set up for groups that large.  Find a place that wants your business.

Another awful experience!!  Way to go Management, cooks, servers; you surely know how to ruin your customers evening!!  Shame on you all!!! <br><br>What a terrible terrible terrible experience.  The food was not cooked correctly; main dishes came out in intervals of 20 minutes apart, so we basically watch each other eat.  The management does not care at all.  Never even stopped by to apologize.  Stay very very far away from the Cheesecake Factory in KOP.  They do not care about their patrons or the terrible experience they deliver.  Goes to show you where their mindset is these days.  AWFUL!!!!

So good as usual . Everyone was happy with their meal and appetizers. Wish they would bring back the steak in the factory burrito. They only have chicken , just not my choice . But everything else was great .
Horrible! Wait 15 minutes at the table for the waiter then my cheese on my burger was cold

My partner and i ordered rasberry lemonade&amp;coke, fried calamari as an appetizer, chicken parmesan pizza style and pork chop. Portion of the chicken parmesan pizza style was so huge. I couldn&#39;t finish. It was good, i wish i didnt order appetizer, then i prob could have eaten all of my entre. Service was nice as well

Went last night and got there right around 5.  It was already busy, but we were seated immediately and our server, Devin, was at our table immediately.  That&#39;s great because this location gets packed on Friday nights (it&#39;s often packed) and the wait times can be ridiculous.  (Service was top notch...kudos to Devin)<br><br>I&#39;ve been to TCF many times and am familiar with the menu, but I&#39;m on a clean eating program, so I visited the website earlier in the day and pre-selected my meal (yes, I still ordered cheesecake, though...lol).<br><br>I ordered the Wellness Salad because the ingredients are foods on my favorites list. This salad, however, will not be on my favorites list and I was so disappointed that I asked Devin to bring me a to-go box and immediately stashed most of the salad to take home and fix.<br><br>Here&#39;s a link to the website&#39;s recipe for the salad:  <a href="/redir?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.thecheesecakefactory.com%2Fabout-us%2Four-recipes%2Fwellness-salad%2F&amp;s=ae4dfc7da85d3679279ff28dc1a6c1fe5ebf1fe5de7e5a8b751f746e8c83409e" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.com…</a><br><br>Here&#39;s what went wrong:<br><br>1)  The broccoli was overcooked, mushy, and bitter (I love broccoli, so this was disappointing).  It had lost all of its bright green color and smelled bad.<br>2)  They used wild blueberries which don&#39;t hold up well in a salad like this only because they are so small and are lost when up against kale.  There were enough; they were just overpowered by strong kale.<br>3)  Soaking the onions drastically mutes their flavor.  A little muting is fine, but I couldn&#39;t taste them until I dug through, found a piece (really small), and tasted it.  Barely oniony and could have been left out completely without notice.<br>4)  Couldn&#39;t find the spinach.  There were so few leaves, I could have counted them.<br>5)  No arugula at all.  Looks like they substituted radicchio which couldn&#39;t stand up to the kale.<br>6)  The other ingredients seemed lost.<br>7)  The kale smelled and tasted a little old, a little too bitter.<br><br>The problem with the salad they served last night was balance.  The large pieces of kale (they were much larger than bite-sized and had to be cut down to be manageable) just overpowered this salad.  I eat kale every day, love it, and can tell when it&#39;s too much.  This was just too much.<br><br>Maybe this was an off day.  I&#39;ll give them the benefit of the doubt, which is why they&#39;re getting 3 stars.  The concept of the salad was good, but the execution was way off.<br><br>Next time, KoP, follow the recipe on your website and take better care to balance the ingredients.

cheesecake factory is pretty staples, as it comes to food. you know what you&#39;re getting, and its pretty consistent.<br><br>i&#39;ve marked this review as 2 stars (Meh. I&#39;ve experienced better) because its exactly just that - i had a snappy waitress who was rude during their brunch session. the place wasn&#39;t that packed, yet she was very sluggish to our table, and she scoffed. i know this doesn&#39;t always speak to measures about the integrity of all cheesecake factory staff, but this individual compelled me to mention her. when i complained that my eggs bene&#39;s eggs weren&#39;t soft boiled, she said thats how they were supposed to be. well, alright then...

My family ate at The Cheesecake Factory a few days ago, we always eat here when we get to King of Prussia which is only once a year. We had to wait 40 minutes but that&#39;s not a huge surprise. We ordered the pork belly sliders and corn tamales for appetizers, the pork belly sliders were awesome, absolutely wonderful. This is where the good review stops!, the tamales although decent flavor have shrunk drastically from the last time we were there. For entrees my daughter and I both got the almond crusted salmon salad, #1 the salmon was this teensy tiny piece that looked like a crouton on the salad versus a piece of fish plus #2 the fish was so dried out it tasted like salmon jerky. My son got the Cuban which he said was just ok. My husband ordered the chicken fettuccine alfredo and thought it was disgusting and zero flavor. It looked like a blah dish just noodles and boiled chicken on a plate with no pizazz whatsoever, my daughter tried the alfredo and said the frozen Lean Cuisine alfredo she eats is so much better. Overall not worth $160 for lunch, won&#39;t be back anytime soon.

We have been coming here for years and honestly, there&#39;s only been one time where we ordered guac and it was unpleasantly salty. Other than that, I&#39;ve never had a bad meal! The portions are huge. The flavor is always on point. Everything is delicious, always! Don&#39;t even get me started on the Cheesecake!!!! Mmmmmm! We usually take it to go. Their green tea is very good! They have my favorite Riesling! Some recommendations: nachos, sweet corn tamale cakes, avocado eggrolls, Louisiana chicken pasta, skinnylicious chicken tacos, burrito, salmon. All delish! <br><br>The service is hit or miss. There is a range from excellent and attentive servers to awkward and just ok servers. This is going to happen anywhere. There is always a presence of management. Always. <br><br>The downside: It is always ridiculously crowded and they do not accept reservations which is annoying. We have waited up to 2.5 hours to dine here. We expect this on a Saturday so we go knowing it will be that long and we plan to walk around the mall. This is where my biggest frustration is. They used to have a system where they would text when your table was ready which was great because we could walk all the way to the opposite side of the mall and spend our time wisely... shopping! Working up an appetite! They went back to the nasty, germ infested buzzers that don&#39;t allow you to go past DSW. I don&#39;t appreciate being held captive or else risk losing my table. I also find it disrespectful that there is not adequate seating for a 2.5 hour wait so people are sitting and laying on the floor like dogs. So you have to wait in a confined area for 2+ hours but there&#39;s nowhere for that volume of people to wait. It makes no sense. For me, this system needs to be improved. <br><br>The one other con is they need to pump up the air, even in the winter. It gets SO crowded in there that when you walk in it is super hot and there&#39;s a cacophony of smells. It feels like I&#39;m in a Petri dish. It makes me nauseous. <br><br>Overall, we love it here! I&#39;m surprised their rating isn&#39;t higher.

I haven&#39;t been to a Cheesecake Factory in years, but not a whole lot as changed. Big oversized menu with big oversized portions served on big oversized plates. Food was decent here though. Iced tea (unsweetened) was better than expected.<br><br>Service was friendly, but not all that fast.

Dine in: good food, decent service.<br>Take out: total $#!T-show. It took 45 minutes just to make it from the front door to the take out counter which only had one register for both ordering AND pickup. Most disorganized service I&#39;ve ever seen. <br>Overall: a huge menu that is equal parts exciting and overwhelming, food is good but overpriced, cheesecake is delicious, but not worth the headache.

This used to be one of our favorite restaurants. It took forever to get our food. They didn&#39;t have several of the appetizers and cheesecakes that we wanted. I always get the chopped salad. It used to be sooo good. This time it came out and there was barely anything on it but lettuce. It was completely missing the chicken, I only had a couple bites with either avocado or blue cheese in it and I had even asked for extra blue cheese. They seem to really have cut back on what they put in the salad. It is mostly just lettuce. Very disappointing

The lunch and dinner menu is probably the same, it&#39;s way too big for me, but the kids love it. I still struggle to find something aside from dessert that&#39;s going to bring me back, but hey it is called the Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>They do have a nice bar with some good drinks.

I was in here earlier this week with my 4 year old son for a late lunch/early dinner. The atmosphere is nice, as well as the presentation of food. The menu is extensive! I felt like I could&#39;ve spent an hour reading it all haha<br><br>I particularly liked that the kids menu had quite a few choices, including salmon and veggies. However, my son opted for pizza that day and devoured it! He was on a carb kick that day for sure because he also enjoyed the bread. He&#39;s usually quite the salmon connoisseur. <br><br>I had the snack plate of chicken taquitos, which were delicious, and a side Caesar salad that I enjoyed as well. <br><br>The reason I took a star off is because our server rarely came to the table. I wasn&#39;t offered a refill until I requested the check. After reading through the other reviews for this location that seems pretty common and is something management should consider addressing.<br><br>We will return!

Initially I was going to give this place a 3 based on my previous experiences - HOWEVER I came here for the first time in a year or so and they really improved!! Service is super attentive and food comes out pretty fast!<br><br>We got the summer rolls to share- it&#39;s a different take if you were expecting Viet summer rolls.  Lots of noodles inside-I thought it still tasted pretty good- comes with two sauces. <br><br>I got the lunch portion for the chicken carbonara. I usually get the same dish no matter which cheesecake factory location I&#39;m at it. It is pretty consistent and this was no different.<br><br>Overall I had a very pleasant experience coming here for lunch!! Would recommend coming here- I believe the dinner portions are a lot bigger- be warned.

Ordered two slices of cheesecake from the to go counter and waited 30 minutes until we got them. It was only after a manager was called that they finally did anything. The cheesecakes had been just sitting on the counter in front of us piling up not being handed out for 30 minutes! Very unorganized and disappointing. A better system needs to be put in place.

This was literally the most insane experience I&#39;ve EVER had. This location was literally out of everything and didn&#39;t notify customers after we waited an hour and a half! The wait was originally 45 minutes then they made us wait another 45. When it was up for us to sit, another host took another party and gave them our table. Our host told us someone took our table and then we had to wait in the middle of the place scrambling for seats. Then, we sit, it took forever to get WATER. Or bread! We finally got our order taken and our server had the biggest attitude. She then told us they were out of endless appetizers, including the buffalo blasts, which I came for. We then proceeded to order bread, and they told us they were out of BUTTER. BUTTER!!!!! How the hell were you guys cooking things with no butter!? Then the table next to us were served butter. We asked their server and he talked to us rudely and gave us an attitude. Not sure if there&#39;s a racial issue here but it did so happen that we were neglected the entire night as two black men and two black women. All other tables around us got their butter, bread, waters on time, and everything. And yes those tables were all white people. It&#39;s a shame. we were just trying to enjoy ourselves and get a quick drink and appetizer and it turned into this whole ordeal. We felt so uncomfortable and not welcome and as an establishment in which we frequently go, I was highly disappointed along with the rest of my party. Will be awhile before going back and will never go back to this location ever. Will definitely be asking for some sort of refund or something because the entirety of this experience was completely ridiculous.
Food was ok with larger than average portion size.  Service was excellent. <br>Margaritas a bit over priced!!!<br>Minus two stars for the noise level.

The last few times I&#39;ve came here the restaurant is pretty dirty. The woodwork needs a scrubbing. Every time lately when I sat in a booth theirs been many crumbs on the seats, tables and inside the menu. The silverware and small plates had stains and crumbs on it. The floors had crumbs as well. It feels difficult to eat here anymore. Although the food is still and always delicious, which is why I&#39;m giving this experience three out of five stars. I give the cleanliness 0 stars.
Disappointing.  I ordered the turkey club that came with a small side salad.  The sandwich looked way better than it tasted.  I ended up tossing the whole thing.

A group of 10 of my family wanted  to celebrate my sisters 75th birthday here yesterday since it&#39;s her favorite lunch spot &amp; has lunch there weekly with her friends. I called several times to try to reserve a table only to be given the same robotic speal...even from the  manager...it&#39;s our company policy to not take reservations, particularly since you want to come in at a very busy time, huh, however you can make a reservation for 6 people on Yelp???? Several people arrived early to get the table but were told there was a 2 hour wait, we left and had the most enjoyable time and meal at Maggiano&#39;s with a very friendly and attentive staff.<br>In my opinion the Cheesecake Factory is not into customer service but just flipping tables, everyone I talked to each time I called was very cold &amp; not one person, even management seem to care.<br>FYI, we will never come back and my sister and her friends will now be going to Maggiano&#39;s for lunch weekly, you can thank your incompetent staff and self serving and ridiculous company policy.

Where should I begin? First of all, the service was horrible. I totally understand it was busy but there is no excuse for poor customer service. The floor was filthy, crumbs galore.. it took 10 minutes to get a menu!! Are you serious?!?!?  Not to mention the plain cup of water that took 15 minutes to arrive. Now let&#39;s talk about the appetizers disgusting! Which I wouldn&#39;t even feed to my cat! The avocado toast tasted like green baby goo, no taste, no flavor, no seasoning, just a bunch of leaves sloppily scattered on top of a loaf of hard crunchy bread tossed with a few grape tomatoes added for color only.  After that it only got worse..... now I like to  eat my steak well-done, not char coal burnt! All I was thinking of how would Chef Ramsey react to this ghastly concoction. Two hours later, I&#39;m still burping up garlic and having heart burn up the cazoo. After several attempts to obtain a check, while the waitresses just walk by and ignore your request for help, we finally got the attention of someone who was able to get us a check and out of there for good, never to return AGAIN! I am writing this review while still boiling from anger inside. I&#39;m a person that enjoys fine dining and good tasting food along with good service. Is that so much to ask?!?! I will never step foot in ANY Cheesecake Factory AGAIN!!!

A friend took me here for lunch for my birthday. I ordered fettuccine alfredo with chicken. It was terrible!!!!!! Chicken was white and shriveled with plenty of grissel and nooooo seasoning.
