They couldn&#39;t grill it or something? Fettuccine was flavorless and the meal wasn&#39;t visually appealing at all. Just a white flavorless mess.  Very disappointing. I didn&#39;t complain because it was a birthday gift! Service was great but when you conversation going on  please don&#39;t keep coming by and interrupting!!! #dobetter

The Cheesecake Factory is a very good restaurant with very good food and not so good price. <br><br>Whether you are browsing the mall or happen to be in King of Prussia, the Cheesecake Factory is a great place to eat. The wait and serve time is generally low unless you go on a weekend, which I would recommend leaving some time for. The food is all very good and fresh tasting, and I would definitely recommend their enchiladas! Of course, their cheesecake is by far the best part of the meal, and there is a huge variety to choose from. But, this leads us to the price. Unfortunately, the meals are above-average prices, and a normal entree will run you about $14, the cheaper ones being around $11-$12 and the most expensive being around $20. <br><br>I would recommend it!

I&#39;ve been here countless of times before. And each time i visit, it&#39;s always AMAZING. But let&#39;s just discuss why I only gave it 4stars. The spring roll that we had was aL LITTLE undercooked. Coming from an Asian family, I like my spring rolls fully cooked and crispy. The second reason was that when we received our order, the meals were warm/room temperature. I feel like they didn&#39;t put it under a food warmer while it was waiting to be picked up by a server. So that was basically it, plus, we went there on a Saturday night, so it was PACKED!! Expect to have a line waiting and be on the waiting list for at least 45 minutes.<br><br>APPETIZERS: <br>-Cheese Burger spring rolls: i have never in my life thought about putting a cheeseburger mix/flavor in a spring roll before, and that was INCREDIBLY genius and so delicious<br>-Buffalo Blast- a MUST have when you come to Cheesecake Factory. The flavor is just amazinnng, definitely not a fan of bleu cheese though, just absolutely not my kind of cheese. <br><br>Main Course:<br>Boyfriend had the Louisiana chicken pasta, who said &#34;the chicken melts in my mouth&#34; and claimed that it was one of the best meals he ever had. I tried it myself and it was pretty awesome! The chicken was so crispy and definitely just melts in your mouth. It wasn&#39;t too thick or too thin either. The pasta itself was cooked wonderfully. The flavors exploded in your mouth! So many spices in this dish!<br><br>I had the Chicken Bellagio, which was superb! I&#39;m a pretty petite woman, so my food portion sizes are small. The meal was HUGE. Literally bigger than my torso. And it was the best pasta and chicken I&#39;ve ever had. The chicken was amazing, it melted in my mouth also. Was kind of disappointed that the server didn&#39;t come back and offer to put cheese on our course, because from the last time we were there, they always came back to offer cheese. But anyways, pasta was perfectly cooked. Again, the food was warm-ish, closer to being room temperature, so that was a downside. The prosciutto was amazing, as always. Would definitely recommend this dish to anyone!

Holy moly the Spicy chicken chipotle is like taking a bite of a bonfire. Too much chipotle, I could not get the smell out of my mouth and nose. Service was gOod though. Would recommend the buffalo blasts.

The best part about the meal was the fried cheese appetizer. My shrimp and angel hair was a lump of gluey pasta with shrimp that had been overcooked to the point of being inedible. My daughter ordered her burger medium and it came out mooing. On top of all that the service was incredibly slow. Overall very disappointed and will not be coming back anytime soon.

Where to begin, the arrogance, lack of good business sense? It makes no sense to me that I tried to make a reservation for 20 people for a business that I own and the manager, John was completely disinterested in this. Basically I was dismissed, luckily there are many other places that would like to have my business. To all of you local business owners, I would put cheesecake factory off of my list as they do not accommodate and are not interested in your business.

Worst experience I&#39;ve ever had at a Cheesecake Factory<br><br>1. The wait - over two hours to get seated. Which was more than what we were told <br><br>2. When we finally get to the table and order drinks. One glass cake with shards of glass all over it which then got all over the table. Two people at the table cut themselves on the glass. Hopefully the person that had the glass didn&#39;t accidentally drink any glass. <br><br>3. Another waiter accidentally dropped a gravy boat that hit my sister <br><br>4. After all this shit, they didn&#39;t offer us free dessert or anything. Any other restaurant would have done something. But nope not here. Just trying to get as many people into the restaurant as possible so they can make money. They clearly don&#39;t care about cleaning the glasses/tables and making sure their customers don&#39;t I don&#39;t know EAT GLASS! HORRIBLE!!!!!!

The Cheesecake Factory is usually a no fail for me when I can&#39;t decide what I&#39;m in the mood for. They have a huge menu with a wide variety of food, so you can always find something that fits your cravings. <br><br>This location in King of Prussia is conveniently attached to the mall, so it is easy to take a break from shopping and grab a bite to eat. Their lunch menu is served until 5:00pm which is nice because you can grab an early dinner and get the lunch specials, which are a lot cheaper than the dinner menu. <br><br>I came here with my sister on her last visit in the area. We had been shopping and decided to grab an early dinner at about 4:00pm. The restaurant was quiet at this time and we were seated right away. We both got the lunch salmon specials. She got the fresh grilled salmon and I got the herb crusted filet of salmon. They were both delicious and left us feeling stuffed, but of course not too stuffed to pass up a piece of cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory and commend them on their consistency from location to location.

I have loved the Cheesecake Factory 4 ever and even went there for my birthday last year. <br>Tonight I still love the place but I did not enjoy my meal ,I ordered the wrong entree!<br>I always get a choice of salmon, tuna or their amazing fish &amp; chips but tonight I chose the &#34; pizza style&#34; chicken Parmesan. I read the menu again and even asked the server to describe the dish , it was described as &#34; chopped chicken&#34; which imagined as pieces of chicken with cheese &amp; sauce on top.How could I go wrong ordering this I thought to myself as I was envisioning pieces of whit meat chicken covered with mozzarella &amp; marinara sauce.<br>This is how the server described the dish and said it was her Fav. I never imagined that chopped chicken means &#34; a disgusting chicken patty &#34;. It was really bad and I am shocked &amp; appalled that the Cheesecake Factory would serve a &#34; processed chicken patty &#34; as an entree.I haven&#39;t eaten anything this bad since lunch in my High School cafeteria.<br>I waited an hour and 40 minutes for a freaking disgusting chicken patty!<br>I still love this place but if I ever return I need to remember to stick to my go to entrees and I guess we need to be aware of &#34; chicken patty&#39;s &#34;.<br>Stay away from the pizza style chicken parm!<br>My wife had the sweet and sour shrimp &amp; chicken and it was delicious! She frequently visits this location and knows what to order! I wish I had the salmon or tuna ! <br>The Hershey Chocolate Cheese Cake was amazing and we also had the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake and I definitely recommend this choice!

I had occasion to have lunch with an out of town friend last week.  She absolutely loves the Cheescake Factory &amp; I haven&#39;t been for many a year.  She goes for one reason &amp; that&#39;s the tuna.  I, as is my usual, ordered an omelet, and I will just say I will never eat there again.  If you can&#39;t cook eggs, you&#39;re not worth your salt.  It was rubbery, cold, and bland.  It was plain awful.  I&#39;ve had bad omelets, but this took the cake.  I&#39;ve had better omelets at local diners.  Our waitress was more than attentive, but that&#39;s all I can say for our experience.

Food was good as usual, but I think their entree portions  got significantly smaller.  My husband and I usually have leftovers, we weren&#39;t super hungry, but still finished our entrees.  We haven&#39;t done that in the numerous visits in Cheesecake Factory in past years.<br>Side note - the bread that we got tonight was cold, subsequently, very chewy.  Maybe we just got the bottom of the bread batch.

Only reason i gave it a two star is that we all felt sickly with the amount of oil in thier cauliflower steak, burgers  and avocado roll.  The fish and chips is ok. The apptizers were oily as if fried in cold oil.<br><br>Now cheesecake....

My wife enjoys this restaurant.  This was my first time.  We had dinner last Thursday evening.  I had a white fish entree she had a salad.  She was happy.   I thought the fish food was rather bland and arrived lukewarm.  I had an Italian coffee cake (nothing to be excited about) and she chose a cheesecake dessert.<br>Service was good, finding parking can be an adventure.  For all the hype the meal was average.  Service was friendly and moved quickly.<br>I just was not impressed to want to try it again.  However, my wife really likes the place, so I am probably coming back.  Too many really good restaurants in KoP area.

I have been here many times and it&#39;s always a good choice. I am not a huge fan of chain restaurants but this is nice every once in a while. The menu has something for everyone and is very extensive but expensive. Also it&#39;s very dark in the restaurant and the wait can be incredibly long. <br><br>However, the portion sizes are ridiculous and I usually split a meal when I go. One thing I don&#39;t like is that you leave the restaurant feeling like you ate way too much. The cheesecake is pretty expensive but is delicious. I love all the options, my two favorites are the Hershey chocolate bar and the s&#39;mores. I usually order Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta and it&#39;s nice and light and delicious with fresh veggies and pine nuts in an olive oil sauce. <br><br>Favorites in our family include the Thai lettuce wraps, the factory burrito and the avocado turkey sandwich. They give you bread while you are waiting for your food which is pretty delicious. Just save room for all the food to come.

I can&#39;t recall how long this Cheesecake Factory has been at this location, but it&#39;s a testament to the food that the lines are still so long.  There is always a wait, but everyone is aware of that.  We usually can&#39;t eat an entire meal and enjoy dessert, so we come here quite often for just cheesecake to go.  Over the past few months, the line has been increasingly longer for the cheesecake, but it&#39;s always been worth it.  <br><br>This past Saturday the line was extra long and wasn&#39;t really moving at all.  Someone told me that they moved six inches in fifteen minutes.  An argument broke out between an entitled woman and people in the line.  It was chaotic and slow.  We&#39;ve easily eaten over fifty cheesecake slices from this place and 2017 hasn&#39;t been their best at service.  Hopefully they get it right soon.  Maybe it&#39;s just that it&#39;s cold outside and more people are there...  I&#39;ve experienced plenty of long lines, but they usually move product.  Hopefully next time we go, it&#39;ll be faster...  It took us over a half hour to order and get our food.  Possibly closer to forty minutes.

Had a bad visit to the Cheesecake Factory in KOP back in October.  In short, the service was horrendous and took forever (for myself and my son), and the meal came out cold.  This was the 3rd experience like that, so I took a review and provided that feedback.  About a week later I received an email from the manager asking about the experience, and offering a gift card to make up for it.  He said it would be coming via email 1 week later.  Fast forward a month after and I remembered that I never got anything.  I wrote back to Ryan and Scott the managers, and got no response at all.  I followed up a second time and again, nothing.  <br><br>I live local and used to go a lot because the kids always enjoyed it, but the service is horrible all the way up to management.  Go give your business to a company that actually values its customers!

I have tried eating at this Cheesecake Factory multiple times, but have ended up going to a different restaurant every single time because of the ridiculous wait times here. If you value your time, don&#39;t bother going here. <br>They also refuse to take reservations!

Olivia B was fantastic. We mentioned it was our 1 year wedding anniversary and she came out with our cheesecakes on plates with &#34;happy anniversary&#34; on them. soooooo delicious and phenomenal service!

Ambiance was relaxing and clean. The waitress was nice but you could tell she was stressed and/or tired. <br><br>The appetizer tasted homemade, loaded tater tots which had bacon, cheese and red skin potatoes rolled in panko crumbs with two dips. I&#39;m not sure I could share them next time- that&#39;s how yummy they were.  <br><br>The menu was huge so it took a while to pick one item.  They could cut the menu in half because it was almost ridiculous. No wonder there&#39;s a line out the door. Everyone&#39;s taking so long reading the menu!!   <br><br>I got the bowl soup, sandwich and a salad. The salad had nutritious greens in it. Of course, I got dessert!! Chocolate cake was to die for.  The ladies at my table agreed and had some too!  Overall, I would visit again. We need one in Hershey PA.

First time ever being at the Cheesecake Factory on our bday (July 24th). At the beginning the server was taking awhile to get bread and drinks. There weren&#39;t that many people there so we weren&#39;t sure what the hold up was. She did bring us fresh bread though for the wait. She didn&#39;t offer to refill any of our drinks or check up on us unless we called for her sad.. ‍ Despite the beginning and the drink issue we loved it so much we plan on going back very soon next time we&#39;re in the area. Recommend the Alfredo pasta and the macaroni bites, my sister loved them!! The cheesecakes were amazing and definitely fill you up even though they are a bit pricey for one slice ($8).

Went here on a Friday night at 7pm.  They told us it was approximately a 30 minute wait...at 7:25 we were seated and waited on immediately.  Our server was great...very attentive and always coming back to see if we needed anything.  We had the mozzarella sticks for an appetizer..they were great...and nachos which were also good.  I ordered chicken piccata, good lemony sauce,  served with angel hair pasta..  my husband ordered the  Cuban sandwich ..he ordered it at Delaware location and thought it was very good. Not as good here...used too many pickles on the sandwich.  For dessert, we ordered the chocolate mousse cheesecake ...it was chilled and decadent.  This was our first experience at this location and we will very <br>likely return.

One of the worst dining experiences that we have ever had. We have been there twice, which is two too many. The only reason we gave it a second chance was that my step-daughter, like every other teen in the area, has been brainwashed into thinking that this is the place to go and chose it for her birthday. I dont know where to begin to describe all the issues we had. First off, the wait is just appalling. Secondly, at neither visit, was the estimated wait, even in the same realm as the actual wait time. The last visit we were told it was going to be a 1 hour wait and after an hour and a half, we were still not seated. When we questioned the manager, after 1:15 hour wait, that we were told 1 hour, we were essentially called liars. They forgot about us two more times and almost 2 hours later, we were seated. But that wasnt the end of it...... we waited another 15 minutes before anyone came to set our table or take our drink orders and had to request additional silverware twice, from our waitress &#34;Betty&#34;, who could never seem to respond to the slightest request in under 10 minutes.  But that STILL wasnt the end of our nightmare..... we were a party of seven and ordered our meals. When the food came out, one of the orders was completely forgotten and had to be reordered. Another (Filet Mignon) was not cooked correctly and was sent back, where it took another 20 minutes to get it back. These two incidents, caused two of our party to begin eating their dinners after most of us were done. In total, it was over 2 hours and 48 minutes from the time we entered the restaurant, until we took the first bites of food. This, in conjunction with being called a liar, having our order forgotten and food not prepared correctly, causes me to give this place, the lowest rating for a restaurant ever. We will never return and will inform anyone who asks, of our experiences here.

Ehhh same as any other Cheesecake factory. The food was good, came out hot and tasted fine.<br><br>Service here wasn&#39;t that great. Server wasn&#39;t very attentive &amp; the hostess was a bit abrupt. We went for lunch for my daughter&#39;s graduation.<br><br>I had pasta jambalaya. It was very spicy. My daughter had pasta carbonara. &amp; my sis had some chicken &amp; pasta dish. We also had the loaded tator tots for an appetizer. Those things are really good!
I&#39;m always in love with their avocado egg rolls. Something for the whole family. All my relatives have dietary restrictions, allergies etc and there were plenty of options for all.

Packed on a Friday afternoon so we snagged a high top at the bar. <br><br>Clam chowder was surprisingly excellent. So many clams. The creamy broth isn&#39;t too thick so it&#39;s really a perfect soup that doesn&#39;t leave you hating yourself if you&#39;re going to try on clothes after. <br><br>The chicken buffalo blasts are addictive. The wonton tastes like crispy fried skin. <br><br>Avocado toast was a letdown. Unsalted and overly chunky avocado. Sad. <br><br>Key lime pie cheesecake is exactly what you think when you image the two dessert combined into one. I wish it had more graham cracker crust but overall tasty!

Poor service....30 min wait for seating then waited over an hr and still no food.... waiter left  and new waiter never even greeted us.... not sure if it was because we are black but I&#39;ve never had this poor service in my hometown in Florida .... we were clearly discriminated against as the mgr after informed us that our food was in the window for pick up for 40 mins plus so someone purposefully didn&#39;t want to serve the colored folks... my post had nothing to do about hunger it is about the disrespect

This is my absolute FAVOURITE restaurant out of any I have ever been to. When we arrived there, there was a half-hour wait like usual because of the location and popularity of this restaurant. However, it&#39;s in one of the biggest malls,KOP, so I don&#39;t mind the wait because I can browse in the stores. We had an app that told us when we were ready to be seated. When we were ready, a very friendly seater brought us to our table. We ordered, and for appetisers we got mozzarella dippers, nachos with just cheese but jalapeños and sour cream on the side. They also offer you free bread. The food came quickly and it was delicious! Our nachos had tons of cheese and the mozzarella came in the cutest little tray. When our food came it was all still hot and I ordered bowtie pasta with sauce on the side. The pasta was al dente and the sauce was slightly sweet so it paired nicely. After we finished eating, we decided to order dessert. We got the strawberry shortcake and it is HUGE. There is a layer of cake, scoops of vanilla ice cream, these sweet fluffy pieces of bread with sugar crystals on top, and fresh strawberries with whipped cream. Every layer is pretty big and we share this with the whole family. Definitely recommend going here!

Not a huge fan of this location. They always seem to get my order wrong when I place an order to-go, they&#39;re never apologetic and never accommodate me for the inconvenience of having to wait an additional 20 minutes beyond the 30 minutes I had to wait for the original order. Also, the food isn&#39;t as flavorful at this location, I can&#39;t put my finger on it but it always seems to be bland and missing flavor.

Not a chance of me ever going back here. The menu has hundreds of items so that should have tipped me off. Completely average diner food for premium prices. Can&#39;t believe this place is actually in busoness. 21 page menu and the food is terrible

I had lunch with my girlfriend on December 13 th.  I had half of my salad and  decided to take the rest home.   I started eating the remainder of it tonight and I found the long hair in it.  Totally grossed me out that&#39;s one thing I can&#39;t stand his hair in my food

This location is always solid. Amazing food, huge portions, and of course delicious dessert. If you go, get either the gumbo OR the bang bang chicken and shrimp. They are two amazing dishes that are packed with flavor. The avocado rolls or the factory nachos are amazing for appetizers. Don&#39;t discount the avocado rolls. Try them! They have a crunch to them but are so soft and creamy inside. The dip is also fantastic.<br><br>Now the cons: weekends can see waits of anywhere between 45minutes to over an hour at times. Call first!! Depending on where you sit, it can be very loud! Get a booth if possible. The tables feel like you are sitting on the next person&#39;s lap. Also, it is easier to hear your guests in a booth. The bar area? Forget it if you want to talk and hear someone. The lighting at night is abysmal. Bring a flashlight to see the menu and your food. Maybe it was the day we went but it was practically black inside.<br><br>You should still try it at least once. Go hungry, eat up, and take a slice of cheesecake to go!!

Okay. Overall I love their cheesecake and every once in a while I BEG my fiance&#39; to come here basically because I want that brown wheat bread they give you and I want a piece of cheesecake.  So we went last weekend.  Luckily, being a party of 2 the wait on a Saturday night was only 30 minutes but be aware to potentially wait well over an hour for a table, especially if you&#39;re a bigger party.<br><br>Usually, I don&#39;t have any complaints. The food is just average and I always order off the skinnylicious menu because seriously all of their food is WAY too many calories (good luck finding items on the normal menu under 1000 cals) and if you want cheesecake with that, it&#39;s just too much for me.   But this last time our waitress was terrible.  She didn&#39;t come to check on us at ALL and she got my order wrong.  I ordered the skinnylicious chicken tacos and I got some kind of fish tacos with rice and beans.  The problem is, after we got our food, we couldn&#39;t find her or anyone that wasn&#39;t running around for that matter, so I ended up just eating it because I was starving.  She also didn&#39;t give us any refills on our drinks which was annoying, especially because I literally got water so I don&#39;t think I was costing them much.  I hope they&#39;re more attentive next time!

Love this place! Always packed. Wait times are usually on the higher side. The food is incredible. Shawn was our server. He was great! Quick, Fast and friendly.  We come here pretty often. Always trying new cheesecakes. Only disappointing thing was, I got a cheesecake to go and it was the wrong one. Still tasted good, but I would have loved to had the one I ordered.

I feel that I&#39;m being rather generous giving a 2-star rating since most of my dinner experience wasn&#39;t 100% awful.<br><br>Just to quickly go through the good parts of my dinner here: the waiter was nice and checked on us frequently enough, the salmon salad was decent, and the hot spinach dip was exactly what you might expect of a spinach cheese dip.  All rather good things.<br><br>The highlight however is how bad the Cajun Jambalaya pasta came out.  If you&#39;re unfamiliar with the dish, it is a linguine served with chicken and shrimp in cajun seasoning.  The chicken and shrimp were solid; no complaints at all.  <br><br>Now now, I&#39;ve had cajun seasoning on food before but under no circumstances have I ever had anything taste as salty as the pasta did.  Have you ever gargled salt water to help treat a sore throat? Now imagine pasta tasting even saltier than that salt water rinsing around your mouth.  I couldn&#39;t believe how that could even happen and I really couldn&#39;t convince myself not to waste the food.  I&#39;m the type of person that will eat everything I order pretty much as long as it doesn&#39;t touch the floor.  This linguine was the first thing I&#39;ve ever been incapable of stomaching beyond the first bite.<br><br>Recommendation: Do not get the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta

This is probably the worst experience I&#39;ve ever encountered. We&#39;re supposed to have good family dinner before my daughter taking off to college tomorrow.  The waitress was so lazy, didn&#39;t bring the bread,  never ask us for a refill of beverages. When we were done my daughter wanted to get a cheesecake upfront, the guy serving was also taking his sweet time.  We have to wait for another 15-20 minutes for premade cake with no line. I am so done with your inconsiderate service.

HORRIBLE SERVICE. HORRIBLE. JUST SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN!  The manager is no help either. We waited over an hour and a half like she told us we would be and when our buzzer went off she said oh no another 10 minutes..... 30 minutes later still nothing! Ended up leaving. FIRST &amp; LAST TIME. NEVER AGAIN.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory on a weekday afternoon for lunch. My party of two was seated almost immediately. <br><br>The tables were a little crammed together and the restaurant a little noisy so I would recommend requesting a booth. <br><br>I ordered the four cheese pasta with shredded parmesan on too and it was delicious and HUGE, I could only eat half. Would highly recommend this dish. For dessert I got the S&#39;mores cheesecake to go, which was amazing as well and a sizable piece. However, cheesecake is a little pricey, around $8. <br><br>Overall experience; a really yummy restaurant that will leave customers satisfied but I would suggests going in unusual hours to avoid crowds.

We came here to celebrate my birthday. Perfect service. I can&#39;t say enough how terrific Kayla was. She was patient, remembered everything. She was knowledgeable about the menu. Before we could even ask if something had pickles she told us. This may seem small, but when you hate pickles and the menu doesn&#39;t mention them but your chicken comes out with pickles, you might loose your mind lol<br><br>Food was excellent, Nashville tenders were on point. My pasta was perfect, not too much oil. And of course I got cheesecake to go. Which was DELISH! Celebration cheesecake I believe. Can&#39;t wait to get back !!

Today I have lunch at cheesecake factory I have to say that everything from appetizers to  main course  was perfectly done1. Including the service...  Contrary of my last rewiew, You are back in the game!!

We love having a Cheesecake Factory so close to home, whether it&#39;s for brunch, take-out, or a sit down dinner. We&#39;ve done curbside pickup but it has never worked out as planned - the food is not ready on time or the person never shows up to bring your food which forces you to go inside. We&#39;ve also ordered through a delivery service and our order was messed up. Brunch has always been tasty and fresh and they have a nice variety of dishes. Our only real gripe about this place is that you will wait A LOT - whether it&#39;s for your to-go order, a table, bread, a refill, the check, etc. In the 10+ times we&#39;ve come here, we&#39;ve maybe had one frustration-free experience with not having to wait an exorbitant amount of time for various things. Most of the staff seems annoyed with their job and don&#39;t do anything to enhance your dining experience. Overall, this is an &#39;okay&#39; Cheesecake Factory but don&#39;t expect the greatest service or to be in an out quickly.

My fiance and I arrived and waited to be seated. We were then ignored by the wait staff and a huge group was taken before us. We were obviously forgotten about since there were many tables open. The waitress took forever, the food took forever, and then the check took (what it felt like) 5 days to appear. The food also wasn&#39;t very tasty. This was a sad experience compared to our first, which the food was pretty good the first time (we ordered burgers each time). We will not return. It just took extremely too long for what we received.

We made a reservation for lunch today for 20 people.  When we got to the hostess stand, after hunting for parking, they told us we were 8 minutes late so they gave our table away.  Even the manager&#39;s comment was &#34;we are busy, you were late&#34;<br><br>We will not be back there again.

Kinda bummed about this experience.<br><br>Service: the service was great, our server couldn&#39;t have been better. Unfortunately she doesn&#39;t have a kitchen to back her up.<br><br>Food: my girlfriends pasta was great. But I ordered a burger and it came out not only EXTREMELY salty but way undercooked. They explained it was a new menu item but it was one of the worst burgers I have ever had ...I ate about two bites and realized that it was undercooked and couldn&#39;t eat anymore. <br>The cheesecake was awesome. <br><br>They did a good job at correcting the situation, seriously our server was AWESOME, she comped our desert, which was really nice. <br><br>My only qualm was that they didn&#39;t take the burger off the check... that would have been nice.<br><br>I probably won&#39;t be back, as I can get better food elsewhere without the hassle.

I&#39;ve been to this location twice on my lunch hour in the last month. The first time, I was with a group of 4 coworkers, the second time I was with one coworker.<br><br>The good:<br>Both times we were sat immediately<br>The food was good <br>The server greeted us immediately<br><br>The not so good:<br>Both times, once the drinks delivered, and the food ordered, the server completely disappeared and was not seen for almost an hour. Today&#39;s lunch, my co worker and I both ordered salads. After 50 minutes of waiting, the server ran by and we stopped them and said &#34;excuse us, just checking to see if food coming anytime soon, our lunch hour is almost over&#34;. The server said he&#39;d go check and immediately came back with our salads. The impression was very clearly that they had been sitting back their and the server had just forgotton about us.<br><br>I&#39;m a fan of this restaurant change but unfortunately will be unable to return to this location. I get only an hour for lunch and when the food doesn&#39;t come for 55+ minutes, it&#39;s impossible to enjoy my dining experience

I am usually a big fan but I went for lunch on Friday August 16th and was extremely disappointed . I ordered a burger and it was extremely over cooked! Dry and tasteless. I also have a lot of food allergies and the bun was covered in seeds. It was a terrible meal. I will not be going back for a while

The most over crowded place. The plates are Uncleaned and has lot of stains on it. Secondly the place is so very busy that we don&#39;t get proper service. I would highly recommend this place for the person who loves desserts as they have exclusive variety of cakes  The food served is also delicious but the tables are placed so closer that we feel the people on table next to me are also sitting with me <br><br>Occasionally this place is good to visit.

Visited this location for dinner w/ family and once again we were disappointed w/ the food quality.  Unfortunately, even the service was poor this time around. Wasted $85 on horrible food: ALL three of our dishes were bland/tasteless and oily.  We chose not to complain, as we were already skeptical going in given our last few mediocre dining experiences here. NEVER AGAIN.

Absolutely amazing food and service! Our server, Kortnie, was friendly, and so enthusiastic. She made the dining experience truly exceptional. The food was super enjoyable. I recommend the Vietnamese summer rolls, and Tuscan chicken dish! You won&#39;t regret coming to this specific Cheesecake Factory location

We went there last night for our anniversary dinner. We didn&#39;t have the greatest time. <br>They are very unorganized. We waited a few minutes to get a table. Walking to our table the hostess turns around and says never mind you don&#39;t have a table. Go back to wait again.<br><br>Then... It&#39;s too dark to read the crazy long menus. With the light of our cell phones you could see how dirty the tables and floors were. The food was good but cold.  The waitress didn&#39;t pay no attention. She came back once with a sigh of we&#39;re a bother to clear plates then asked you didn&#39;t want dessert did you,-handing us the check.

We have been coming here for years, and there is some good and some bad with regards to this particular establishment.<br><br>First, let&#39;s talk about the good.  The food here is always good and very consistent.  There is a ton of options here, and if you can&#39;t find something on this menu, there is probably something seriously wrong with you.  Some of my personal favorites include the quesadilla, black pepper shrimp, factory meatloaf, and Louisiana chicken pasta.  The portions are huge, so expect to come home with leftovers.  I&#39;ve never ordered anything that I really didn&#39;t like.  The cheesecake is fantastic, and there are about 30-40 different options.  My favorite is the Adams peanut butter.<br><br>Now the bad.  This place is notorious for long waits.  Being in the King of Prussia mall which is always busy means always at least a 20-30 min wait and sometimes upwards of 2 1/2-3 hours during the holiday season.  My big problem is that you will be told the wait is 20-30 minutes and end up waiting 40-50 minutes for your table.  I&#39;ve even had a half hour wait turn into an hour and a half on one occasion.  The service is also pretty slow as well.  They really need to get their act together with regards to these issues.<br><br>So overall, good food, but lackluster service and be prepared to wait.

This is probably my least favorite restaurant in the KOP area. Don&#39;t get me wrong. I always like to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt if a experience there has been poor. But this restaurant is pretty good with being consistent with poor service and mediocre food. <br><br>After my experience here, this will be my last. The server was never attentive. Amongst the many things I told my server, I asked for her to give me utensils so that I can actually eat my meal... which took 15 minutes for me to get her attention. It was a normal paced Sunday night so I was pretty irritated because I was just starving. <br><br>One thing that ticked me off - which contributes to the low rating was when my entree did come out - was when the food runner looked at my eyes and said that my steak was rare. I ordered it medium rare, but I specially asked my server to make sure it was on the rare side than medium well. When I finally got my utensils to eat, I cut into the steak to find that it was far from rare. Cooked all the way. It was pretty tough to cut into... I didn&#39;t even bother taking a bite.<br><br>Not sure if it&#39;s my fault to order a steak at Cheesecake Factory... I didn&#39;t expect it to be like butcher and singers. All I wanted was attentive service and decent food.

While having dinner one weekday evening, I needed to use the handicapped bathroom. After sitting down I realized there was no toilet paper in the handicapped bathroom. Also, there was no extra rolls in the stall either. I waited and no one came in so I had to use paper towels. I went out and told the dinner manager. He said they didn&#39;t get to checking it before the dinnertime. When I told him it was only 6:15pm. He should have handled it differently- he should have offered a drink, dessert, gift card or comped/or discount my meal. He didn&#39;t even apologize. On top of it, I sent Cheesecake Factory a &#34;contact us&#34; on their website. I never received any response to date. I am not in a hurry to go back. They need to rethink how they treat customers.

Let me just say the server we had made the experience worth while. Always made us laugh, and offered us excellent advise on food choices. I would definitely come back to this location when I&#39;m in the area. <br><br>Service 5/5<br>Food 4/5<br>Atmosphere 4/5
Who doesn&#39;t like Cheesecake Factory? lol..I love this place! It can get crowded many times, but I feel the food is worth the wait!

My coworker and I came here for dinner after work. We had two different servers during the evening due to the change in shifts. Both waiters were friendly and prompt. I had a passion fruit margarita and my companion ordered two pineapple mojitos - both were good. For entrees, we had the herb crusted filet of salmon (which comes with mashed potatoes and asparagus) and the Cubano sandwich (which came with a side, my companion ordered a salad). The food came out at a good pace and the portions were generous. The food was yummy! Lucky me, my dining companion was here on a business trip and he let me take home part of his sandwich, and I&#39;m looking forward to eating it later. We could not end our visit without ordering their famous cheesecake. We ordered the caramel pecan turtle cheesecake and the lemon meringue cheesecake. It was creamy, rich, and delicious. We purposely only ate half of our cheesecakes so we could enjoy them again later. I&#39;m looking forward to my next visit!

The only reason that they are getting three stars is because I just ate, and I&#39;m not hangry anymore. The restaurant itself is nice, the food is good, however, our waiter pissed me off. I needed a drink refill, but it was coming to the end of our meal...not ONCE did he offer me a refill (and I hadn&#39;t had any refills). He came back past the table five, FIVE times...end rant.<br>I will come back again, despite this incident. The food is yummy.

I guess you don&#39;t have to offer a friendly hostess, attentive server or quality food when you are serving the masses. We were so bummed out from our experience yesterday from the minute we walked in the door. The hostess never looked up from her computer and just mumbled &#34;there is a fifty minute wait 5 0..&#34; Wow not hello or how many in your party nothing. So we ended up only waiting about 1/2 hr which was great. A server came over and took our drink order and brought us bread. He told us there was going to be a shift change and someone else would be our server. We asked if he could put our food order in because we were starved from a 45 mile birthday bike ride we just got back from.. So 40 minutes later we are still waiting for our food... Guess we should have waited for the new server. She ended up bringing our food which we knew right away had been sitting in the window for a LONG time. All the sauce on our pasta was congealed on top and the plates were scolding hot. My Alfredo was horrible, it tasted like dishwater. I had asked for broccoli on my fettuccine Alfredo , it came out with 2 tiny chunks of broccoli that were nearly cooked. Was shocked to see I was charged $2 for that. My daughter ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. It showed up as single meatball with spaghetti. The sauce tasted exactly like the sauce on canned spaghetti-o&#39;s . My other daughter got the chicken parm pizza style. It was a weird ground up chicken patty type thing that tasted like breakfast sausage topped with angel hair with a weird cream sauce. So we were hopeful for dessert. My daughters had mentioned to the server that it was my birthday, they kind of thought the server would at least stick a candle in my dessert. I had ordered a coffee with my dessert knowing we had an hour and half ride home after a long day riding our bikes. No sign of the coffee and no trace at all of a birthday celebration on my dessert. She dropped our desserts with the check and didn&#39;t see her again till I took out my credit card. Overall it sucked. We always try to find some good in an experience but this was not one of the times.

I had never been to one until this night.  <br><br>Was a bit disappointed in the menu - until they brought out the skinny menu.<br><br>Regular menu is sort of like a higher class Cracker Barrel.  It&#39;s good but not good for you.  I can see why people like this place.<br><br>Skinny menu provided me with a salad around 500 calories.  Was good but not great.<br><br>My gf had a &#34;slice&#34; of cheesecake and it was a bit over the top.

Very disappointing meal after a wait of an hour- I want to start by saying how rude the manager was when being approached by us- he didn&#39;t introduce himself and basically gave no feedback or resolution to our problem (even when I said then we will not choose to dine here then) My fiancé was super polite and just spoke about how misleading the menu is -  We had a $70 check plus $25 at the bar when we waited -  we ordered the steak and shrimp scampi platter- for $22, the portion was extremely small and we were on the road all day.  (3 shrimp and 3 tiny pieces of steak- bite size) There are no descriptions of the meal on the menu- for that portion and price , we will<br>be choosing another destination to eat and deserve what we pay for.  Very upset by tonight&#39;s choice in meal and our response from a manager that is supposed to put customers first and ensure the happiness of a customer-

Amber was an angel. Me and my friend came in and she has an avacado allergy and she was very apologetic and worked with us to make sure she was safe. The food was excellent but the bellinis were better. Thank you amber!.
Food is good and service is usually pretty good. Be prepared for long wait times on Friday &amp; Saturday

I was just told that strollers weren&#39;t allowed in. Therefore my son and I were not able to eat there. He was sleeping and i am not going to take him out of the stroller (he is too young for a high chair). What a discriminatory policy for new parents. Very shocking given that the restaurant was very empty! So disappointing

Not the greatest food you&#39;ll ever have but you won&#39;t go hungry!  Large menu to choose from with calorie counts beside each dish making you second guess each choice for fear of needing either a cardiologist or bariatric surgery!  Seriously with each dish being over 1300 calories it takes the joys out of eating out.  <br><br>Cap your meal with a piece of their signature cheese cake and you have had a week&#39;s worth of calories at one meal!

You can&#39;t go wrong w/TCF. Our server/waitress, Marlene was on point and very attentive to our needs. She was the best that we&#39;ve had, out of the TCF restaurants that we&#39;ve been to in Maryland and California. I just there was one closer to Carlisle , PA.<br><br>We&#39;ll be back!

The wait was short, especially for a Saturday late afternoon, say around 4.45 pm. The table was cleaned half assed. There was still other people&#39;s food pieces on it.<br>Now, our server, Hector was the bomb. The man  knows how to please his customer. Very friendly, knowledgeable, and most informative. He makes you feel like a million bucks.<br>The food, mine was a bacon bacon cheeseburger came out on time, and the wife&#39;s turkey club came out a reasonable time, except it wasn&#39;t a turkey club. It was some kind west coast chicken and avocado thing on a flat roll. The manager came over and took care of our bill. The turkey club sandwich was still a half an hour wait, but it was well worth it. It looked and tasted great.<br>When management makes any kind of error better by comping, it erases any bad vibes. Thank you Mr. Manager and Hector for a job well done.

It was Okay . <br><br>I had the CHARGRILLED COULOTTE STEAK (medium well) which came with mashed potatoes and green peas. The steak was salty and dry, the mashed potatoes and peas were very oily as well as salty. However, it was only $20 so I didn&#39;t mind that much. Overall it was fair, the waiters are slow and the food takes forever to come out, so plan on that before going . Also go between 4-5 and you won&#39;t have to wait in line at all !

I have been to this place more than 6 times..initially I loved the food but in last two visits my experience was not so good...this time I ordered factory nachos because I just loved it when I ordered in my prior visits..but this time the dish was just warm and also it tasted different...I don&#39;t know the reason it may be Sunday rush..but overall I just love California guacamole salad of cheesecake factory and also complimentary breads..just try to avoid weekend rush if you really care about food quality..
We second the review who fell asleep here. All we got was cheesecake and it was an hour wait. AN HOUR. We will not be returning.

I live in KOP. It has been more than 10 years since I have appointed this place for various occassions inclduing birthday, family gathering, anniversary and just a catchup with frineds. However, I started noticing the service was becoming not very pleasant. The worst experiences hit me this month at &#39;to go&#39; counter. I got some gift card and a cheesecake voucher on email. I order a piece of cheesecake to go two weeks ago at &#39;to go&#39; counter. The cashier was not attentive. She wad delaying to take my order by doing some other things although I was waiting at a resgister patiently. Finally, I approached ot her to the other side of couter. She didn&#39;t say a word but came back to a register. However, she was starting to put in something into a register. I  got her attention by sayng &#34;excuse me.&#34; &#34;Can you take my order? I am in hurry.&#34; She looked at me but didn&#39;t say a word. She took my order finally just a piece of cheesecake. and said &#34;a few minutes.&#34; Then a man (who seemed to be a deliver man for another business) interrupted us and this cashier started chitchatting with him instead of taking care of my order. I asked her again to pack my food because I had to go pick up my child. She didn&#39;t appologize. She looked grumpy. She finally packed my cake but I saw her wiping her hand against something. I had to run to my car. On the way, I saw chocolate cream smeared on the handle of the plastic bag. It was so disgsting. She may have touched the food. When I took it out from the bag at home. The part of chocolate cream was smeared out side of plastic container, too. I couldn&#39;t eat it. What a nightmare. It took total 20 minutes to get one piece of cake to go! If there were more customer waiting, I could understand. But I was the only one after one lady before me. Actually, I contacted Cheesecake factory first. I got to talk to a manaer, James. He said he will send me a gift card and confirmed my mailing address two weeks ago. It hasn&#39;t come yet. I went back to &#39;to go&#39; counter two more times because I still have gift card balance left and location is convenient. The same cashier treated me in rude way again. One was today. The funny thing is that I saw her greeting another customer with smile and even exchaged a couple of jokes. I thought that manager talked to her about customer service skill finally. But when it came to my turn, she made an unpleasant expression and replied me &#34;what&#34; as if she couldn&#39;t understand my accent. I repeated myself in the same accent in louder voice. She took the order. Again, no saying &#34;bye&#34; or &#34;thank you for coming.&#34; She talked fast and unclearly. She said &#34;a few minutes&#34; for one piece of cheese cake once again. I had more time today although I was frustrated of her comment &#34;a few minutes&#34; over one cake to go order. I was going to time it. But actually she grabbed it fast ( I think someone else took care of packing). I don&#39;t understand why she didn&#39;t say a word when a customer leave. Most staff says &#34;have a good day&#34; or &#34;thank you for coming&#34; at least at any other restaurant including fast food chains. <br>I am so disappointed at Cheese cake factory in KOP. They could do better job. I am writing at YELP to see if this post may impact their service or not. By the way, the cashie&#39;s full name is not descibed but was written as &#34;Casher D.&#34; THat is also unprofessional in the service industry. Any manager, if you see my post, please pay more attention to train your staff especially at &#39;to go&#39; counter. I went to Maggiano&#39;s last Saturday where service and food were much better. Price was much more reasonable with a coupon, etc. I won&#39;t have any more gatherings at Chessecake Factor in KOP if you don&#39;t improve and don&#39;t keep your promise. So disappointed.

Great food! I had the chicken parm pizza style and it was good! Service was questionable.  It was my two children and I and she was pretty scarce at our table while frequenting others much more often and with more enthusiasm. Otherwise they had a good experience.

My granddaughter got food poisoning!  I reported it to the Health Department so that others may not get sick.  <br><br>It&#39;s been at least 15 years since I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factory and it will most likely be at least 15 years before I give it another try.  It used to be THE Place.  In fairness, I live in the Washington Metropolitan area and used to frequent the Cheesecake Factories in that area.  I get to the Philly area once or twice a year and will be sure to give the Cheesecake Factory a wide berth.  <br><br>When we arrived, we were seated in a half-rounded booth.  All of the dessert/teaspoons were dirty.  As in caked on fudge, dirty.  The Factory Nachos, although lukewarm, was delicious as were non-alcoholic mixed drinks.  Those and our waiter are the only reason I can muster up one star for this review.  <br><br>Despite our abysmal seating, the waiter frequently checked with us to ensure we had everything we needed.  He was obviously working quite a few tables and I had to wonder how he drew the short straw for the amount of work he was doing.  <br><br>When our food arrived, it was all lukewarm.  The shrimp scampi was completely inedible.  We could taste no garlic and the entire plate tasted like thickened dishwater.  My bang bang chicken would have been tastier if it had been spicy, as the menu described, or warmer.  The chicken riesling was mostly bacon flavored with bits of bacon here and there.  The pasta wasn&#39;t completely cooked, and my granddaughter spent most of her day feeling nauseous.  My daughter&#39;s burrito was okay.  <br><br>Our waiter comped the inedible shrimp scampi.  I tipped him well because it wasn&#39;t his fault that the cooks fell down on the job.  <br><br>All in all, I wouldn&#39;t return and, with the many restaurant offerings in the area, you&#39;d be better off flipping a coin and choosing another location.

Went here last Friday. I got the Cajun chicken critters thinking they would be spicy and they had no taste at all and we&#39;re not even spicy! Just glorified chicken tenders. My boyfriend got the chicken costoletta and there was barley any sauce on it. We asked for extra and only got two scoops of sauce. Food took a bit to come out and when we went to pay with cash the waiter said he didn&#39;t have change to give back, so he ended up with a hefty tip. We were extremely disappointed in our experience.

there was hair in my slider and in my calamari!! i ate it and it was still good though. the waiter was nice too so they&#39;re cool. :)<br><br>update: i ate some whipped cream and it was crunchy!!! i had to spit it out :(<br><br>update pt2: this is NOT a hate threat ;) (also there was a chili pepper on my fork from the previous customer)
If we ever get our dinner...I&#39;ll let you know. Our caesar salad was good. It&#39;s also freezing in here so bring a parka.

I love The Cheesecake Factory in general. We had dinner here at this location tonight for the first time. Portions were large as they always are. Food tasted great but we did have a few service issues which is why I only gave 4 stars. Still love this place!

We came in here on a Saturday afternoon and as expected the wait time was quite a bit. That&#39;s ok considering the day and location.<br><br>On getting the text we came in here and our waiter was really good. He not only helped us with the menu but gave his suggestions too. The portions can get a bit better but the food tasted great. The cheesecake options are good too.

Management: please tell the hostess with the tattoo behind her ear that she needs to treat all her guests equally regardless of race. You don&#39;t tell your guest &#34;You 2 follow me&#34;. 12/5 around 7 pm. <br><br>Visiting King of Prussia for the first time. My fiancé and I go to Cheese Cake Factory in almost every city we visit. Reason being is 1- Hospitality and 2- We trust the food and know what we like on the menu. There were a few people in line ahead of us. I told my fiancé good start... the hostess seems nice.  She greeted the couple in front of us pleasantly with good evening and how are you. When it was our turn, her whole attitude changed and said with a condescending tone &#34;you 2 follow me&#34;.  I was going to walk out but we got to our table and the waiter came with a big smile. The waiter was a really nice guy and turned the evening around for us. We tried some new dishes that he recommended and loved it. Despite all the waiters efforts and good food, we will always remember the hostess who was condescending and rude. She shouldn&#39;t have a job in the service industry!!! Management needs to put the right people in the hostess position!! I give this place 2 stars because hospitality is very important to us.
Enjoyed an early lunch, Jim our waiter was excellent. Everything was great but the flatbreads left a little to be desired for... but the Red Velvet Cheesecake made up for it!

The food was ok. My friend&#39;s lemon ricotta pancakes were burnt and that&#39;s the 2nd time she has gotten them and they were brunt from this location. They must have changed vendors for the cheesecake because it was the worst I have ever eaten. I won&#39;t be back anytime soon.

This was my 1st visit to the Cheesecake factory.. And I loved it. The restaurant is a classic... It was a weekend dinner date and luckily there was not much crowd. The lady who attended us was really sweet and patient.. Being a vegetarian I was surprised and happy to see so many veg options on the menu.. Being a cheesecake and desserts lover, I was on cloud 9 when I saw the varieties of cheesecakes, desserts and the portions they served us with. I think I am going to visit this place again and again just for the cheesecakes. Must try - tomato basil cheese flat bread, passion fruit mojito and the ULTIMATE RED VELVET CHEESECAKE!!!

Was surprised there was only a small wait. Wish it was nicer outside to sit on the patio.  I had the Cauliflower &#34;steak&#34; on top of spinach with corn onion tomato mixed couscous. For dessert had the Resees peanut butter cup cheesecake Absolutely delicious meal all around. Waitress Donna was very attentive and funny. I&#39;ll definitely be returning. Great atmosphere, food and friendly staff.

Always have a great meal at Cheescake Factory. I&#39;ve gone there and made a meal from the appetizers alone! Some of my favorites are the avocado rolls and Thai rolls. Our server was friendly and informative. Love that they now have a calorie conscious menu! The flatbreads from this menu are yummy. There are limited low calorie drinks and I tried their mojo to, which was ok. Love the cheesecake!!<br>For Center city dwellers - a Cheesecake Factory was opened at 1430 Walnut St!!

Usually love the Cheesecake Factory despite the long wait for a table so I was pleasantly surprised when there was no wait on Friday. Stopped in for a late lunch. Was seated right away. Our server came quickly and we placed our orders. Brussel sprout appetizer, pepperoni flatbread, order of fries and chicken bellagio and a chicken costaletta. Bread and drinks were quick to arrive. Got the sprouts, which were very good. Waited for utensils...and waited..finally another server dumped enough forks knives and spoons for 8 people. We were a party of 3. The restaurant was fairly empty,  so figured there wouldn&#39;t be a wait for the food. Finally spotted our server and asked her when we could expect our order. She claimed they were being plated. Still waiting...finally 2 of the orders arrived and then we waited for the third. By the time the third came out, we had pretty much decided to get our stuff wrapped to go and just get the check. I have been to this cheesecake factory location several times, have never minded waiting for a table and always knew that as crowded as they were, food might take some time coming out. Considering that the restaurant was not even one third full, the wait time was ridiculous. The servers seemed too busy talking to each other instead of servicing their tables. One star because the brussel sprouts were good.

We came here to celebrate my sister&#39;s graduation from medical school and I had my worst experience at a restaurant to date. <br><br>First, they messed up my wife&#39;s order. When she brought it to our waiter&#39;s, Shawn&#39;s, attention, he initially argued with her about what she ordered. Nevertheless, he took the dish back. In the meantime, my dad found a wad of garbage (two pieces of crumpled paper; looked like the paper between cheese slices) in his salad. At this point, having had some time to fume about the waiter&#39;s reaction and now finding garbage in our food, we demanded a manager.<br><br>The manager came by and... eh. He almost seemed frustrated/confrontational. It was awkward. Regardless, he didn&#39;t do much to save the experience. It was at about this time that we had to remind them they never brought out my daughter&#39;s fries.<br><br>All 7 of us were disgusted by the whole experience and those of us that got our food, prematurely stopped eating and just boxed our food. Everyone wanted to leave asap. They took three meals off the bill, but there was no saving things at this point.<br><br>Ending on a positive - bartender made a mean Moscow Mule. Kudos bartender.
Their bread is amazing. Food is always good too. You can usually count on there being a wait but it is worth it.

Came for dinner with a couple of friends. The hostess was not too friendly that night. <br><br>I ordered a salad, they sure give you large portions here, but the quality was subpar. Now I am not comparing this to other restaurants, but compared to other Cheesecake Factory, the quality was inconsistent. For a restaurant that prides itself on consistency, this was a let down.
Everything was really good! No waiting when we get there last night. People are friendly. Yes! Definitely coming back for more!!!
Ive heard nothing but good things about this place i cant wait until i finally go i lobe cheese cake and i heard they have the best

My family and I, went here for dinner Sunday afternoon after church on our way home from Harrisburg, PA. The only negative thing I have to say is that it was super super cold where we was seated, like extremely cold. There air conditioner definitely works, and works well. Other then that, the food was amazing, and our server was by far the best server I ever had. I think I gave her the highest tip I have ever given a server before, thats just how good she was.

Went here with my boyfriend the other weekend for the first time in years, mainly because we got a gift card for Christmas. We didn&#39;t think we&#39;d need a reservation since we ended up going pretty late(after 9, when the mall was closed), but we were wrong. We were seated in about a half hour. Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is overwhelmingly huge, so we decided to just get apps. We shared:<br>Caesar Salad- great, with a big enough portion for two<br>Pretzel Crusted Chicken- this was pretty bad, we didn&#39;t even finish it. Not what I was expecting at all<br>Dynamite Shrimp- excellent, similar to Bonefish&#39;s bang bang shrimp<br>The service was great despite being crowded. Our waitress was Sarah P. and she was super friendly and attentive. You can&#39;t come here without getting cheesecake, but we were pretty full so we got a slice of the oreo cheesecake to go. We shared it that night and it was absolutely heavenly. I forgot how great their cheesecake was.  As far as food goes, CF is above average for a chain, while still being priced pretty reasonable. <br>Edit to add: I have tried to come here numerous times since this review. But, there is always a ridiculously long wait that is not worth it. They need to start taking reservations.

Always enjoy a trip to the Cheese Cake Factory! We had mojitos, the egg roll sampler, bistro shrimp pasta, factory gran burrito, and the lemon meringue cheesecake with some Adam&#39;s peanut butter cup fudge ripple cheese cake. Never disappointed!!

I think I&#39;ve been to this restaurant about 10 times now and have never ordered the same thing twice. I&#39;ve always enjoyed my meal! Never disappointed! Portions are great.<br><br>Try their strawberry lemonade, it&#39;s awesome and you&#39;ll get free refills.<br><br>Just wish this place wasn&#39;t as pricey. Service could be a little faster as well but overall, I love this place! <br><br>If you&#39;ve never been here, must try&#39;s are: <br>- Cajun jambalaya <br>- spicy chipotle chicken pasta <br>- da Vinci pasta<br>- fish tacos <br><br>But then again....everything everyone else orders at the table always looks great too...

I usually order to go and the food is always ready in the given time frame. Sometimes it can get frustrating because you have to pay at the same register people order cheesecakes so it tends to be quite a wait to simply pay.
Did a car side to go pick up order was correct and ready by the time I got there I was told 20 minutes arrived in 24

There is something to be said about a restaurant that has 250 + items on the menu and a completely from scratch kitchen. This company knows what there doing. I&#39;ve  Been going here often for years now. People are waiting 2 hours to eat on a Saturday night for a reason!

Fine. Loud. Hit or miss food. <br><br>My friend and I arrived at 7:30 p.m. on Wednesday. Normally I don&#39;t come to Cheesecake Factory because of their insane waits. In fact, even though I could see it out my bedroom window for 10 years, I had only been to this location once. While we had a backup restaurant if the wait was terrible, we were told 10 minutes and actually seated in 5 minutes. We got a small table near the back. And when I say small table, I mean small table.  It barely fit our drinks and appetizer. We  struggled throughout the meal not to knock things off of it. Unfortunately, it was virtually on top of the table next to ours as well. At least it enabled us to become friendly with the foursome to our side.<br><br>We waited about 10 minutes for a waiter to finally come over. Once he did, we requested water, which we had not yet received. My friend ordered a half bottle of Veuve Clicquot champagne, because she was in a bad mood and decided to splurge, even though the half bottle cost more than a full bottle at a store. The waiter then told us that they don&#39;t have half bottles, but my friend pointed it out on the menu. Despite their very poor beer list, they did have Stone IPA in bottles.  So I ordered one of those. The waiter returned about five minutes later with the half bottle of champagne and a bucket to keep it chilled as well as my beer.<br> <br>My friend and I decided to split an order of nachos for an appetizer, and I ordered a hamburger medium rare you know why she ordered a chicken dish for our entrees. I have to admit the nachos were surprisingly good. They seemed very fresh with lots of cheese, guacamole, and sour cream. I ended up eating more of them that I had expected. However, they were the best part of the meal.<br><br>Unfortunately, our entrees were not nearly as good as the nachos. My burger, which again, I had ordered medium rare, was well done. It was dry and relatively tasteless. It was also not brought with the condiments I had requested on the side. It also came with a very small side of fries. I was just not in the mood to send it back and wait for another one though. My friend&#39;s chicken, which I did not taste since I don&#39;t eat chicken, was cold and tasteless. She said it was cooked, but cold. At least I could order another Stone IPA and she could enjoy her champagne. <br> <br>For dessert, we split the &#34;ADAM&#39;S PEANUT BUTTER CUP FUDGE RIPPLE CHEESECAKE (Creamy Cheesecake Swirled with Caramel, Peanut Butter, Butterfingers® and Reese&#39;s® Peanut Butter Cups.)&#34; It was good, but not great. It kind of tasted like it had come out of a box.<br> <br>Overall the service was pretty good. After the initial delayed water and misunderstanding about the champagne, our server was attentive except for the condiments, and it is not his fault that the entrees were not good.<br><br>The restaurant itself was quite loud, measuring 93 decibels. <br><br>I won&#39;t say that I will never come back, but with so many good options in the area I&#39;m unlikely to be back anytime soon. The very poorly executed entrées and the pathetic beer list really kind of ruined it for me.

I always enjoy going to the Cheesecake Factory. It is by far my favorite chain restaurant. The food has always been great! The service was a bit slow last time I was here though. The Cheesecake Factory is always a reliable place to get good food while on vacation.

We stopped in for Dessert about a half hour before closing time on Monday night and were seated outside. <br><br>My friends ordered strawberries and pumpkin cheesecake. I first tried to order a brownie sundae but your brownies were frozen so I ordered a rocky road sundae.<br><br>My sundae came and after eating the whip cream I realized it was just a chocolate sundae. Our waiter never came back to ask how things were until we were done eating. I let him know it had no nuts or marshmallow in it. He said &#34;Oh I didn&#39;t come back because I was eating&#34; and &#34;it&#39;s the end of the night so they probably weren&#39;t paying attention&#34;<br><br>No apology - nothing free - no care in the world.<br><br>I certainly felt like we were an inconvenience instead of a customer. Never again.  Is Grande Luxe better?

So they had some bullshit Happy 40th Anniversary promotion where you&#39;d get a free cheesecake if you download the door dash app. I downloaded the app and the Manager Scott on December 1st when I called assured I could get the cheesecake . At the very last minute they cap it off at 40,000 slices . Never told anyone. What a CHEAP DISGUSTING COMPANY!  I will never set foot in this mediocre chain restaurant ever and neither should you whoever is reading this !

Girl at cheesecake register has poor customer service. They need to rethink their hiring process. If you can&#39;t be friendly and say thank you then you shouldn&#39;t be working in a service industry. These kinds of employees will tarnish your reputation. I&#39;m okay with mediocre food and pricey menus but service is important. The customer pays your paycheck.

If you take out make sure you get order right in the phone otherwise you get an attitude from the girl at the counter. Bad enough it took four times to correct her on the phone about the order and she still forgot one order. Then she charged the wrong amount and had to bring in the manager to fix it...without apologizing for her incompetence. Food was good otherwise (that&#39;s my 2 stars).

Stopped here on the way home from a hospital visit. Food was excellent. I ordered the Skinnylicious Veggie Burger and the good friend I was with ordered the Skinnylicious Chicken Enchiladas. Both were full of flavor and hot when delivered to our table. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly.

Came here Black Friday night and the wait was an hour and a half but it was worth it!<br><br>Our waitress was very happy and friendly. She also had good memory!<br><br>They give a basket of bread and butter in the beginning. We asked for more of the brown bread which was kind of a mistake cause we were pretty full by the time our food came out.<br><br>We had the Chicken Samosas, Avocado Eggrolls and Stuffed Mushrooms for starters. They were all really yummy! I&#39;m not a huge fan of mushrooms but the sauce it came with was really good. My friend also loves it.<br><br>For the main course, we had:<br>Famous Factory Meatloaf,<br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta,<br>Over the Top Meatloaf sandwich,<br>and some kind of fish and steak.<br><br>I didn&#39;t try all of it but the pasta was SOOO GOOD! Kind of spicy. The meatloaf and the mash potatoes it came with was really good too.<br><br>Next time I&#39;m shopping at KOP I&#39;d probably stop by. =)

The service was pretty bad. Served dirty glasses, was rude af when we asked for a different side. Also we waited for 20 minutes after we were done eating for the server to acknowledge us even tho he was just standing around ten feet away.

It seems like a lot of people dislike this place, but I always enjoy it! Whenever I come to the Cheesecake Factory, I always leave satisfied. The food is consistent and always tasty. They have a large menu with a vast variety - there is definitely something for everyone! The service has always been great and timely. There are no reservations, which can mean a long wait time since it is in the always crowded King of Prussia mall. Going at &#34;slower/off peak&#34; times certainly helps with the wait time. The outside tables are also a great option when the weather is nice. We have sat in the bar area when there was a long wait and experienced the same great service and skipped the wait. <br><br>I have been here for brunch, lunch, and dinner many times. The lettuce wraps and southern egg rolls are my favorite appetizers. I also enjoy the beet salad and Greek salad as small plates. My favorite entrees are the orange chicken or the spicy cashew chicken. The portions are huge, which is a plus! They also have the orange chicken as a lunch special. My go-to cheesecake is the original with strawberry! <br><br>I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for consistently great food  and service. I&#39;ll be back again soon.

I was not very happy w the service @ this restaurant. The waiters seemed bothered and they weren&#39;t as welcoming like other restaurants. My burger was not medium like I asked for. The fries tasted old. My friends ordered the jambalaya pasta the noodles were beyond SALTY. They gave them a second &#34;new&#34; plate was the same old noodles SALTY. When the bill came they charged us the jambalaya which they weren&#39;t supposed too and we&#39;re not too happy to take it off either. Not happy at all. Will not be coming back

Extremely crowded and busy place on Saturday night in November. But the staff did a great job of getting people sat. Overall we probably waited 45 minutes to get sat and we got there at 5:30. We originally planned to sit at the bar first anyway for a drink or two, so the wait was ok for us. <br>The only real annoying part of the night was the bar itself. There was a single mother with 4 kids sitting at the bar eating dinner. I actually looked into this, as I thought it was illegal for kids to sit at the bar. It&#39;s not illegal as long as they are with a adult, which they were so I really had nothing to bitch about as far as the company side of things. But just thought it was rude to the adults and the bartenders working that 4 of their 12 seats were being used up by non tipping customers.  lol I&#39;m reaching here I&#39;m sure but, otherwise the place gets 5. Food was awesome, waiter was great and we really enjoyed our trip to the KOP mall.
As expected, solidly mediocre cuisine served in huge portions. Finished with the a Key Lime cheesecake - tasty.

After waiting over 50 minutes  for an ice cold  macaroni and cheeseburger and  half eaten salad my boyfriend and i decided this was not worth coming to anymore.The service was terrible,the food worse and the cleanliness was suspect as well.

I have been to this location twice, and both times it was good. <br>I love their avocado egg rolls, especially the sauce they come with. <br>They portion sizes are huge, even the lunch portions. I can barely ever eat half my break, usually I get it boxed for later. <br>Of course no visit to this place is complete without getting some cheesecake. Yes, they are delectable sugar highs, but worth it every single time.<br>Like any other cheesecake factory location,I would recommend to make reservations. There is always a wait.
Can&#39;t go wrong with this place.  They have everything you could ever imagine and you never get a bad meal.

I have gone to this Cheesecake Factory twice and been extremely disappointed. I was told that the wait was only an hour, but ended up waiting two hours to be seated. I got there at 3:30 and didn&#39;t end up leaving until 7. I ordered the loaded baked potato tots and they came out completely smashed and the breading was completely off/destroyed. I got the pasta da vinci for my entree and that was good. However the service was poor and our waiter seemed absolutely miserable. One star rating would not do justice to how horrible my experiences here have been. Next time I will go to the one in Philadelphia.

complete waste of time tonight.  called for pickup of cheesecake, told me 15 min.  got there 20 min later, waited 20 more minutes.  left without cheesecake, no communication for any kind of service.  probably would have waited another 30 min before being addressed.  mismanaged location, cannot handle their obligations to the large crowds.  it was haphazard, confusing, slow, no sign of urgency and a complete headache.  <br><br>long time loyal customers bailed on our order and probably won&#39;t be returning.

Always get the factory nachos. They are covered in cheesy goodness and would easily be enough for two people to share and then get dessert. I&#39;ve also had their white bean soup in the past that I have enjoyed. It&#39;s on the lighter side but still has a nice flavor.

Food was ok but service was terrible. I expected it to be busy as we went on a Sunday night but we waited over an hour after we finished our meals to get our dessert and check. Four people in our party including 2 kids and the wait was BRUTAL. Waiter was busy but not very responsive. No desire to go back and even if I did, kids would never tolerate it. There are other places with similar food and better service.

My wife and I go to the Cheesecake Factory at least once a month and sit at the bar to eat and drink. They have the best bartenders and especially Caesar!  <br>We went for my birthday a few weeks ago and Caesar did not disappoint. At the end of the meal I had ordered the big chocolate cake to take home. Little did I know that they had put the cake on a plate with a candle and Happy Birthday writing. Also a few of the staff sang Happy Birthday to me! <br>Just a nice touch to a great evening at the Cheesecake Factory. If you have to wait it is always worth it!
Wait time is always crazy here since it&#39;s always crowded. Just like any Cheesecake factories, very nice service, good food, somewhat pricey.

I am a returning customer to the Cheesecake Factory. I had a bad visit this time. I usually visit this restaurant with family, friends and/or business associates. So my average bill is no less than $100. On this visit I ordered Fettucini Alfredo which was tasteless. Also, I was never offered Parmesan cheese unless I asked for it. It&#39;s normal for bread and butter to start the service as you are seated but this never happened even after I asked for it and noticed the tables around me getting the bread basket with butter. My server kept telling me that he was waiting for it to get out of the oven. Furthermore, I ordered coffee which was served lukewarm and I never received a refill through the dessert. Believe me, I asked for one too.<br>I am not sure what happened this time. I am very disappointed with my experience this time.
For the negative review I only got the somewhat ironic response shown on here.  They did not try to offer me a gift card or entice me to come back.

I was pretty disappointed this time - obviously we where there at peak time - service took long , one of us asked to have no cilantro on his dish , and received tacos with cilantro as well as cilantro rice - food is of medium quality - there is better places to spend your money

First and last time coming here. Party of 7 waited two hours ... over priced should&#39;ve gone to a restaurant in philly with a cleaner environment better food and less expensive! Should&#39;ve known better than a shitty chain restaurant... one star because the food was greasy but ok ... although we were starving after waiting to eat for 2 hours!<br><br>Also the bathrooms were disgusting... no soap hardly any toilet paper trash and overflowing... I told one of the hostesses and she just rolled her eyes and said ok ... hopefully that wasn&#39;t the only bathroom and the waitstaff had soap to wash their hands!

Not the best experience. We went here for a friend&#39;s birthday and they ruined the vibe completely. First of all, I called in advance to see if I could order her the celebration cheesecake in advance and put a candle one it, no one answered the phone and when they eventually did they hung up. First red flag!<br><br>Now let&#39;s get to the experience of the restaurant itself. When we got there we put our name in and waited to be seated, after a while we start wondering if anyone was going to seat us because there were many empty seats yet we were still waiting out front for a long time. We finally got seated and we&#39;re greeted by the waitress( sorry I can&#39;t remember her name) we ordered drinks and they took forever with the drinks, it was only a milkshake and a mixed drink, nothing fancy. Second red flag. Then I order a kids meal for my baby girl, the only meal that was order since us adults only wanted drinks &amp; dessert. The kids meal also took a while and when they finally brought it out the entire plate was HOT. Now this wouldn&#39;t normally be a big issue but (A) it was a plate for a baby to eat off of &amp; (B) the temp of the plate tells me the food was ready long before it was brought out. Third red flag. The last straw was after we ordered our desserts they come back about 5-10 minute later to tell us that the celebration cake(the whole reason we went there) was too frozen to serve &amp; that we would have to take it home. Ummm... WHAT?!
