This completely ruined my friend&#39;s birthday experience. <br><br>The only good thing I have to say about the experience was that the portion of the kids meal was sizable &amp; the smores cheesecake was delicious, hence the two stars. With the bad service we most definitely won&#39;t be going back. We can get cheesecake elsewhere.

For a chain, the Cheesecake Factory is pretty impressive. The menu has great variety, the food quality is consistent, and the cheesecake is nothing short of amazing. The menu has actually been recently updated with a section of healthy offerings that I am looking forward to trying. Some of my favorite meals include the avocado egg rolls, skinnylicious vegetable salad, and veggie burger, and the lemon meringue and hershey bar cheesecakes are unbelievable. <br><br>One negative is the inevitable wait that you will encounter upon asking for a table. This place is always packed. Also, the portion sizes of the meals are just a little too big for my liking. I can&#39;t even imagine how much food is wasted here.

This review is in reference to take out- cheesecake only.  I was able to order in a timely manner as there were no other customers; however, I waited over 10 minutes for 2 pieces of cheesecake. There were 5 workers behind the counter, but none of them were fulfilling orders. When you are paying close to $20 for 2 pieces of cheesecake, I would expect better service.

today, my friends and i went to The Cheesecake Factory in King of Prussia Mall. we had an exceptional experience. at first, we were told there was a 50 minute wait but it ended up being a 90 minute wait. at first, some of the waters were mixed with sprite but they fixed it. however, there are some positive things. THE FOOD IS SO GOOD. it&#39;s a little pricey, but it&#39;s perfect for the quality we received. overall, our experience was a solid 3/5. it was a very long wait with a couple of mistakes, but it was worth it.

Very long wait and slow service BUT I do love the sweet wheat bread and the enormous platters of sweet potato fries.  it&#39;s amazing how the first bite of bread and butter is enough to make me forget my frustration with the wait.  The bang bang chicken with shrimp is a new hit with me, as is the chicken and biscuits.  I was able to substitute broccoli and spinach for the peas and carrots, which was a nice plus.  The bang bang dish is simmered in a creamy Thai curry sauce that is a nice fusion take for those who can&#39;t handle the authentic Thai spice.  Highly recommend the white rice over the brown as the brown can be al dente and dry.  Prices are very reasonable for the enormous portions.  One entree is almost enough for two!

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory before and it&#39;s always busy, and usually has a wait for a table. Today we were lucky enough to be seated at a booth for two with no wait at all. Our server was really busy, but other servers checked on us and helped during our meal. We never felt neglected - just goes to show how well the servers worked together as a team. My friend and I shared the Tuna Tartare appetizer. It was the perfect small portion for us, and we also had warm bread at the table. I ordered the Asian Lettuce Wraps from the &#34;skinny&#34; menu (under 490 calories) and I loved them! They tasted so fresh and crisp, and I loved that the sauces were on the side so the wraps didn&#39;t get soggy and I could decide how much sauce I wanted on there. My friend ordered the Chicken Belagio, which was breaded chicken and pasta with pesto sauce. She really enjoyed it and the portion was very generous. She had enough to bring home leftovers for another meal.

I went to this Cheesecake Factory because I thought it would be a nice change of pace from the Willow Grove location I normally go to. And boy ... was I wrong. It started with the staff who immediately was not friendly. I know they were busy, I understand that but simple niceties would have been appreciated. Then the experience went down hill from there. My friend and I both ordered and my friend was delivered the wrong dish. Okay the waiter comped it but he made it seem as if it was my friend&#39;s fault when really the waiter just misheard him apparently. I am sure there are plenty of people who do order something and when they get it say it&#39;s not what they ordered (shame on these people) but the waiter clearly misheard him and so when my friend asked what it was, he told him what it was and said that is what he ordered. It was a battle about taking it back, my friend hates wasting and was going to eat it anyway but the waiter offered to swap it (+1) but his tone just seemed very peeved. &#34;I can swap it but we cook it fresh so it&#39;s gonna take awhile&#34;. Okay ... Then my food that I ordered was super liquid-y. I had a dish with a cream sauce and instead of cream it was soup. The sauce didn&#39;t even stick to my pasta. It just tastes watery and bland. We had to ask for more bread and drinks , normally we get asked if we want more. And then to top it all off the place, as another yelper had mentioned. It needed a face lift. I realized once my plate was clear that below it was a giant crater from which the entire top surface of the table was removed (the faux marble effect ) to reveal its undersurface - rough and raw. We skipped out on Cheesecake after everything that has gone wrong thus far. And then we left to use the bathroom and there were not even enough bathrooms I waited and waited and had to leave. With a restaurant that huge why do you only have 3 bathrooms? I know that is not the restaurants fault, but it was just another sour note on my first and only poor Cheesecake Factory experience - and I have had a drink spilled on me. Needless to say, I won&#39;t be going back!

It&#39;s a big portion and pretty good food. I like shrimp and chicken gumbo. It has a good tomato flavor that I like. Cheesecake is amazing. My kids love this place too. Very family friendly restaurant. We love it!

Let me start by saying I love Cheesecake Factory but the people that they have working there they really need to have someone watch them closely the waitresses woman who does online orders she&#39;s such a bitch very nasty disposition slow as molasses she thinks she&#39;s some kind of Taskmaster a real schizophrenic sociopathic ignorant decrypted individual the type of people I don&#39;t want to be around especially in a restaurant when I&#39;m spending my money are you kidding me they need work they need to start with her these people that work in this restaurant needs restructuring it&#39;s their attitudes that are slowing the business down they need to stay focused like a racehorse you see a race horse has blinders on so that they can stay focus that&#39;s what they need to do stay focused instead of getting an attitude with the customers and act as though they own the joint get their asses in gear and act appropriately I&#39;m so pissed off you can fry an egg on my head they&#39;re horrible there somebody needs to step in and watch them closely because it&#39;s attitudes like that that ruin businesses people go elsewhere when they go through this nonsense that I&#39;ve been through with these people and I know I&#39;m not by myself with this complaint because there were several people in back of me at the countertop complaining about their orders seriously y&#39;all need to get yourselves together then I&#39;ll return

Tonight was a bummer. I understand that they were busy because of the power outages and people eating out for dinner, but the customer service was terrible. After our wait we sat at the table waited 15 minutes to be greeted. Then our drinks took 15 minutes. The waitress told me not to order what I wanted because the kitchen couldn&#39;t handle it. That speaks poorly on the restaurant. We had about 10 different people come to our table to drop things off, but we only saw our actual server a few times throughout the night. On a night where your are busy, it&#39;s just proper to attempt to offer better service. We knew going into the night that the food might take a while and that was fine, but EVERYTHING TOOK FOREVER. Just an all around bummer.

1 Star - Ambience, Restaurant Cleanliness and Interior Design<br>1 Star - Amazing Service<br>1 Star - Delicious Food<br>1 Star - Left Satisfied <br><br>People either love this place or hate it. It is a &#34;big-chain restaurant&#34; I get it... but it&#39;s also a BIG serving size of a good to delicious food in my opinion. <br><br>So I was here having dinner with a friend and I have to say first off, it looked like a HOT MESS. There was a bit of a line to the hostess and every person coming back from the front was reporting back to their families &#34;it&#39;s going to be a 50 minute wait.... ugh&#34;, or some sort of noise of frustration. <br><br>It was 7:30pm on Thursday night and I was thinking, oh damn... if it takes almost an hour, I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth that long of a wait? But also, I was friggin hungry. Yet, made it to the front fairly fast and for a PARTY of 2, we were instantly seated. Better for 2 than more. Perfect! Whew.<br><br>The only gripe I had about the night was that I don&#39;t like the Party of 2 Tables basically lined up with only 1 small table&#39;s length of space between them. As we were seated I had a couple on both sides of our table and maaaaaaan can people be nosey. Listening in on conversations and just looking at us while we eat. I ordered the Classic Burger with amazing fries and the entire time, I felt like a lion demolishing amazing meats while hyenas just kept looking at me from the sides. I just kept looking back at them - for the eyes to turn away real quick as if they weren&#39;t creep&#39;n... but besides the point.<br><br>Food here, is known for its BIG PORTIONS. How do you even get Appetizers, Main Course and Dessert? I had my burger and fries and was done. <br><br>the highlight of the night was a young lady named &#34;Amy&#34; if I caught her name right. (It&#39;s quite noisy inside). Her service, was on point! She was there when my drinks needed to be refilled and wasn&#39;t hovering or interrupting conversations at all. Really appreciated her service that my friend and I split a good tip!<br><br>Overall, will I go there again? Yes. Will i ask for outdoor seating where it&#39;s a little less crammed with people creep&#39;n. Yes. But I enjoyed it.

Beware of this restaurant, we dined at this restaurant and after waiting 2 hours. They told us they were out of Steak Diane and we wanted to substitute the steak for another steak and they said no because that&#39;s the way they do things around here.  We asked for a manager and he was worse.  Mr. John Miller was a condescending jerk. Spoke to us like we were bothering him.. he should not be a manager with that attitude.. I&#39;m an owner of a business and will never allow Mr. Miller to service my clients.. the owner of this restaurant should evaluate his performance!!

Ordering takeout from TCF is probably the worst idea ever. This is the second time I have ordered takeout and it was over an hour late. Then one of the entrees was missing.  When I called the restaurant I was told &#34;it&#39;s surprising&#34; that something is missing and that it was the delivery guy&#39;s fault that it was late. Never patronizing again. The food isn&#39;t even that great. It&#39;s just cheap.

Food is always great. Beat &amp; Goat cheese salad, the farro salad and Greek salads are my favorite. The Sheppard&#39;s Pie is a must. The Turkey burger is incredibly flavorful. Nothing I don&#39;t recommend.<br><br>They make a proper martini. Not too dirty, chilled just right.<br><br>The SERVICE is always wonderful. Very attentive but not annoying. Friendly and know how to take care of their tables.<br><br>After a 12 year restaurant tenure, I enjoy coming to CCF because they treat you as guest should be treated. They deserve a 30% tip!

Actually, I would give this place more of a 4 1/2 star than simple 4.  This was my very first visit to any Cheesecake Factory, so I went in not knowing exactly what to expect with food other than desserts.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good the dishes were starting with the excellent bread served while you wait for your order.  You have your choice of white or dark bread and I found the dark bread to be addictive.  I had to control myself so I didn&#39;t fill up on it.  It was full of flavor, crusty on the outside but soft and pillowy inside.  A request for more so I could take a couple of slices home with my leftovers was met with a big smile and cheerful tone.  Next up was the appetizer, which was the stuffed mushrooms.  Although the mushrooms were meaty and well cooked, I did find the sauce that accompanied it to be a bit disappointing.  It didn&#39;t have much flavor and was way too thin, almost watery.  But then came the main course.  5 stars plus for my Shepherd&#39;s Pie.  It was chock full of perfectly cooked veggies (especially the carrots) and you could tell the meat was high quality.  The sauce was fantastic, rich in flavor and perfect.  The serving was also more than enough for a second meal, which I will thoroughly enjoy tomorrow.  The drinks were a mixed bag.  I found my pina colada to be delicious but my Granddaughter hated her Margarita.  She drank less than half, claiming it tasted almost like medicine.  She substituted it with a pina colada too and found it just fine.  Now, of course, the dessert... I am not actually that fond of cheesecake in general, but I was assured theirs is different.  It was the gospel truth.  I ordered the Ghiradelli Cherry Cheesecake and couldn&#39;t believe how delicious it was.  There were even large pieces of cherries inside that added to the pleasure.  One other note... I&#39;ve never had whipped cream that held up the way that theirs did.  We live an hour away, and by the time we arrived home and I got into my cheesecake, the whipped cream was just as full and fresh as it was when first packaged.  Amazing.  Definitely, a place I wish to go again... perhaps for my next birthday.
Always decent food and service.  Nice selection. Normally no issues with getting things cooked to request.
Good service and good food tonight. No complaints at all. Love, love, love the fried mac-n- cheese balls!!!

I have had many pleasant experiences at other cheesecake factories, but this was just a miserable dining experience. Took well over an hour to get our food that came out cold and soggy. Waitress was inattentive and unapologetic about the experience

The food was super delicious. The atmosphere was so pleasant! And this food put me into a food coma!! Jeanette made sure we had everything we need and was very nice!! I&#39;m big on customer service and she delivered a fantastic experience!! Hats off!!

I had been here for the first time. Me and my husband reached there quite late for lunch on weekend. The place was crowded with an hour waiting time. We ordered Passion mint fizz and citrus sparkler. They were refreshing. For appetizers, we had avocado egg rolls which were delicious and the Evelyn&#39;s favorite pasta for Entree was good. Although we weren&#39;t expecting anything dry. I would definitely love to try this restaurant again.
Skinny menu is AMAZING.Service is AMAZING.Ambiance is AMAZING.Dessert is.....AMAZING.5 starts to this place.Never dissapoints .
One of my favorite places to eat. No matter what I order (from their giant menu) the food always comes out so good.

I have been to KOP location like quarterly for many years but this time, I think the quality of food went down so much. Let&#39;s start by ,1st, in the past, they provide single-serve butter from organic valley or Kerrygold but today, they serve a slice of butter on a small dish that I feel like eating in a diner.  Then, the portion of food starts to reduce and how could I tell? The pasta/noodles of Chicken Bellagio is cut into half to make it look huge but ,in the past, it was long pasta/noodles. For a high-end restaurant (or maybe I am wrong Cheesecake Factory is not a fine restaurant), they don&#39;t break pasta.  Finally, they are famous for their Cheesecake and usually it can be shared by four people but I feel like the cake which I ordered today is from skinny menu. how about service? as bad as food so I am so disappointed by their changes and maybe the corporation make bad decisions to do all mentioned change.

This place does it right.  They have good food &amp; good service and the place is always packed for lunch and dinner.  The portions are large so know that before you order appetizers, entrees and dessert. You will need to take it home!<br>There is also outdoor seating if you like to eat cafe style.<br>I have had good experiences here so I would recommend it. Save room for dessert since they have so many options for cheesecakes, they run about $7 - $10 a slice.<br>Plenty of options for everyone, I always see lots of salads coming out of the kitchen.<br>Go hungry as you will get a lot of food.

I never understood why people queued up at this place in KOP mall, thought like their cheese cake food must also be good. Until it happened to me one day. Went to the mall and was exhausted to go anywhere else to dine out, so decided to finally make it beyond their cheesecakes and have dinner. Food is what you can get at chili&#39;s, Olive Garden or uno Chicago grill with minimal originality or better say nothing to make you eat at this place again except for the very reason I ended up eating here - mall exhaustion and proximity to my already parked car.

Who doesn&#39;t like cheesecake factory? This location was great. Stopped in during lunch and the place was just getting busy so we were seated right away. Service was quick and the good came out perfect. My coworker lost her phone and the staff was really nice in helping her find it!

On the plus side we were seated fairly quickly and our waitress was good. However I have to comment on the lack of lightening available to see our menus. It really makes it hard to order when one cannot see the menu. We had to take out our cell phones to obtain lightning to views our menus - a definite downer to start a dining experience. Also, there has to be a better way for the kitchen to communicate. We kept hearing the kitchen manager yell out throughout our meal. It was as if we were hearing someone speaking on a muffled megaphone at a country fair. Maybe pipe in some soft music or white noise that offices use to provide a nicer customer experience? Food was ok, but the aforementioned distracted from dining experience.<br>And, the bathroom had only cold water and overflowing used paper towels in its garbage bin.

Have lunch here frequently.  I usually get one of the salads which are very good.  This time I decided to try the stuffed burger and upgrade to sweet potato fries.  The cheese was no longer in the burger, but on the bun, which was extremely messy.  $1 to upgrade to sweet potato fries, which I&#39;m okay with if you get a good amount, this was not.  I also ordered a glass of the house wine, and got something else and was not aware until we got the bill and it was $2.50 more.  Plus it took very long to get our order.

3.75 Stars <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is always busy and they do not take reservations.  It is located in the mall, so just grab a pager and then go shopping and you can return once the buzzer sounds.  The service is very quick for always being so packed.  They give you a free bread basket and butter.  The pumpernickel bread is very good and right out of the oven.  My favorite dishes are the Four Cheese Pasta, Bang Bang Chicken, Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo, and the bowtie pasta.  Almost all the pasta dishes are very good.  Be warned that the portions are huge and fit for family style dinner.  Sharing is caring.<br>The cheesecakes are also very good.  My favorite is the strawberry cheesecake, which is just the original with strawberries on top.  It adds a good freshness to cut the heavy cheesecake and cream.

This place has some of the most amazing dessert!<br><br>However on this particular night, we just grabbed salad. Our waitress was very attentive, but when I asked for extra dressing, she gave me a disapproving look and even commented &#34;You know dressing comes on the salad right?&#34; Even the guy I was with was like &#34;Damn, she&#39;s judging you.&#34; Service was pretty quick, but every time she came by, I felt like I got the look of disapproval.<br><br>Not a deal breaker by any means, but last time I checked, we were out for dinner not a second opinion. The food is good, but I&#39;d probably order take-out unless you want to be judged.

Since the day it opened I have never understood people&#39;s fascination with this place. The food is very average at best; the atmosphere, suburban mall ugly (especially the views of the parking garage from the large windows); and the cheesecake, nothing special. As a Chrismas treat, I purchased an entire cheesecake from the take-out counter at the bargain price of $55.95! That&#39;s correct - almost $60 for a cheesecake!! Of course, shame on me for buying it; that was about double the price I would have paid in a local bakery which puts out delicious cheesecake. Anyway, if you don&#39;t mind being overcharged for what is at best slightly better than average food, this is definitely your cup of tea. If not, there are many, many other better options in the KOP area. Try one of them instead.

I never had a bad experience at any Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;ve been to ones in many states. My last experience here was a disaster.. My sister and I sat at our table for 15 minutes before our waitress (Regina M) even came over.. After taking our drink order we decided to jus order everything so we wouldn&#39;t have to wait longer.. At this point we are now at the table 5 minutes after ordering and still we had no bread at our table. When our waitress finally came back over and we requested it, she responded with a slight attitude &#34; I&#39;m getting it now&#34;. I&#39;ve never had to wait for bread at any restaurant.. when we finally got our entrees, we had to tell the waitress that we never even received our appetizers of Dynamite Shrimp , for which she looked confused and said she was going to look for them.. after 10 minutes she came back with them and they were not good at all they were not Spicy. When i spoke with the manager to let him know about my concerns he responded very dismissive which i was very disappointed with.. I hope no one else has this experience.

Go during off-hours to avoid long wait times.  My wife and I recently arrived at 4 pm on a Sunday and were seated immediately.<br><br>I had the Korean BBQ Chicken Sandwich with fries.  I really enjoyed it -- the chicken is super tender and has a thin crispy coating, not overly breaded at all.  Fries are served in one of those heated metal cylinders which keeps them hot throughout your meal, it was a nice surprise. The fries came with two little cups, one filled with ketchup and the other with a spicy mayonnaise-based dipping sauce.<br><br>My wife had a Cuban sandwich with a small side salad instead of the fries.  It was equally good &amp; she only ate half the sandwich (we took the other half home in a doggy bag).

Cheesecake Factory is an awesome restaurant with a huge menu. If you&#39;re looking to eat healthy do not order off the regular menu. They are caloric nightmares and have tons of fat. Cheesecake is also very secretive about their stats and only ever have them up when laws forced them too. <br><br>Skinnylicious menu is where it&#39;s at but you still need to be carful there because they can be up to 600 calories. <br><br>I usually get the tuna carpaccio as my enter and enjoy it with a few prices of bread. It is large thin slice raw tuna with avocado and a delicious soy based sauce. Their pumpernickel bread is warm and amazing and a great accompaniment for a lunch under 400 calories. <br><br>Cheesecakes of course are amazing but only if you want to ingest 900 plus Val&#39;s

Stopped in here to fuel a day of retail therapy. Being 12:30 on a Sunday, there was a 20 minute wait for a table for 4, but the time quickly went by as we all stared at the variety of cheesecakes offered, of which there are plenty! After we were seated and ordered, the food took a good while to arrive, but the restaurant was visibly packed, so the wait was understandable. I had the Thai lettuce wraps, which never fail to disappoint, and more importantly, leave room for a piece of cheesecake. I had the hazelnut crunch cheesecake which is quickly becoming my favorite; who wouldn&#39;t want a cheesecake topped with Nutella!?

I have never seen a Cheesecake Factory with as a ridiculous wait time as this location. An hour and a half to be seated??? And then the line just to order Cheesecake is insane. How come I haven&#39;t had this issue at other locations such as Princeton and Cherry Hill?? The food is not that good to wait even 30- 45 min.  I refuse to go to this location and caution against others to attend this location as well.. unless you have 4 days to wait for a table. Go around the corner to California Pizza Kitchen (that&#39;s what we ended up doing)- great food and friendly service and a reasonable wait time.

If you can&#39;t find something on their extensive menu, you&#39;re in trouble.  If you like martinis, try the Strawberry Infused Martini - a bit pricey, but excellent.   Frequently a long wait at the Cheesecake Factory so you need to be aware of that on weekends.  Attached to King of Prussia Mall with easy access.

I really have limited critiques of CF. I will preface with I was an employee back in 2004-2005. They make just about everything there in the kitchen, minus the desserts. The wait can be long if you go during peak times and i rarely order alcohol since I think it&#39;s overpriced. <br><br>But the menu is extensive. You could go there everyday for a year and not order the same thing twice. I love their salads. They are huge ( even the lunch portions). I always get the Santa Fe  salad. It was chicken, beans, corn, tomatoes, tort strips, cilantro, and mixed with cilantro lime dressing and drizzled with a peanut sauce. To.die.for. when I&#39;m watching the calories I order from their skinnylicious menu. The beet and goat cheese salad is divine and I&#39;ll pair that with one of their skinny taco options. <br><br>I suggest if you want to go with a short wait, avoid weekends. Weekdays are good, right at 11, when they pen or after 2. For dinner go right at 5 before the crowd comes in.

Was in for lunch today with my family. We were very happy with our food. I&#39;m posting this review because I wanted to acknowledge how much we liked our server, Leigh. <br><br>She had a really friendly, upbeat personality. It was my grandmother&#39;s first time at the Cheesecake Factory, and Leigh was SO sweet to her. When my grandmother said that in 94 years she had never tried cheesecake before, Leigh replied &#34;94? You don&#39;t look a day over 21!&#34; and my grandmother was absolutely tickled by that. <br><br>Also, my parents accidentally left their credit card in the billfold and Leigh chased us out into the mall to give it back to them. <br><br>We all really appreciated the exceptional service. We will definitely be asking for Leigh when we come back :)

I would give this place zero stars if that was an option. Third and last time I am dining here. Came as a party of 9 and was brought back to a table large enough to hold a maximum of 5 people after a long wait. The manager was extremely rude and provided no resolution, only came up with poor excuses. Do not recommend this place.

Wasn&#39;t impressed. Took them about 10 minutes to seat us after they said our table was ready. They ran out of fettuccine noodles and the grilled pork chop was tough and the entire plate of food was cold. I doubt I&#39;ll be going back

Ok so overall I&#39;ve had a pretty good experience here but the last time I went...not so great. <br><br>The food was eh. But the service was horrible! Like absolutely horrible. I had to ask for the check when I got my lunch because I wasn&#39;t sure when she would be coming back to check on us.

Unbelievably slow and poor service. We were seated immediately but it took at least 10 minutes for our waiter to show up for drink orders. 15 minutes later drinks showed up. Then, when dinner came, I ordered a glass of wine... that never came. Of course it was on the bill. We asked for dessert menus to order to go and it took him 15 minutes to come back. At least the food was good...

Your typical Cheesecake Factory, except this location makes my favorite Cheesecake Factory entree so much better AND larger than any other Cheesecake Factory I have been to: The Chicken Bellagio!<br><br>Expect a wait, even at odd hours during the day (2-4 pm), especially on weekends. We waited forty minutes for a table at 3 pm. My parents are normally not impressed with chain restaurants/food, but they were with our meal here. <br><br>Fish and Chips were excellent.<br><br>My dad&#39;s steak was not - we have had better (granted, it&#39;s not Ruth&#39;s Chris), and his was cooked too long (he wanted med rare and it came out med well) but they gladly took it back and cooked up another one more to his liking.<br><br>My mom&#39;s turkey half-sandwich, salad, and soup lunch special was huge. Note: different soups on different days of the week but it&#39;s the same rotation.<br><br>Service is pretty decent considering how busy they constantly are... and as always, their cheesecake slices are huge and delicious.

While at a conference we decided to get the ​Cheesecake factory curbside​ pickup.  The food was good, however, why order ahead only to have to wait at the counter for 20 minutes for your food.  A note for others, don&#39;t prepay and include a generous tip.  The service at the counter was certainly not worth any tip at all.
50 minute wait on a Saturday night after 5pm ...  Wow, they really need call ahead seating or reservations

Yummy...I love The Cheesecake Factory. Their menu has a huge selection and I could easily eat here everyday, but sadly, I&#39;d be as big as the restaurant in no time! Fortunately, they do now have their skinny menu and most of the time, I just order off of that menu. The meals are 590 or less calories and still very flavorful. Although portion sizes are smaller than off their normal menu, you likely won&#39;t walk out hungry. That&#39;s because the portion sizes off of their regular menu is ridiculous! I really like the various Mexican dishes that they have here and often go with the chicken enchiladas.  For starters, we really like the taquitos. We&#39;ve had several of their cheesecakes but our favorites are the vanilla bean and the Snickers, although I&#39;m looking forward to trying their new S&#39;mores coming later this month!! <br><br>Service has always been good. Downside is that this place is always packed and they do not take reservations or do call ahead seating. We arrived most recently around 4:00pm on a Sat afternoon and the wait was 60 minutes. By the time we left at 8:30 or so, the line was out the door just to put your name in, and the wait was up to 75 minutes. I heard they have a nice brunch on Sundays....gonna have to give it a try one of these days!

There was a huge waiting line and I was told we&#39;d have to wait 50 minutes. So we took our beeper and walked around the mall. Only about 30 minutes had passed and my beeper rang! This is because we were willing to sit wherever seating was first available. Our table was outside but we did not mind because it was such a beautiful night. <br><br>The waiter was friendly and professional. She served us our drinks, gave us bread and took our order. The brown bread is delicious with butter. I even asked for seconds. <br> <br>The portions were huge! I ordered the Thai lettuce wrap and buffalo wings for appetizer. For our entree, we ordered the crusted chicken romaine and cajun jambalaya pasta. It was so much food for 4 people. So we packed our leftovers to go. <br><br>I would definitely try it again and save room for dessert.

Third time here and definitely last...service was horrible...over an hour till we had our entrees...server brought us the wrong appetizer and the replacement wasn&#39;t brought till we got our meals....and then he charged us for both appetizers....brought us our check without even asking if we wanted dessert... and then we ordered cheesecake to go which took another 25 minutes...never going back...plus the food was okay nothing special

First and foremost they have great cheesecake! I always get the white chocolate caramel macadamia nut cheesecake and it&#39;s awesome!! <br><br>As for the food? It&#39;s hit or miss. Avocado Eggrolls are so good. I love those and wish I could replicate them to save me the hour long trip to here. I&#39;ve also had the grilled Portabella on a bun which is also good.<br><br>Last time I went I ordered the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta. Yuck!!! Barely any sauce, no richness just heat. Luckily I brought it home and made my own cream sauce to salvage the leftovers. We&#39;ve also gotten burgers which are big and fat but rarely juicy. <br><br>My advice? Stick to the appetizers and cheesecake!
The wait be real long that sehyo give it three stars, however the food n service is five star!!!

Excellent value! One of my favorite restaurants considering price, variety and taste. May I recommend the mac and cheese and tex mex egg rolls? Fantastic! My fiancé and I will customarily order nothing but appetizers - this is where Cheesecake Factory shines.<br><br>The only downside is the long wait. You can anticipate 30-60 minutes on average.

The best part of this meal was that they have this &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu, so I could get something without a ton of butter, cream, sauce, fried stuff, etc. And keep track of my calories and have a pretty good idea where they were coming from. I had the salmon with grilled veggies (several hundred fewer calories on the skinny menu than the &#34;same&#34; thing on the regular menu which tells you a lot about how they prepare their food... probably a lot of butter!). I don&#39;t remember what my partner had for dinner because for dessert he got some insane cheesecake that had reese&#39;s cups and butterfinger and was sensational. <br>Things to know: there were only two of us at maybe 6pm and we had to wait 45 mins. By the time we were being seated, the wait was over an hour. It was totally packed. The girls in charge of taking the buzzer, printing out your little ticket, then looking at each ticket to seat each party, kept accidentally putting away tickets for parties they hadn&#39;t seated, which meant things got very backed up. <br>Given how busy it was, our service once we were seated was very good.<br>Also if you&#39;re given a buzzer, make sure yours lights up with a red number at the tip, because mine didn&#39;t and when I came back to the hostess to ask about it she said the battery had died. My wait could have been waaay longer!
Gumbo, wondrous &amp; mouth watering dish!  Includes Chicken, Shrimp and Smoked Sausage. With diced peppers along with tomatoes! Excellent service and wonderful management

My sister and I went here for a birthday brunch. There was about 18 of us and I liked that we were not on top of each other at the table. I ordered a whiskey drink, I forget what it was called but it was really good. I also got the Monte Cristo which was delicious! That is probably my new favorite meal from there. My sister got the garlic pasta which she liked but there was nothing spectacular about it. We also tried the vegetable tempura and that was really good too. For desert we had Chris&#39;s famous cheesecake which I didn&#39;t like, and the 7 layer chocolate cake. It was huge! But it was really good! There is always a wait here so make sure to call ahead!

The Cheesecake Factory in King of Prussia has great service, an amazng menu with very well prepared food, every time. The desserts are epic and scrumptious!! I always try to eat dessert first, because lifes short, so why not?<br>Great, fast, friendly service with good recommendations when asked. The envirnment is clean, properly lit and decorated and enjoyable. I truely enjoy eating at this location when I&#39;m around the mall or in the area.

Yummy cheesecake! I got the vanilla bean and it was creamy and smooth and just so good...and HUGE. Also very rich, so I couldn&#39;t finish the whole thing in one sitting. Good for leftovers though. Their banana cream cheesecake is also great.

I can always count on a good meal from The Cheesecake Factory. We went between the lunch and dinner rush so we didn&#39;t have to wait. The service was friendly and fast. As usual, the portions were huge. I really like that they have a calorie conscious food and drink menu.
The King of Prussia location is one of the best restaurants in the national chain. Good service and good food no matter the time you get there.

The services is always particular slow at this location. The last time I was there it took almost an hour to get salad and chicken lettuce wraps.<br><br> It doesn&#39;t help that this location is always jammed and screaming loud with people. It&#39;s almost impossible to order because of the volume.<br><br>I appreciate there new text messaging reservation. This allows you to at least shop while you are waiting for your table.

The wait to the sits here is ridiculous. People sit on the ground to wait 2 hours to get sits. No worth it, not fun... Maybe they should change their waiting system to texting do people can go walk around and do other things while they wait and just get a text message when their sit is ready.

I arrived put my name in for a party of 2. They told me the wait would be 40 minutes which was fine. They said they were out of pagers and would print out my receipt showing that my name was in. They told me to come back within 20 minutes for a pager to wait, which was fine. I walked back to the front gave my receipt, they told me they already paged me and skipped. I was upset but not distraught. What really ruined my night was being sat and having another server kick me out of my seat !!!!! She said, &#34; this isn&#39;t your seat, are you supposed to be here? I&#39;m going to ask you to leave and have a good night!&#34; As if I didn&#39;t wait in line like everybody else. I was very offended and felt like I wasn&#39;t welcomed. I was embarrassed along with very upset as I was kicked out of my planned dinner. Everyone around our seat saw how offensive this action was. I went to the front and explained and they wanted to sit me next to the same people with the same server after we went through this embarrassment. I was very disappointed with the management and staff of King of Prussia&#39;s Cheesecake Factory and will not be returning, due to the fact no one resolved this issue and I ended up leaving very unhappy as hungry!

The food is OK and fairly priced, with a large menu so it&#39;d be hard not to find something you like.  Leave room for dessert.  <br><br>However, it seems to be perpetually busy, with a long wait to get in and no reservations taken.  Definitely a turn-off.<br><br>Bring ear plugs to make it quieter.

My friends and I were visiting the area and decided to come to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner at 9pm. We sat outside on Monday 9/5/16. When we were being seated we heard a girl (obviously working patio) says &#34;ugh great. I&#39;m gonna kill myself&#34; making us feel as though she did not want us to sit out there. When she approached me and my other friend while the other two people with us were using the restroom, she slammed the bread basket down and said &#34;what can I get you to drink&#34;. I responded and said &#34;I would like a diet&#34;. She returned to get the drinks and while she was coming in the door as my friends were coming out she was mocking me saying &#34;I&#39;ll have a diet&#34; in a rude condescending tone to her accompanying server on the patio. Our servers name was Emily. However I do not know the name of the other server on the patio who, while our server was taking our order walked by and said, &#34; I hate me life&#34; and our server discretely responded &#34;same&#34;. I did not witness this myself, one of the people I was with did. Me and my friends have NEVER been treated so terribly. We are all servers ourselves and know it can be frustrating at times but this was absurd. When we asked the hostess for a manager, no manager came. We believe the also rude hostess never said anything to the manager on duty. We feel extremely disrespected and will not be back. Food was okay, not bad but not great either. There were things missing from our order, chicken as a topping on a salad and no jalapeños on the nachos. Small things that usually we would pay no mind to but we believe was done intentionally. We felt rushed by not only our server but by the other server with the braids on the patio as well. If I had a dollar for every time the two servers on the patio had rolled their eyes or loudly stated walking past not only our table but others &#34;I am going to kill myself&#34; we wouldn&#39;t have had to pay for our $128.00 meal. We spent a lot of money and tipped 20% because that is in our nature. The server did not deserve it, but we will not stoop to the level of the employees you currently have working there.  <br><br>If you would like to see what good service looks like, when you are serving 12 tables at once instead of 3, come visit the brickyard in Williamsport. We&#39;ll show you how it&#39;s done.
Cheesecake Factory has always been great place to eat but it&#39;s an extra special treat to have the waiter be so nice and attentive.

We dined on a Wednesday night in July with a party of 4 adults. Arrived at 7:20pm to a 40 minute wait. We were seated at 8pm. The waitress came over quickly with water and asked if we wanted other drinks. She the suggested we take a minute to look at the menu. She returned 20 mins later to take our order. In the meantime, I used the ladies room which was completely unkept - the stalls were dirty, one of three dispensers had paper towels, and there were disposable soap containers on the very wet sink top. We placed our drink and dinner order. One person ordered a tap beer and someone else an iced tea. Both came out within a reasonable amount of time. We waited 35 minutes for our dinner order to come to the table. We did not order appetizers but stopped our waitress at one point to ask if our table was going to get bread to which she replied they ran out and walked away without offering an alternative even with the long wait for food. Our dinners arrived and one member received the wrong meal: steak with salmon instead of steak with shrimp scampi - his was returned to the kitchen and brought back 10 minutes later. While eating dinner we had to get the attention of our inattentive waitress to ask for water refills for the first time since being sat. Everyone was happy with their meal. We ordered 3 slices of cheesecake that took 10-15 minutes to be brought out. Very good. Boxes and check was brought promptly while the server was clearing the salt/pepper off the table to refill. Felt a bit unprofessional. For $115 for 1 beer, 1 iced tea, 2 steak dinners (1 with side of shrimp scampi with 3 shrimp), 1 taco dinner and 1 shrimp pasta (with 5 pieces of shrimp), and 3 pieces of cheesecake I wasn&#39;t impressed and wouldn&#39;t plan to return given all the other restaurant choices in King of Prussia.

My first experience at the Cheesecake Factory was good. I got pasta and it was great. Honestly I wasn&#39;t expecting it to be that good. I couldn&#39;t even get dessert because I was so full! I like how they give you bread in the beginning. Next time I go I definitely have to try their desserts! The server was okay, I felt as if she could have been nicer. We had to wait for over 30 mins to get a table which I heard is normal but I would never wait 2 hours to eat here (I&#39;ve heard many people have). Overall my first time experience was good!
Food was good, but the service was slow and the ladies room was disgraceful by 4:00 pm. I don&#39;t understand how they can have an amazing dessert menu and not make a decent cup of coffee.

For as big as the mall is, I thought this location would have decent service. Our appetizer was flavorful &amp; decent, which is why I give this place an extra star. We waited 20 mins for a server to take our order for drinks. I ordered the shrimp tacos that had zero flavor. Even the side of broccoli had zero flavor, even after adding copious amounts of salt &amp; pepper. My husband&#39;s spicy chicken chipotle pasta was bone dry, it didn&#39;t have enough sauce. Last, our server never came back to refill any of our drinks.

We were not able to go to the affair in Philadelphia for which we were scheduled, so, since we had not eaten since 9 am and it was now 4:30, we felt we should eat somewhere. We headed for the King of Prussia Plaza, and, after exploring a bit, came upon a really-good-sized menu outside one of the doors at the Plaza. We were impressed with the variety of food items which you can get at the Cheesecake Factory (I didn&#39;t want any cheesecake for dinner, so I didn&#39;t have any), so we went in and were seated immediately, since there wasn&#39;t much of a crowd. We were served by  Ally, a young lady who was very personable and took our order as soon as we were ready to order. Our drinks (iced tea) were quick to arrive and our entrees were presented in a reasonable amount of time. My wife had a salmon dish and I ordered a specialty hamburger with very good fries. It was a BIG burger, which I thoroughly enjoyed, and our server checked back several times to make sure everything was all right . We had a nice dinner and skipped on dessert, since we had done very well already, thank you. The price was very reasonable and the staff was pleasant and efficient.  I would say we would come back again next time we are in the area and looking for food.

Since they do not take reservations, we walked up to the desk and prepared for a excruciating wait for mediocre food. The woman at the desk said tables were available outdoors currently or it would be a forty-minute wait for indoor seating. Not a fan of car exhaust mingling with our cheesecake, we opted to wait. <br><br>After thirty minutes of watching mall weirdos, the pager buzzed. We handed over our pager, and then a small piece of paper was put in the holder ... which was apparently the next part of the waiting game. When our name was called, they announced the wrong party-size AND proudly announced the our OUTSIDE table was ready. I quietly corrected the server on the party size and location. Thus ensued a conversation between this woman and the one behind the desk ... WHO THEN TORE UP THE SLIP OF PAPER WITH OUR NAME AND GAVE US ANOTHER PAGER AND TOLD US TO WAIT AGAIN. Had it not been for one member of our party begging us to stay (because he didn&#39;t have the will to seek another place), I would have snapped that pager in half and shoved it in the cushions of the leather chairs over by Urban Outfitters (I rehearsed this in my mind many times). <br><br>When the pager went off the second time, we silently handed it back in (in one piece, against my better judgement). The little slip of paper was again put in the holder ... where we stood again (it&#39;s like something out of the absurdest film Brazil). A new server, came for our party AND ANNOUNCED THE WRONG SIZE AGAIN. I corrected him. We all sat down at a booth and the server THEN brought over ONE fewer menus ... saying he was confused. (Well, he was clearly not alone in this).<br><br>BTW, there was never an apology for the major waste of time. NEVER. (I don&#39;t drive to KoP to wait FOREVER (TWICE!) for a table at a chain restaurant). <br><br>The food was okay (it always is) but the experience was so HORRENDOUS that we will not return here. EVER! Maggianos is located on the perimeter of the mall, and they take reservations (and you can also place that reservation on your iPhone!) Go there!

I do love the Cheesecake Factory, mainly for their consistency in their meals, the variety and amount of food they offer, and of course the delicious cheesecake.  You can find either a menu item under $10, or find a more expensive item for $20-25 and both taste great.  Downside to the Cheesecake factory (at pretty much any location) is the wait times!  No reservations, but they clearly know they don&#39;t need them because people will wait 2 hours.  My last wait time was 1.5 hours, but we had a very large party and already agreed on eating there.  It can also get pretty loud there so not the place to be at for quiet romantic evening.  If you are lucky and there are only 2 of you the seats by the bar are first come, first serve.  Overall great food, great cheesecake, sucky wait!

I have to I can&#39;t give a star at all I went through 2 meals and were HORRIBLE. 1st order was shrimp scampi no flavor sauce tasted like flour and water with dried parsley.. sent it back tried the grilled fish tacos. I should have sent that back as well fish was dry rubber no flavor not even a touch of salt. With that said the waitress new I was unhappy never did the manager come to see what the problem was.. won&#39;t be eating at any Cheesecake Factory again!!

the only reason this isnt a 5 star review is because of Miss Grace H. <br><br>crusty ray romano? fabulous. <br>mac n cheese burger? out of this world. <br>cesaer salad? best of all. <br>cake? big n strong. <br>cheesecake? painstakingly delicious. <br>a one ms. grace H? returned multiple attempts to compliment her singing fell flat with nothing but a bad tude and an ignorance of the iconic anthem, &#34;Childs Play.&#34;<br><br>in her defense, it was busy. but that doesnt mean your drake references should be mediocre or foggy. just disappointed, especially from a pop culture standpoint.

This place is great. It&#39;s your standard casual dining food. They have a great menu selection and huge portion sizes. The cheesecake is where they really shine though and they are all fantastic. <br><br>The biggest downfall is the very long wait times. I rarely can actually get a seat during normal dining times. They do not have a call ahead or reservation system, so be prepared to wait (sometimes for hours).

Had a wonderful experience tonight at the KOP Cheesecake Factory. The service was slow, BUT the food was amazing. I had a frozen strawberry daiquiri that tasted like fresh strawberries. We had the buffalo blasts for an appetizer, and for dinner my boyfriend had the chicken tacos and I had the garlic noodles with grilled chicken. Our meals were cooked perfectly and were full of flavor. We will definitely be back!
This place never disappoints. Great food, good service, huge menu, and of course awesome cheescake. Always look forward to going out to the Cheesecake Factory.

Came here on a weeknight. Got seated right away for a party of seven. I ordered the chopped salad, the portion is big. My son got the Mac n cheese and the other one got chicken tenders. We were almost done and I looked over and he still got 3/4 bowl of his Mac n cheese left. He said, it doesn&#39;t taste good. I took a taste test and oh lord.... it was watery and tasteless. I called over our waiter and told him about the issue. He said, he can give us another one or take it off the bill. Seriously...I don&#39;t think my dog will even eat it. It was so gross. Please take it off the bill.... poor kids that ate this that day... they wouldn&#39;t know any difference. I just hope the chef will taste it before serving it.

My teenagers love it here. However, the last few times we&#39;ve been here the service seems very rushed. On our visit 6/24/17 we were not even given app plates for our appetizers and bread. I&#39;m still giving it four stars because the food is dependable, the mixed drinks are good, and the cheesecake is delicious. Attention to detail and cleanliness could be improved.

I visited this restaurant for my birthday on Wednesday with my sister and mother.  When we entered the restaurant, we waited. Although there was no line of customers to be greeted and seated.  The hosts were not at their posts and the employees assisting customers at the cheesecake case did not acknowledge us. When the hosts finally arrived to seat us. They did not welcome us and ushered us to the front of the restaurant and/or bar area.  My family is African American and the reason why I am noting this is that me and my family were greeted with cold and unwelcome stares from the Caucasian employees at the restaurant which is unacceptable behavior.  The Caucasian female initially assigned to our table acted like she did not want to serve us so her co-worker, a person of color, offered to do so.  After we were seated, we ordered lemonades. The rims of the glasses were covered in sugar although we had not ordered margaritas or alcoholic beverages. This could have been very problematic as my sister has diabetes.  I informed the server or waiter that it was my birthday and ordered a cheeseburger with fries.  When the food finally arrived, the bun on my burger was charred. The outside of the burger was burnt and the inside was raw.  The waiter apologized as he had not even bothered to ask me how I wanted my burger cooked i.e. rare, medium, well done.  He took the hamburger back while I hungrily waited for him to reappear.  He eventually returned after my sister and mother were finished with their meals with a burnt burger that was too burnt for consumption.  It felt and tasted like they had just cooked the old burger even longer.  I informed our server about the second burnt burger and he brought the manager who wanted to know if I wanted to give it a third try????  I declined the offer and ordered soft chicken tacos instead.  My sister&#39;s meal was gumbo with cheddar sauce???  Anyone familiar with this cuisine knows that it should never be made with cheese.  My experience at this establishment was horrible to say the  least. I have visited this restaurant in the past albeit years ago and the service and food had been excellent. I often referred to cheesecake factory as my favorite restaurant and so I was very disappointed and ashamed that I had recommended that we celebrate here.  Neither me nor my family or any family of color deserves to be treated as described at this chain restaurant.  All they will remember is how badly we were treated and the sub-par quality of the food.  I agree that the cheesecake is now &#34;so so&#34; and/or average.  We had wasted so much time at the restaurant that we decided not to proceed with our planned shopping trip and simply returned home.

I&#39;ve been here a few occasions,  but don&#39;t plan on returning unless it&#39;s just to have their dessert. The food isn&#39;t all that great and it&#39;s ridiculously overpriced. $24 for bang bang shrimp  (maybe 8 small shrimp) with sauce and white rice???!! No thanks. My girlfriend and I have always enjoyed the food over at The Grand Lux cafe much more. Next time we&#39;re in the area, that will likely be our go to place instead. Their prices are much better.

This place must have an exceptionally large air conditioning bill, i cant say I have ever ate in a place so cold. My family walked in and sat down and the first thing we notice is that the silverware is dirty with bits of food still on it, not appetizing. They get us new silverware, and our waitress was really nice about the situation and apologetic. As for the food, it kills you to look at the menu and see that the lowest calorie dish is a salad at over 1,000 calories. I chose the bacon burger and it was 1700 calories. That leaves me with 300 calories to use in my daily standard calorie intake. The prices were a bit high but the food was alright. A solid two star.

This place is a joke. They do not take resverations, came here on a Saturday and the place was jammed pack. Line was out the door. Was given a piece of paper that said we had to wait 45 minutes for a table for two. Fine. Came back in 45 minutes later just to wait in a different line for another 20 minutes. When we got to the front desk, we were given a pager thingy. We had to wait for another 15 minutes. The wait would be fine if the food was good. The food sucked. I got a lousianna chicken pasta, the pasta was dry, oily and it was just so hard to eat. My finace got one of their chicken sandwich special. The fries that came with it was hard and cold and one of his bread was completetly burnt. The only reason why we gave this place two stars is because our waiter was very nice and attentive for such a busy night. Only come here for the cheesecake.

Came in on a Thursday night around 9pm and it wasn&#39;t too busy, thankfully, as I often see people waiting out front. <br><br>I&#39;ve had cheesecakes before, but never have I had dinner her, so it was time to give it a try. My husband ordered the fish and chips, which came with coleslaw. He said he liked it, and I have to say, it did look good and not too greasy. I ordered the seared tuna tataki salad from the skinnylicious menu. Only 600 calories or so, if I have to believe the menu. It looked like a really small salad when it came out; however, it was more than enough. It comes with delicious slices of seared tuna, lettuce, tomatoes, avocado and a soy sauce dressing. <br><br>Obviously, I ordered from the skinnylicious menu because I was saving up for dessert. ;-) I ordered the red velvet cake cheesecake and my husband a chocolate tower something something cheesecake. His was massive and had so many layers. It was very rich in chocolate for sure. Mine was delicious, although I would&#39;ve preferred more red velvet cake. <br><br>I&#39;ve had the apple caramel streusel before and I liked that one better, but hey, there are so many to try out, it&#39;s insane. <br><br>Heard good things about their brunch - will go sometime soon.

I recently went to the Cheesecake Factory for the first time. The menu is large (ironically few good choices) and confusing order (i.e multiple appetizer and sandwich pages/inserts). <br><br>I settled on what I hoped to be safe option: a burger. It was dry and lacked flavor. When I received the bill I was charged at extra $1.50. When I asked the waiter, he explained that the extra charge was the slice of cheese. ON A BURGER. <br><br>After I said that the menu did not mention the charge, nor did he, and he offered to take the charge off. A few minutes later the manager approached my table and explained that the charge could not be removed and the cheese charge is not mentioned to customers because they do not &#34;want to offend customers&#34; because they are an &#34;upscale restaurant.&#34;<br><br>lol. <br><br>This place is an overpriced Applebee&#39;s. If you really want to eat at KOP save yourself the money and go to Shake Shack, or if you are inclined to eat processed frozen food I recommend visiting the local supermarket for a bag of frozen chicken tenders. <br><br>Many of their meals are above 2,000 calories. I assume they smother it in butter and amazingly, ITS STILL NOT GOOD. <br><br>I only gave the place 2 stars because our waiter was nice and they gave my friend a piece of cheesecake for her birthday. Needless to say, I have no intention of ever returning.

1.5 out of 2 stars for Food<br>0 out of 1 star for Service<br>.5 out of 1 star for Cleanliness<br>0 out of 1 star for Atmosphere<br><br>We were immediately put off by the detached and bored attitude of our server. She would not look us in the eye and ran through her rehearsed spiel with no emotion at all.<br><br>We ordered the Tex Mex Eggrolls for an app. They had good flavor, but no spiciness at all. Very greasy. For entrees we ordered the chile relleno burger and the smokehouse burger. Both were run of the mill, chain restaurant burgers. Again, no spiciness on the relleno burger. There is however, a reason this place is called the Cheesecake Factory. The pineapple upside down cheesecake was quite possibly the best dessert I have ever had! If I go back here it will be for dessert only.<br><br>The restaurant as a whole is relatively clean but someone desperately needs to dust! Huge dining area with each section divided by highly polished wood that is covered in a layer of dust. Obviously neglected for a long period of time. <br><br>The atmosphere is very cafeteria like. Very loud! Close seating.

Always a good pick.<br>Huge menu, really too big, but always something for any time of day and any person.<br>The appts and cheese cake are always my two favs.<br>I usually can even skip a main encores and just get them.<br>My top picks for apps<br>Cuban rolls<br>Corn Cakes<br>mac &amp; cheese balls<br>buffalo blast<br>Cheesecake<br>Red velvet<br>Pumpkin<br>Key Lime

Ok....I&#39;m an addict....an addict!!!!!!<br><br>The cheesecakes are amazing but so so bad for you. But so delicious!!!!!<br><br>Most people know the deal with the Cheesecake Factory so there isn&#39;t much to Yelp about. <br><br>Here&#39;s the summary:<br>1. You do not go here without ordering dessert! (This is non-negotiable)<br>2. You will wait in line...a long time!<br>3. The menu will be a thick book with never-ending choices<br>4. The bread will be delicious. Do not fill up on bread. (See #1)<br>5. You will be indecisive about getting a fancy drink..but you will eventually break down and order that $10 daiquiri <br>6. You will not finish your main course (See #1)<br><br>**** Bonus tip!!! Most people don&#39;t come for brunch....but they have a classy brunch. Try it sometime!

I had the worst experience in Cheesecake factory last week. The food was okay but the service was bad!! The waitress was unprofessional, never filled our water or ask if we need anything else. After we finished our appetizer, we waited for 35 mins to get our entrees (If we dont ask, I dont know how long it will take). During the 35 mins, she didnt even stop by. I was very disappointed of the service.

This is my favorite spot for solid food. Brunch is amazing with their eggs Benedict and chicken and waffles. I hate to say this, but the brunch is better than Sabrina&#39;s in Philadelphia. People always downplay how good the food here is which baffles me because I haven&#39;t had one bad meal here yet
Used to be good. It has become costly when compared to Carrabba&#39;s for the same fare. Also, their wait time for a table nowadays is killing.

If I was going with the quality of the food i would have given it 1 star i ordered pasta with sausage and was given two tiny pieces of sausage crumble then had to wait over half an hour to get anymore so by the time it came my sister and I had to leave. We got the check where I was charged for sausage AND extra sausage (which I told them I was not paying for) my four stars are given for the outstanding services from our waiter! He was the only waiter for 10 plus tables and was still able to be friendly, and pretty much perfect dealing with the pathetic quality of the food. I wish I remembered his name needless to say he got a very good tip so thank you to him for saving our lunch!

On a Saturday night, do NOT even put this place in your plan to eat here. They do not take reservations &amp; I was told a 70-90 min wait at 4:20pm &amp; at 6:50 was not seated after 3 attempts to even be seated with my party. Management is terrible &amp; no one is accommodating no matter how long we waited. I am in absolute disgust with how we were treated.

Visited: 02/22/2016<br><br>We visited while in KOP to grab a quick lunch. Coming from GA, we all know this is a chain that is pretty much everywhere I look now :D When we visited it wasn&#39;t during the busy lunch rush hour so we were served in a timely manner. Everything was great as usual :) I admit I&#39;m a fan because it&#39;s a go to spot when you&#39;re in certain locations or you know exactly what you want from this place. In all my years of experience with The Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;ve only had terrible service once. Trust me, it was handled, though not as well as it should have from the manager, but handled. Overall, it&#39;s my go to so I&#39;d consider myself a fan.

My friend and I have an annual tradition that consists of Christmas shopping at KOP and having lunch/dinner at The Cheesecake Factory, adult libation necessary (this time it was a Georgia Peach. Brainfreeze inducing goodness!). It&#39;s a pretty amazing tradition.<br><br>Our plan of attack is to share small plates, get a light entree and, of course, end with a hunk o&#39; burning cheesecake. On this particular trip, we shared stuffed mushrooms (cheesy and delicious), sweet corn tamale cakes (absolutely amazing. Get this.), and crab bites (crispy on the outside, but a little mushy on the inside. Still yummy.). For my entree, I got the pear and endive salad. It was really good, the dressing was deliciously tangy. The pears were cooked, though. I think it would have been better with crisp, fresh pears.<br><br>For my dessert, I got the Kahlua cheesecake. IT. IS. TO. DIE. FOR. It has a brownie base and.. oh, man. It&#39;s so good. Actually, writing this made me remember that I had some left over. I left my computer to go to the refrigerator to steal a bite. Yep, that good.<br><br>Our server was a really nice, sweet girl. It was crazy busy in there but she never left us waiting for anything. I&#39;m not sure how she did it, but she was awesome!
Always so good,  I always come for the same thing the bang bang shrimp with the side of succotash I&#39;m always leaving with a doggie bag because you get soo much food loving it everytime

Chicken alfredo was delicious this time around and the cheese cakes here are presented beautifully too. I found it to be a bit on the expensive side, however the good thing is they do give you quite large portions of food and the food itself is VERY filling. We didn&#39;t wait long for our food once we ordered, but it took a long time for our bill to be brought out. Our waitress that evening was a super kind young woman. Props to her for doing a fantastic job on a crowded weekend!
Ordered curbside pickup. My food took longer to prepare then stated on the call. My salad was decent.

Went there for late lunch Saturday. After previous good exp there, this one was one of the most horrible lunches i ever had. Waitress, Betsy, took 15 mins to even come to our table, then would disappear for long periods of time in the back. Ordered a very simple cheeseburger medium well, came out pink as pink could be. I couldn&#39;t even return it cause our waitress, Betsy, was no where to be found. After looking for our waitress for 25 mins, she finally came to the table and by this point i was so over it i asked for the bill, instead of waiting another 25 mins for her to come back. Took her 15 mins to come back with the check. Just horrible.

I have dined at various Cheesecake Factory locations over the years. The food is good, the portions are huge and the service is excellent. All of those details are consistent. <br><br>I wasn&#39;t particularly impressed this time around, though, because the chicken in my salad had miso sauce on it -- the same sauce on a salmon dish someone at my table ordered. Perhaps someone used the same knife to cut my chicken after they cut my friend&#39;s salmon? Gross.

The Cheesecake Factory is a nice restaurant to dine at but not all the time. It&#39;s very expensive and has huge crowds making it noisy with a long wait. It does not the healthiest of food.  Though the food is very well cooked and delicious, I would recommend this restaurant for a birthday or special event, not for a Friday night dinner. <br>This restaurant gets 3  1/2 stars because it&#39;s not all the hype. Known for their amazing cheesecakes and good food, The Cheesecake Factory is a fancy and expensive restaurant at which to dine. I recommend trying their Chicken Caesar Salad or their Tomato Basil Pasta(picture). The Chicken Caesar Salad is topped with their mouth-watering special Caesar dressing with Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. The Tomato Basil Pasta is light with fresh grilled chicken, fresh mozzarella, and a touch of garlic on Penne Pasta. Though it is a nice restaurant with delicious food, its prices are very high. One of the cheapest meal you can get is around 11 dollars. It&#39;s around a 45 minute to an hour or more wait to be seated to eat.  A long wait doesn&#39;t put you in a happy mood to have a nice meal. Plus there is nowhere to sit while waiting because of the huge crowds of other people waiting. You can choose to sit outside of the restaurant in the mall, stand in the crowded restaurant or go shopping around the mall while waiting for your table. You might think why don&#39;t you make reservations? Well, you can&#39;t because they don&#39;t take reservations. With the big crowds of people waiting brings loud noise, so it&#39;s very noisy in the restaurant. The noise is not peaceful and makes you talk louder to talk to people sitting next to you. The tables are close together making the restaurant feel cramped.

This is a review for Cheesecake Factory located at King of Prussia Mall.<br><br>Blunt, no flavor, below average food and waited for this for 45 minutes jus&#39; to be seated. From reserving our name with the receptionist to the food being served we waited for a little over an hour an half. <br><br>We were 2 of us. I guess those that came in groups or families probably had a longer wait time. <br><br>I have been to Cheesecake Factorys in Delaware, Virginis Beach, Baltimore and Miami. The one at King of Prussia Mall is worst when it comes to food and service. Please if you can look for other options in the area after shopping do so.

We liked the food (at least some &#39;lighter dishes are OK) and the ambiance is good for families, kids and large groups. But our waiter was HORRIBLE. He kept rushing us, trying to take our plates while still eating. On a Monday evening (with the restaurant nearly empty) he brought the check before asking if we wanted a dessert and after ordering a slice of cheesecake, he still brought the check before the cake.....  and came back after 30 second to pick up my credit card. Overall, a TERRIBLE food experience.

My husband and I went here few months ago and the food was terrible. They were out of brown bread the last two times we were there. My food was so disgusting it was inedible so I sent it back and ordered something else. 45 minutes later a cold plate of tasteless food was delivered. I just didn&#39;t bother eating anymore after that as it was obvious the cook was not going to be able to prepare a decent meal. We tried to go back tonight with friends and at 8pm was told the wait was over 2 hours. This is ridiculous. GET A BETTER SEATING SYSTEM OR START TAKING RESERVATIONS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Love their Shrimp Scampi. However, their service is a hit or miss. No one wants service that&#39;s either going to be a hit or miss. One time I ordered the shrimp scampi to go, it didn&#39;t have the garlic cloves in it, which is APART of the dish and mixed in the sauce. To me the dish is not complete without it. The manager on duty came to me with COLD garlic cloves he just yanked out of the refrigerator. I had to go home and put my $20 meal strait in the microwave. It was like my third time not having garlic in my dish. One time I got all the way home with NO garlic and was not driving back, I was pissed. I always try to give this place the benefit of doubt. I was there recently on Easter. As I was going to the bathroom I told the waiter I was ready for the bill. When I came back everything on the table was cleared off. No one asked me if I wanted to take home my leftovers!! I have the servers name but I&#39;m not going to go there. I&#39;m really getting sick and tired of this place. They seem careless to me. I think I&#39;m over it. I have more stories but it&#39;s too much to type.

When I rave about TCF to friends, my enthusiasm is frequently met with a flat response: &#34;It&#39;s a /chain/.&#34; Why is that so bad? My mission is to find great food anywhere. I have no shame in saying that the Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to eat. The menu is massive, the portions are titanic, and there is no shortage of guaranteed-to-be-excellent dessert choices. This is the best restaurant in the mall by far, and perhaps in King of Prussia.<br><br>Buffalo Blasts (Chicken, Cheese and Our Spicy Buffalo Sauce all Stuffed in a Spiced Wrapper and Fried until Crisp. Served with Celery Sticks and Blue Cheese Dressing) - 4.5 out of 5<br><br>Chicken Potstickers (Oriental Dumplings Pan-Fried in the Classic Tradition. Served with Soy-Ginger Sesame Sauce) - 5 out of 5<br><br>Hibachi Steak (Certified Angus Hanger Steak with Shiitake Mushrooms, Onions, Bean Sprouts, Wasabi Mashed Potatoes and Tempura Asparagus) - 5 out of 5<br><br>Thai Lettuce Wraps (Satay Chicken Strips, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Coconut Curry Noodles and Lettuce Leaves with three delicious Spicy Thai Sauces - Peanut, Sweet Red Chili and Tamarind-Cashew) - 4.5 out of 5<br>I love the playfulness of this dish. The flavors are all there. -0.5 for the flavorless noodles used as an accompaniment. Why not toss them in some sesame oil and sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds?<br><br>Chicken Lettuce Wrap Tacos (Butter Lettuce Leaves Filled with Grilled Chicken and Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Cucumber, Cilantro and Rice Noodles with Spicy Cashew Sauce) - A smaller, simpler version of the Thai Lettuce Wraps - 4 out of 5<br><br>SkinnyLicious Asian Chicken Salad (Grilled Chicken, Romaine, Carrots, Bean Sprouts, Green Onions, Cilantro, Rice Noodles, Wontons, Almonds and Sesame Seeds Served with Sesame-Soy Dressing) - 4 out of 5<br><br>Kale Salad (Cranberries, Apples, Marcona Almonds and Green Beans. Tossed with Buttermilk-Black Pepper Dressing.) - 5 out of 5<br><br>Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake - 2.5 out of 5<br>Average. There is only a small amount of cream cheese flavor. The rest of the icing tastes like the generic plain white variety. (There are 10+ cheesecakes that are chocolate/chocolate cake-based; the reason why I ordered the Red Velvet is because it&#39;s the /one/ with cream cheese icing.)<br><br>Oreo Dream Extreme Cheesecake - 5 out of 5<br>Amazing. There are so many different flavors  and textures at work: Oreo cookies baked into the creamy cheesecake add a nice textural contrast, pillowy fudge cake that tastes like the cocoa-y cookie, Oreo mousse, milk chocolate icing that teeters on too sweet, and garnished with the familiar crunch of freshly-crumbled Oreos.<br><br>Dutch Caramel Apple Streusel Cheesecake - 4.5 out of 5<br>This cake is a cross between a luscious cheesecake and the best apple crumble ever, which is a winning combination in my book.<br><br>Key Lime Cheesecake - 4.5 out of 5<br>This cake has a very pronounced tart flavor that cuts the richness of the cake. Every bite is increasingly addictive and leaves you wanting more. The sweetness enrobes the tip of your tongue and the creaminess captures all of your taste buds, leaving the faint taint of fresh lime and tartness to refresh your palate. The macaroon crust is a nice departure from the pedestrian graham cracker.<br><br>Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake - 2 out of 5<br>I&#39;d hoped that this would be my favorite cheesecake, but it was quite disappointing as it tasted too artificial. I would suggest adding some brûléed fresh pineapple, or some acidic component, to wake up the flavors.

I have seen a steady decline in cleanliness, food quality, and service the last few times we have eaten here. The bathroom was dirty, one stall was out of order, and it is very small for the size of the restaurant. <br>Our food was delivered cold, and the coffee was stale. Once they warmed up our food, it was good. <br>The service was very slow.

Of all the cheesecake factory branches, the King if Prussia mall branch has been constantly serving good dishes with good service. With others, it&#39;s been hit or miss. Crossing fingers. Kudos to management for doing a fine job of hiring and training a winning team.

We used to love coming here, however it just keeps going downhill. We had gift cards from the holiday and decided to give the Cheesecake Factory another chance. Big mistake. The service is lousy at best. Our waitress was unfriendly and inattentive. Rushed us to put in our order and never checked back (no drink refills, nothing). We both ordered brunch....I figured I&#39;d be safe with French toast (hard to mess up, right?). Wrong. It was burnt and so hard, it could have been considered a weapon. I needed a serrated knife to cut it. I paid extra for a side of bacon....had to ask for it. Prior to our meals being brought out we requested bread....never got any. My husbands coffee was loaded with large coffee grounds. I ate 1/4 of my French toast and told the waitress it was burnt and hard. She blew it off and just cleared my plate. Just an all around appalling experience. KoP has so many dining options....just go somewhere else.

Went in for lunch and got seated very quickly. I ordered off of the lunch special menu and my friend off the dinner menu. Our waitress was fantastic, she never let out drinks go empty and was very attentive and friendly. The food came and our meals were huge portions. The only reason I&#39;m giving this place place 4 stars is because the pasta I had seemed reheated because it was lukewarm as opposed to the rest of the dish which was fine.

Pretty typical for Cheesecake factory. Novel of a menu that&#39;s fairly overwhelming, very large portion sizes, always very busy, no reservations, service a little on the slower side, and typically sticky tables. Not a huge fan overall, but the food is pretty good, hence the 3 star rating.
Nice. No different than any other CF. Staff was friendly. No happy hour at this location. :(

I&#39;ve been to a couple cheesecake factories and I thought this one was okay. When I got there they said it was a twenty minute wait and it probably ended up being a little less. The table they sat us at was very close to the other tables. I could hear the other table&#39;s conversation the whole time. I got the tex-mex egg rolls and they were okay. I thought they were kind of flimsy and not very crunchy. My boyfriend got the orange chicken, which he really liked and the portion was huge. So all and all, not bad but nothing great.

As a first time customer at the King of Prussia Mall location I am sad to say that not only was our waiter Greg very blunt and dissrespectful, the bread we were given was very hard and as i asked for a refill on my water he procceded to spill water all over the table, then left without trying to clean it or apoligizing. He was rude and almost judgemental about our specific orders. We also overheard him acting the same exact way to the table next to us. We rated it two stars only because the food came out very quick. We were quoted 25 minutes for our wait and it took about 40 minutes to be seated which was only because we asked the host stand how much longer it would be. Very disappointed.

First off the cheesecake.... was delicious.... we tried the macadamia white chocolate cheesecake, raspberry white chocolate and the red velvet. Perfection. <br><br>The food.. well, just no. I got the salmon salad... horrible... i tried the piece of fish that was smothered with herbs.... a horrible sensation on your tongue.
