My husband tried a bite and both of us said our tongues felt like it was burning.. his meatloaf didn&#39;t seem like it was fully ground beef... like it had a lot of filler. He didn&#39;t eat it all... The mashed potatoes were awesome though. My mom had chicken and it tasted and felt like it was microwaved. So disappointing for the cost<br><br>I sent my food back, and got a chicken ceasar salad which was good.. Overall the meal was so disappointing especially for the price you pay. <br><br>Only great thing besides the dessert was our waiter, Christopher, who was very professional, friendly, knowledgable, and charming.

I&#39;m not huge on chain restaurants but this is always a go to.  One updated fact is they will text you when your table is ready so gone are the days you need to stay close with a pager. How refreshing !!  Just know when you come here it&#39;s always a wait ( we waited an hour).  <br><br>Service was great. She was really sweet and attentive. Most of all our service was kind to our daughter. <br><br>All our food came out delicious and within a reasonable amount of time. We enjoyed buffalo blasts, chicken lettuce wraps, and tostado salad. My daughter had pasta and meat sauce. We took home a ton of food and Adams peanut butter cheesecake. Yum

The only reason this location is getting 3 stars is because the portion sizes are decent and the fact that the Cheesecake is delicious. Service is rushed; which I understand it&#39;s a busy mall but seriously pump the brakes; I feel like I get my check before I get the appetizer. The food is also rushed and you can tell; I&#39;ve been there at least 4 times and the only time the food tastes decent is after I&#39;ve had a few drinks. Save yourself the drama and just purchase a slice of cheesecake to go and skip everything else.

Went here to meet a friend for lunch and exchange gifts. We were greeted by a friendly staff member and seated right away upon entering the restaurant from the mall. After placing drink orders and looking over the menu, our waitress kindly answered a few of our questions and offered a few personal opinions upon request before we ordered. Now since my friend and I are lovers of food we ended up ordering a handful of appitizers to share so we would have the chance to try more of the items on the menu. The fried chicken sliders were amazing, especially with a side of their chipotle mayo...the egg roll sampler was good, definitely interesting flavor combos...the calamari was amazing...but the nachos were average, the chips tasted stale and came out soggy from the toppings. For entrees we ordered the Americana cheeseburger and the pasta carbonara which we again shared. The burger was very good, cooked a perfect medium as ordered, juicy and the special sauce was great...while the carbonara was good but the pasta ended up being slightly over cooked. All in all a great meal with really good service and the cheesecake we ordered to go was to die for as well!

I love this place. Never had a bad experience EVER! At one point in time I came here at least once a week. I work near by and today decided out of no where I wanted some Calamari and Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake. I called in to order takeout and it was a while before the phone was answered (after all it was lunch time) and I was greeted very nicely when the phone was answered. My order was placed quickly and efficiently. The calamari was ready as promised in 15-20 minutes and the lady at the take out counter was very pleasant. Kudos to KOP Cheesecake Factory for maintaining such great customer service throughout the years!

Their food is good (for the most part), my salmon filet was burnt once, I didn&#39;t make a big deal out of it because I just like their food so much. Cheesecakes are pricey but very, very good! Service is lacking a little bit though, especially their hosting staff. It was a different hostess girl every time I went there and every single one of them looked very annoyed. It almost looked like they sometimes act like they don&#39;t see us unless we get really close to their counter and that&#39;s when they still don&#39;t say &#34;hello&#34; and take their time organizing their menus.

If there is zero star system I would not give this place a one star.  Party of nine reservation was made and was given a table that fits only 5 people. The manager is full of excuses and extremely rude, borderline racist, showing no willingness to remediate the situation.   We will never go to this place again.

Great cheesecake! I&#39;m not sure if I&#39;ll ever be bold enough to eat here since I&#39;ve always heard that the ccf food is horrible and expensive. Stick to what you know. And I know they make great cheesecakes.

Love this place but can&#39;t give a solid 5 until they start putting that stick of sugar cane back in their Mojitos..<br>Never skip on the chicken lettuce wraps.<br><br>My favorite entrees are Miso Salmon (Ask for extra miso sauce!)<br>and the Kobe Beef Burger...  (I hate mushrooms but I LOVE them on this burger)<br><br>I have a sweet palette so keep that in mind.

We love the cheese cake factory.  This location is always crowded so go early,  sign in,  then do some shopping at the mall.   They&#39;ll text you when your table is ready.  They have done great small plates that are worth sharing.  Try the fried avacodo, it is melt in your mouth delicious.  There are so many choices we usually don&#39;t have a problem keeping the children happy.  <br>Of course you have to have the cheesecake for dessert.  That usually keeps the children happy and behaved during dinner.   The Germann chocolate is my favorite because it is full of good chocolate,  but I don&#39;t think you can go wrong with any of the cheesecakes.

Can not complain about this chain even though I am not a fan of cheesecake.  I love the decor of cheesecake factory restaurants.  Though crowded, the service has been good.  Enjoy coming here just for a quick &#34;snack&#34; and beverage when going to King of Prussia Mall shopping.  Check it out!

Capital Grille was closed for lunch on Sat. Dec 31st, New Year&#39;s Eve, so we checked the wait time at The Cheesecake Factory (which is usually a 45 min wait at 12:30 on a Saturday), and found it was only 20 minutes.  15 minutes later we were seated and had a great experience all around.  The food was perfect (I ordered steak), the service was 5 star quality-- far superior to Sullivan&#39;s (which is at least temporarily on my &#34;I hate them&#34; list).  As of 12/31/16 I have nothing but good things to say about The Cheesecake Factory at the KOP Mall; it is pricey but it was all around worth it!  Of course the company always makes the meal so it helped I was with 3 amazing friends!

On 12/23/16 I bought a whole carrot cake for $54.95 for a birthday party for a family member. When we served it at the party, the universal opinion was that the cake tasted weird and rather stale. The nuts in the cake were not crunchy but rather soft and soggy. We looked for an expiry date on the packaging but we could not find any.<br><br>I called the store at around 8.30pm on the same day and spoke to a manager (who I met the next day when I returned the cake. I forgot his name. He is a tall, older, slender guy, who wears eyeglasses). He asked me to return the cake. He sounded very cold, unfriendly and not understanding. <br><br>The next day, I returned the cake and I was served by the same manager I spoke with the previous day. He was very cold and made me feel like I was mistaken to return the cake. He made me feel I did not know what I was saying. He reluctantly accepted the cake and refunded my money. I was really bothered by his attitude and poor customer service. <br><br>Later that night, I called this same manager because I had forgotten to mention the lack of an expiration label on the cake. He took the opportunity to inform me that he and other staff had tasted the cake I had returned and they thought it tasted fine. I was stunned that restaurant staff would eat a cake that was not in its original packaging and had been out of the restaurant&#39;s possession for over 24 hours!!! This was amazing to me. It spoke of a reckless attitude for dealing with food safety. I am very disappointed with the Cheesecake Factory and my opinion of them  has been severely damaged by my experience. I will never give them my business again. What a disappointment!!!
We are lovers of cheese cake factory. But this one is just crazily crowded with long lines of waiting on Fridays and Saturdays.
I really love The Cheese Cake Factory, great service. This is the first time I wasn&#39;t happy with my meal. I ordered fish tacos and it wasn&#39;t good at all, VERY BLAND!

At 2:00 on a weekday you would think you could get a clean table and good service--not at this restaurant.  We were seated at a dirty table and when we asked for someone to clean it things went down hill.  The dirty bread plate sat on our table the entire meal without being replaced.  The server was just plain rude.  The food was good but I&#39;m not sure we will go back.

Love the food, but not taking reservation is not too pleasing. Waiting in the line for over 2 hours wasn&#39;t fun, they ran out of buzzer, and didn&#39;t even take your phone number to get a hold of you. They food was great, not very diet friendly if your looking to stick to your diet. It took a group of 4 and 1:30 for full service, from app to dessert, which is a long time. I understand being busy but with lot&#39;s of server, waitress, mangers and other staff. <br><br>The food was great but on the higher end of the price point. I got an original margarita which was not mixed correctly. <br><br>Cheesecake was to die for!!

Normally, I like it here. I always have great apps and drinks. Tonight I tried to have dinner with my parents here since we like to meet halfway. My parents were running a little late due to traffic. I tried to get a table and was told I would have to wait until the whole party was there. I was also told there would be no wait. This would have been fine and I understand company policies... but before I was even acknowledged there was a full conversation going on behind the host stand. When my parents arrived, I went up to the host stand. The hostess had forgotten me, which again wouldn&#39;t have bothered me normally because I understand a lot of people come in. When I told her I had been waiting for a while- she laughed, rolled her eyes, and told me I would have to wait... &#34;well now there is&#34; to be exact - meanwhile was still having another conversation behind the host stand. It was incredibly rude and unprofessional. If the hostess was friendly, kind, or at the very most attentive, my family and I likely would have stayed to eat.

My go - to when I am in KOP and I do not want to spend a ton, and want healthy options. <br><br>I have been here countless times and everything the main thing that is consistent is the food. Service is typically good, a handful of times bad and a handful of times great. If it is a weekend night, be ready for a wait as they do not do reservations. <br><br>Food wise the kale salad sliced tuna salad are my favorite thing on the menu - plentiful and cheap. If i am going for a full meal, the pasta dishes are always very good. <br><br>My con to this place is that it is a chain and the service is not always great, the waiters are their to turn and burn and you get that vibe. <br><br>The cheesecake is always very good, obviously.

I was here a few weeks ago with my girlfriend. Went here for lunch and had to wait the standard 30 minutes for a table due to the business&#39;s popularity.<br><br>The treatment you get is variable. Sometimes you get someone waiting on you hand and foot, other times it&#39;s a madhouse. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had the same server twice. The food here though, gives generous portions and is at least a half-step above the Chili&#39;s and TGIF&#39;s of the world (a full step on TGIF actually).<br><br>The food, for its price, is easily 5-stars. The service can be downright mediocre, but sometimes it is exemplary. <br><br>One other negative is that the chicken that they serve with pasta, is with bone-in. When I order pasta, I&#39;d rather have use my utensils only and not have to work my way around a bone. It&#39;s essentially the same thing as shrimp having their tails on.<br><br>Of course, the cheesecake is the highlight of it all. Any meal without that is incomplete. Though normally I&#39;m too stuffed to enjoy it there and just take it home

I really like coming here, but just for some choice dishes that I oft find myself craving. For a huge chain, the service is not bad, but at this location it&#39;s often a long wait for a table (and they don&#39;t take reservations). I definitely recommend coming for lunch - you can get a lot of the items at lunch portions and prices.<br><br>Let&#39;s get on with the food - I love the bread. And I personally always ask for olive oil, balsamic and parm to dip it in. For appetizers, the buffalo blasts and fried zucchini are really good. Entree-wise, I ALWAYS order the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. I&#39;ve asked for it extra spicy a couple times and they were pretty amenable to my requests. One time it was a little much, but hey, I asked for it. It was quite the epic battle. <br><br>I&#39;ve tasted some other dishes with my friends - herb-crusted salmon was kind of...gross, their house salad with balsamic dressing is good. Clam chowder is just okay. <br><br>And while I&#39;m not a dessert person, it IS Cheesecake Factory, so I do order from time to time. Both the strawberry and key lime cheesecakes are very good.

Love this place! The staff is always friendly and personable, no matter how busy it is. The food is great and so are the drinks! I went with former student one afternoon and she used A LOT of butter on her bread. The waiter saw this and surprised her with a &#34;Butter Sundae!&#34; it was hysterical! I was so sweet especially considering how busy they were that day! I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at this location! I gave it four stars because their coffee isn&#39;t good...at all haha but everything else is A+! My fave!

Overall very tasty albeit filling and fattening food.  I really enjoy the chicken piccata although I know 2 Italian broads with a spatula who really make a killer piccata even better than this. No complaints about this facility although food is really meant to be shared I believe.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory for crying out loud. The Cheesecake Factory is amazing. The menu is huge. Their cheesecakes are awesome. Their entree&#39;s are huge. I can never finish my meal. The staff is really friendly. The establishment is clean, which is a must. It&#39;s a little expensive, but so worth it.

I love the Cheesecake factory, but their portions are way too huge for me.  I can only eat half of my dish and it feels like such a waste to throw the rest out.  I&#39;d take the leftovers with me if I werent living in a hotel room the rest of the week.  Thats why I think its great they are offering small plates! I dont know if this is new or not, but I noticed it on the menu and decided to order from it. I ordered the crispy artichoke hearts and the asparagus salad.  The artichoke hearts came out fresh from the oven! Our waiter had to rework his towel so that he didnt burn himself or me when putting the plate down on the table.  The dipping sauce was creamy and delicious! The asparagus salad was very flavorful. It had chopped tomatoes, lemon juice, and fresh parmesan cheese. I was able to finish both small plates without leaving the restaurant feeling uncomfortably full.<br><br>There was 5 of us and we didnt have to wait for a table. Awesome! Service was good too! Our waitress was always refilling our drinks and checked up on us frequently.

Vegetarians- if you&#39;re like me, be warned: the choices are overwhelming! It took me a while to choose between the many apps, entrees, and of course salads on offer.  The veggie burger seems to be house made. Not the most flavorful patty, but lots of fresh veg toppings on it and sauces on it make it flexible.  If you&#39;re not vegetarian, don&#39;t worry: plenty of chicken, beef, and fish for you. <br><br>I ate for lunch, and had my food within 5 minutes of sitting down and finished in 30. Fast, fresh, and good.

Its definitely a good place for lunch. I dont think its incredible because it seems like every time i go there the food is made differently. The menu is huge which is nice but also overwhelming. I go there for lunch during work or a drink but its not my top choice for a date night or when friends  are visiting me.
Seated immediately. Typical Cheesecake Factory....nice wait staff. The chicken on my pasta was dry. Restaurant is noisy as usual. Getting cheesecake to go.

Consistently great food and service. The Skinnylicious menu offers delicious options...try the lemon garlic shrimp pasta! The oreo cookie cheesecake is insane! Bring your appetite...the portions are BIG!

The waitress is SO nice and the food is FAST too. We ordered Pasta Da Vinci and it was super good. The New York steak is pretty good and juicy too, but it was slightly over cooked. This is my first time trying Cheesecake Factory and it has been a great experience. Would definitely visit again.
Excellent!  I had the garlic noodles with shrimp. It was very tasty. The amount of food was alot for the price and of course the cheese cake was out of this world. Can&#39;t wait to go back!

Seymore was in town and had some dinner at this establishment. Now Seymore loves his tuna and he had the ahi tuna special , the tuna was quite tasty however Seymore is no pussy cat and would have liked to have had more tuna on his plate, especially when Seymore is laying out $19 big ones for his main course. This dish mostly contains rice with very few vegetables, the sauce was well done with nice flavor but all in all the dish was disappointing to Seymore. Now you can not go to the Cheesecake Factory and not have cheesecake,  since Seymore was still hungry after his meal he had two pieces of cake, one was the vanilla bean and the other was strawberry, both pieces were delicious , all the folks in this house were more than friendly and nice. Seymore will give this place only 3 stars due to his disappointment with the main course now I will return soon when I&#39;m back in town and give this establishment another try.<br>Peace people.

Like most Americans, I love Cheesecake Factory!  I always crave their Luau salad and even their lunch portion is huge.  <br><br>Whenever I consider the cheesecake, I look up the nutrition and realize 3 days worth of saturated fat is never worth 1 slice of cheesecake.<br><br>I don&#39;t live near one of these restaurants anymore and can&#39;t figure out why Charleston, SC doesnt have one yet!

I have been to three different Cheesecake Factory restaurant and this is the second one that is super super dirty!!!!!  Me and my husband decided to go and get Cheesecake and avocado egg rolls (which are my favorite). I ordered coffee while we waited for our food. I got the coffee, put creamer in it to my shock the cup had dried stuck on lettuce disgusting!!!! I then said to the waitress this is disgusting I don&#39;t want the coffee. Her reaction was not apologetic at all, she&#39;s like oh ok. Like this is normal!!! Needless to say I will not be going back. It&#39;s a shame I do like their food but now wonder if the plate is clean. The last time I was there the bathroom was also disgusting paper everywhere and tampon laying on the floor. Yuck

Not as bad as the overall rating makes it out to be.<br>1. Wait time was 20-30 minutes. You get a buzzer and can walk around the mall to entertain yourself while you wait. <br>2. Casual atmosphere. Wish the lighting was a little brighter but can&#39;t complain much.<br>3. Friendly service<br>4. Overwhelming menu, but the food is good. The cheesecakes are delicious.
always have a good time there the chicken and shrimp gumbo over white rice is my favorite dish
This is our favorite place to eat.  A great selection for the whole family and guests.  It&#39;s always clean and we&#39;ve always had great servers.

Had to write a review of The Cheesecake Factory in KOP because I grew up with it. The service is usually good. The wait is usually long (as the number of nice restaurants in KOP are limited). The bread is always great -- especially the brown bread -- they need to start serving it with olive oil.<br><br>By far, my favorite dish here is the avocado spring rolls. So yummy! I also love the strawberry shortcake with ice cream -- YUM! As far as the cheesecake goes, there are way too many options. I&#39;ve only had the plain once and it was OK.

Bad service, never came to ask for refills on drinks or bread, the bread was hard and old, All of our dishes were horrible, it&#39;s obvious management is not taken serious here , it&#39;s either that or Cheesecake Factory is changing its flavor for the worst

I love The Cheesecake Factory! I will wait any amount of time! It is so worth it! The Pasta da Vinci is so good creamy, chicken with mushrooms, it will melt in your mouth! You can&#39;t go wrong with any of the Chocolate or Strawberry Cheesecakes. By the way, you can go shop while you wait! I came on a snowy night in February! My favorite restaurant in my favorite mall!<br>P.S. The portions are huge!
Truly excellent restaurant but MASSIVE queues day and night.
Good food but as usual the extremely long wait and slow service will make it a long long time before I go to this place again. So frustrating :(

Went to Cheesecake Factory on a Tuesday evening about 7:15pm. Our party of 3 waited about 15-20 minutes which the hostess announced upon arrival. Which was fine.<br>Once seated we had a terrible experience with the server. <br>One of our dinner members ordered gluten free Mexican lettuce wraps... another ordered flat bread pizza without the pecans and a small dinner salad. We waited 40 minutes for our food and when asked why,the server said gluten free takes longer... that was not what happened at all... apparently either the server or the kitchen did not make the first Mexican lettuce wrap gluten free. Instead of telling the truth, the server lied.. the flatbread came with pecans which was discovered after the first bite... complained and sent flatbread back; within 10 minutes the flatbread returned with pecans removed and the first bite out of the piece very apparent... when addressing the server that the pecans were picked off; again lied and said it was a new one; why would we return?

There&#39;s really nothing special about this restaurant. It&#39;s just a glorified Ruby Tuesdays with the ostentatious dial turned way up. The food is OK, but overpriced. They&#39;ve also fallen into the trap of &#34;if we can&#39;t wow you with quality, let&#39;s just overwhelm you with quantity...&#34; My wife and I both felt awful after our meal (and no we didn&#39;t stuff ourselves or have dessert).<br><br>I guess if you need 3000 calories to feed your growing obesity problem and you don&#39;t mind spending a lot more that other places you could get that many calories in one meal... go for it.

We did not have the best experience for dinner.  Service was lacking.  Our server was pretty much nowhere to be found.  I had to flag someone down just to get a simple refill for an iced tea and some ketchup (for my cold fries).  We were looking forward to ordering some cheesecake for dessert but skipped it due to the crappy service.  Highly doubt we will be going back again. I&#39;m sure I will get the same blanket response from the &#34;business manager&#34; that the rest of reviews received.

The food was excellent. I had the cuban sandwich and it was good. The margarita was also good. I wish i could tell about the fries, but our server, Kimberly, forgot them. Kimberly completely forgot our fries and didnt bring them until we were done. I dont think Kimberly tried her best. Also it was so dark i couldnt see the menu or my sandwich and bit my finger. It would be a nice 4 stars, but Kimberly + my sore thumb = 3

This was the worst experience ever of coming to a Cheesecake Factory :( so disappointed and I won&#39;t ever be returning again. The hostess who sat us was miserable as all hell, barely even looked at us and couldn&#39;t even speak to us. After we sat it took 15 minutes for a waitress to come over to ask for a drink order, it took 25 minutes after that to receive them. Along with that came the bread finally. We then waited another 15 minutes to get the food.  When the food did arrive to say it was bitterly disappointing was an understatement. The fries with the sandwich were cold and hard and overly salty. The salad with the other sandwich was dank, wilted and soft. One sandwich had barely any chicken in it and the other had huge pieces of fat running through the chicken (to the point where it couldn&#39;t be eaten). We complained to the hostess about it and immediately the hostess attitude became rude and sulky. The service in general was terribly slow, we were never checked on once. Our food was dropped off by someone else and our drinks were never refilled. We were in the restaurant for nearly two hours that&#39;s how long it took to get two sandwiches and two pieces of cheesecake. We spoke to the waitress about our concerns and comments who then relaid them to the manager supposedly. Not once did a manager ever come over to talk to us. Our cheesecakes were disappointing- hard, tiny pieces (when Cheesecake Factory is known for big pieces of cheesecake). We were ignored and there attitude in general was disgusting and never will I return here again. So saddened by it all. Poor show on Cheesecake Factory.

My friends and I frequent the Cheesecake Factory for both Sunday brunch and dinner.  We went again this past Sunday night, and I still have very little to complain about. There were three of us and we were able to get seated right away at 5 pm. I have to say this is rare as there is usually a wait, but I guess because it was nice outside, people were down the shore or grilling.  Of the 25 or so times I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake, I only had one dish I really did not like (the breakfast burrito for brunch one morning). I usually order the same dish, Chicken Costoletta, and it is delicious every time. The portion size is always enough to have dinner the following night and the price is beyond reasonable for the amount of food you get. I tried the blue cheese and pear flat bread this past trip and while the flat bread could have had a little bit more topping on it, overall it was not bad for $4.95. The cheesecake is always huge and delicious. I normally don&#39;t get cheesecake but was in the mood for something sweet. My boyfriend and I shared the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake (to go), and it was divine. I only ate about 1/3 of it as it was more than enough to satisfy my sweet tooth. I definitely recommend sharing the cheesecake with 1-2 people as it is way to much for 1 person to eat.<br><br>I recommend this restaurant if you are looking for a quick sit-down meal without a lot of privacy. The restaurant is usually loud and crowded and the tables are on top of one another (unless you&#39;re lucky enough to get a booth). The outdoor area though is good to check out during the warmer months and not as crowded or loud.

I don&#39;t write many reviews for chain restaurants but when I read all the rather negative reviews I have to say that I love this place!  I&#39;ve been going to these restaurants for about 20 years now and recently started going repeatedly, at least a few times a month. True there are many choices in KOP but it&#39;s a standout.  The menu is robust with great variety. I love the skinny menu. Some of my favorite things are the summer shrimp rolls, yummy! And I also love the grilled artichoke. I think the service is always excellent especially at the bar (we love Cesar!) Keep doing what you&#39;re doing!

Last time I made a review I complained about how my take out was always wrong.<br><br>Well, they have improved! :)<br>I like it here and I love all the options they have on the menu. Working in the mall my choices are limited so it&#39;s nice to be able to choose from so many options!<br><br>The menu is just okay, but it&#39;s still good food!<br><br>Everyone at the counter when I pick up my take out is always super nice too!
The lady from next table suggested the Asian Lettuce Wrap Tacos were wonderful!<br>The other dished were not bad also.<br>And of cause ,the original cheesecake ,GREAT with no doubt !

I visited the cheesecake factory King of Prussia Location at 7:00pm on Tuesday, August 22, 2017. Following Patio seating, our server, Gregory, promptly greeted us, took our drink order, and returned shortly thereafter for our meal order. The meal order was taken no later than 7:15/7:20pm.  I ordered the skinnylicious Chicken Salad Sandwich and my husband the Cashew Chicken. We did not receive our dinner until 8:10pm. This was a 50 minute wait for a sandwich and a chicken/rice dish! Before I even had the opportunity to mention the long wait to our server, he took the liberty of apologizing for the delay and twice checked with the kitchen on our meals. We watched two other tables that sat after us receive their food before us (one was a party of five).  Gregory, our server, said he would speak to management to see if we could be compensated for our trouble and came back with the offer of free cheesecake, which was very kind; however, I don&#39;t like cheesecake. I would have rather seen one of our four $10 glasses of wine comped. My husband and I each had two glasses of wine before our food even arrived. I located a manager at the check in desk following the dinner to share our experience. I explained I had worked in the food service industry and understand delays, but that our food took almost an hour to arrive. His response was &#34;Almost an hour. I didn&#39;t realize the kitchen was that behind&#34;. After that, he simply said he was sorry - there was no further conversation and he did not seem to be overly concerned. I didn&#39;t say it out loud, but thought to myself that as a manager, he should realize how far behind the kitchen is. When i walked in his was at the reception desk and when i walked out he was at the reception desk. Maybe he should move beyond the desk? Also, if our server informed him of our wait, he also should have stopped by our table. Having worked in the food service industry, I understand the etiquette when there is an issue.  I regret to say that I did not ask for his name, but he was an older tall slim gentleman with white hair. We are customers that often frequent the KOP Cheesecake Factory and never leave with a bill under $70 or $80 dollars. I want to ensure you understand that we were not looking for a free meal. I was disappointed with the management of the situation; I expected more. With all of the new restaurants in the KOP area, I can tell you that we will not be back. <br>PS: Greg was a WONDERFUL server. Hold onto him! He is a good one.
Always a good place to get a great meal.  Never had a bad meal here.  VERY busy with long wait but that gives you time to get in some shopping too.

Everything here is phenomenal.  I have yet to order something here that I did not like.<br>This is my #1 lunch choice for when I am near the KOP area.  I normally order the Cobb Salad (lunch portion) and I love it.  The sliders are amazing, and so are the fries.  Huge turkey club, awesome fried zucchini and fresh hummus.<br>The mango iced tea and raspberry lemonade are always my drink choices.  Portions are HUGE and the bread that they serve pre-meal is delish.<br><br>Of course every slice of cheesecake is heaven.  LOVE THIS PLACE.
Average food .. not much options for veggies. This place is too closed with lots of smell

We came in very late one night to enjoy a dinner. The server was very polite and friendly. She took our orders in a timely fashion and was able to assist us and have a small conversation. The food was wonderful and filling. Sadly even with our single small portions, we were full we couldn&#39;t enjoy a cheesecake of any kind. Why I selected 4 stars instead of 5 is because the floor was very slippery. I slipped and nothing was done about it since I didn&#39;t fall.
Had a late dinner after shopping at King of Prussia. Dinner was excellent! Unfortunately no room for dessert. Our server, Kayla was also very good! Would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Great food okay service. Can&#39;t blame the waiter since it&#39;s so busy but overall good time

The cheesecake is literally the only good thing about this place. It&#39;s always incredibly crowded and loud, yet there is always a wait. My boyfriend claims no matter what he orders, he always feels sick after eating here--it might be their cooking oil. Last time we went I got a breakfast sandwich and they substituted a different kind of bread workout asking. It was ok, but I wish hey had acknowledged that it was different from the menu. As we sat down, the &#34;clean&#34; silverware on the table had bits of green food stuck in it--both sets. Our server was ok but MIA almost the entire time. Do yourself a favor and just get your cheesecake to take out; ignore the rest of it.

Terrible customer service. Just awful. We had a takeout order and they forgot an item. When I called to see about coming back to get the item, I had to speak to two different people, both of whom were extremely rude. Then, when I drove 20 minutes back to the restaurant to get it and arrived at curbside takeout, I called in to the restaurant to tell them I was there and had to talk to another very rude person. They kept me waiting another ten minutes and when they finally brought the item to my car, the woman who brought it acted like I was a complete annoyance to her. It was unbelievable! Absolute incompetence and rudeness from start to finish. There are plenty of other restaurants that don&#39;t treat their customers like trash. I suggest you spend your money at one of those.

The finale of a day of shopping at the King of Prussia mall is not complete without the obligatory stop by the Cheesecake Factory. Essentially the very last store in the mall, the Cheesecake Factory provides a great embiance and environment for a family meal or date. <br><br>That is, if you can ensure waiting the customary 30 minutes to 2 hours to be seated. With the exception of opening hours, you can expect to wait in order to be seated. The layout of the restaurant gives the appearance that it is incredibly large, but this leads to the deception you may encounter during your visit. <br><br>The restaurant is deep in size, but incredibly narrow. This narrow design means you are forced to interact with the wait staff as they attempt to maneuver around you with other patrons&#39; platters.<br><br>Despite these handicaps, the service is expediant and the customer service is excellent. In my humble greedy opinion, the food is great and the pallette is large enough for everyone in your party. <br><br>So if you are ever in the area and have time to wait for a great meal, stop by the Cheesecake Factory in the king of Prussia mall!

It&#39;s been awhile since I visited the Cheesecake Factory, and now I remember why.  There&#39;s nothing particularly wrong with this restaurant chain.  It has a Disney-esque decor and ambiance, and it has a a good staff (Dijana, our server was enthusiastic to the point of being perky, efficient, and helpful: very professional) and good food, BUT, in the end, it feels more like an amp&#39;d up version of Appleby&#39;s or TGIF.<br><br>As I mentioned already, the food is good, but not great.  As Gordon Ramsay would likely point out, it has too many items on the menu, trying to provide something for everybody, so nothing I&#39;ve eaten at this restaurant chain has been memorable in my mind.  Case in point:  I had Jambalaya with linguini this evening: an interesting twist, but the linguini came out too wet and mushy, having been drenched in the Jambalaya sauce too long.  It was good and acceptable, but not something I would have paid ~$17 in retrospect.  I asked for an extra dry Grey Goose martini with extra olives:  I only got three (not four or five as I would have received at other restaurants).<br><br>And of course, the biggest problem for me: they don&#39;t take reservations.  Perhaps, they do this to purposefully create a crowd swarming inside and outside the restaurant, i.e., to create a buzz, to inflate the anticipation of the waiting clientale, but it does not work for me.  I hate having to wait among the throngs of people outside, and I hate the crowd of people milling around inside the restaurant.<br><br>Why did I come here this evening?  My kids still enjoy it, and they certainly love the cheesecake.  Perhaps, it&#39;s the thing to do after spending the day at the mall;, e.g., it&#39;s more about the entertainment, rather than the culinary, experience.  As long as you recognize and understand what you&#39;re paying for, it&#39;s OK.
I love all the selections of the cheese cakes. They have great food! Never had a bad experience that I can remember and let me tell u I don&#39;t forget the bad experience. Haha

Cheesecake at The Cheesecake Factory - WIN<br>Food at The Cheesecake Factory - FAIL<br><br>I&#39;ve been here a couple of times in my life, but usually it&#39;s so packed outside with people waiting for tables that I just stroll on by.  (Note - They don&#39;t take reservations at all!)  <br><br>A couple of my girlfriends and I decided to meet up for dinner one night, so we ended up at The Cheesecake factory.  The bread they brought out was delicious and warm, so the meal was off to a good start.  The menu is really all over the place, so it takes a little bit to really pick out what you want.  I decided on the crusted chicken romano with pasta.  The pasta portion of the meal was quite large, but was a little dry - definitely could have used some more sauce.  The chicken was pounded flat, but had really good flavors.  All-in-all, it wasn&#39;t a bad meal, but I&#39;ve definitely had better.  My friends got the salmon and four cheese pasta with chicken.  Didn&#39;t hear any complaints from them!<br><br>Now on to the main event - dessert.  I went with the PB Cup Fudge Ripple and it was by far one of the most glorious things I&#39;ve ever seen.  The slice of cheesecake was very generous and the flavor was amazing.  <br><br>I&#39;ll definitely be back for some dessert in the future!

Tasty food, nice variety of dishes on the menu, and HUGE portions - service is hit-or-miss at this Cheesecake Factory location but has been getting better (Anne Marie was the most recent server who helped me out). Great desserts, cheesecake is definitely their hallmark. Recommended for any get together. One negative is that they don&#39;t take reservations (in fact, no Cheesecake Factory does that I&#39;m aware of) and that their prices aren&#39;t the most wallet-friendly.<br><br>I&#39;ve had many dishes here, including the:<br>- Tex Mex rolls - they&#39;re huge for an appetizer, needed to share that<br>- macaroni balls - not a bad app, just balls of macaroni and cheese deep-fried... if that&#39;s your bag, go for it<br>- Firecracker Salmon Rolls ($9) - spiced fresh salmon rolled in spinach and fried in a crisp wrapper. Served with a sweet hot (haha riiiiight!) chili sauce<br>- Bang Bang chicken and shrimp - had this in Baltimore and loved it, but then again here. Wasn&#39;t as good as I remembered<br>- Sheila&#39;s New Orleans Pasta - not bad<br>- cajun jambalaya - good, surprisingly tangy, would get it again<br>- Thai chicken pasta - never mix &#34;Thai&#34; and &#34;pasta&#34; in the name of a dish - not really good<br>- crispy spicy beef ($15) - crispy fried slices of steak sauteed with green beans, shiitake mushrooms, onions, carrots and sesame seeds in a sweet-spicy sauce with white rice - not spicy, VERY sweet, with crispy (who would have thunk it) pieces of meat<br><br>I&#39;ve had a few desserts here but I only remember their carrot cake cheesecake because it&#39;s my favorite there - delicious! Definitely come here for their cheesecake. Their food you can live without.

I had not been a fan of the cheesecake factory all my life, but it has grown on me over the years... i am not too sure I am that much of a fan of any of the entree dishes, but I can eat the appitizers all day long. <br><br>It&#39;s good, it&#39;s got lots of selections, and it&#39;s consistently above average. A great default selection.

My first time ever at a Cheesecake Factory last month. I know, I know, shut up. I&#39;ve always heard such bad things about this place and I feel like every time I read another &#34;worst food in America&#34; article, a dish from this place is on the top of the list.<br><br>So, honestly, I was expecting a kind of redneck joint with tons of greasy fried foods and nothing but unhealthy, gross options. But I was surprised to see that even though it&#39;s got a chain-like decor and ridiculously large menu, it wasn&#39;t half bad. They have great selections on their &#34;skinny&#34; menu. The chicken tacos were actually amazing -- the ingredients were super fresh and the flavor was just right. And I think for something like 500 calories and $10, you get three good-sized tacos and a big thing of rice. Definitely a good value and calorie count. (I&#39;ve seen the 2,500+ calorie monstrosities they have in here, stay away!) The edamame was really good too.<br><br>And what other reason to eat a healthy dinner but to save room for dessert? I mean, it IS the CHEESECAKE Factory, after all. Thank God my brother and his wife and I shared a piece -- they are huge! I think I seriously have dreams about the Godiva slice. Good lord. A woman&#39;s dream.<br><br>Overall, a decent place to come if you&#39;re in the mall or close to it and you&#39;ve got people with different tastes since the menu is so huge. But be prepared for a long wait. And be careful what you order!

I strongly dislike how this Cheesecake Factory is doing things because clearly something is wrong. They do not take reservations and people are constantly camped outside of it like teenage girls camping out to see their favorite boy band. It&#39;s just cheesecake factory, a 5 hour wait on a good day is just unacceptable.<br><br>I think cheesecake factory is a great chain that never disappoints but this one is in dire need of allowing people to make reservations to fix the mess outside of it. People are literally sitting on the floor in a line outside and this particular one is located in one of the classiest and upscale malls in America.<br><br>Simply ridiculous.

Finally a free moment to have dinner with my love, arrived to the restaurant was a 55 minute wait. We decided to walk the mall in the meantime to kill the wait time. Came back and was seated abt 10 mins later an we ordered dinner. We were seated in the booth on the other side to where the waiter and waitresses get there items an so forth so most of the evening I heard draws slamming an a lot of banging on the other side of out table. Was kinda of annoying but we sat there. Our waiter was nice and friendly, we started out with two red sangrias an they were tasty! I ordered the chicken bellagio minus the prosciutto it was still good an I had a lot to bring home with me. Bae had the filet,mashed potatoes,asparagus which he enjoyed didn&#39;t leave a drop behind. He wanted ice cream but they were out of What he wanted. I did bring home a Oreo cheesecake which I&#39;ll be tasting tonight! This is just a suggestion but the restaurant is so dark I had to use my phone to read the menu. They should consider putting some lighting or candles on the tables so people can see ..just my opinion tho!

As many other Yelpers will tell you, the wait is worth it.  Oh, there were doubts.  There were many giver-uppers, and I don&#39;t blame them.  It&#39;s a Friday night, late dinner is inevitable, and you (and your company) are HUNGRY.  I pouted, moaned, groaned, and repeat.  But let me tell you, as long as you act smart and not try to go too far out of your comfort zone with your meal, then you will have a satisfying dining experience at The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>For appetizers, we had Fried Mac and Cheese.  Oh yeah, it trumps a healthier Mac and Cheese dish because you&#39;re just having a morsel, it&#39;s not the main course.  Don&#39;t go too overboard even though they only give you four...the balls are HUGE...<br><br>...and that&#39;s what she said XD.  <br><br>Anywho, had the Crispy Chicken Costoletta.  So NOT the most lavishing and complicated dish on the menu.  In fact, it&#39;s one of the least lavishing and complicated.  GOOD, because it was done very well for my palate, and I enjoyed every bite of it.  I remember the last time I was at the same Cheesecake Factory - I had a salad, and, let me tell you, I got LOST in the flavors.  I am one to always try and finish salads at a restaurants, because they get watery when you take the leftovers home.  It&#39;s by personal preference, but I did not prefer the huge portions.<br><br>Enough of ranting about the past, this is the PRESENT, and the cheesecakes still looked too pretty to eat!  Four slices for a grand total of $30.06 plus tax.  Haha, enjoying the desserts right now...of course, not by myself, but, well, I need to have my share :P  <br><br>Thank you for the memorable dining experience, Cheesecake Factory :-)

So incredibly upset with the service I received this evening. I took my cousin from out of town to eat at this location since we had a less than pleasant experience in Philly last time. The only reason I keep coming back is the food. For starters our waiter didn&#39;t greet us for a while and when he did he only asked for drinks, I had to stop him from leaving so we could order apps. He drops our drinks then runs off. He comes back takes our order, and then the waiting starts. We never received bread, the table next to us got it.  We figured our apps wouldn&#39;t take longer than 15 minutes since we ordered them early... wrong. It took 29 minutes. How do I know you may ask? I was sending a text as the waiter approached to take our entree order and once I realized the apps were taking forever I just checked the time stamp 8:38. Our apps arrive at 9:07. Yes I&#39;m timing at this point because I&#39;m getting angry. We dig in but not once did our waiter check on us not like he had the chance to because 6 minutes after our apps hit the table so did our entree. We&#39;re half way through apps and we start our dinner. We didn&#39;t get to finish either because we were too full, everything was so horribly spaced out. As we finish with our dirty plates stacked in front of us we realize not once did our waiter check to see if the food was okay how we were doing if we needed refills NOTHING. I was at a loss for words at the end of dinner. I have worked as a server for 8 years while being a student and I would be appalled at myself if I ever served someone so horribly. Clearly this guy was not meant to be a server. I let the manager know and his excuse was no not him, he&#39;s better than that. Something tells me he&#39;s not. I get people have bad days but when you see people next to you being taken care of well by the same person it makes you question. I won&#39;t be returning to this location, I would rather travel to jersey.

Just like every other Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve been to.  Great service, never longer than a 45 minute wait.  It&#39;s attached to the mall so you can shop around while you wait.  Cheesecake is amazing.   However it take a while to get a piece to go if you don&#39;t get a seat because the &#34;cake people&#34; are busy working on orders from dine-in customers and often neglect walk-ups.<br><br>I always ask the waiter/waitress to bring a piece to go so I can enjoy it later that night.  PORTION ARE VERY LARGE.

Worst experience at this location! After waiting an hour to be seated we ordered immediately only to have to wait another hour for food. We asked for the burgers to be cooked well done but when they arrived they were medium not even close to well done. We had to find the waiter because he was no where to be found and informed him of the issue. He brought his manager over and all he could say was it takes time for a burger to be cooked and I don&#39;t know what more I can do for you. Poor customer service especially as a manager you should know better. I will never go back to this restaurant because of the bad experience I had here. I am being nice giving this place a star.

Monday, 12 February 2018, my wife and I dined here for the fourth time in two weeks.  Obviously, we love this restaurant.  The food is always delicious.  The service is uneven.  Although server Allie did a fine job, there is a weak link in the host staff which we have encountered more than once here.  I will not embarrass the individual by offering a description, but that person&#39;s demeanor and attitude cause me to conclude that the high standard of this restaurant is not being met. This is something which should be evident to management in observing the employee. On the 12th, when I requested a different table than the small one in a crowded area at which we were being seated, the disgust of the individual was evident.  We were told, &#34;You gotta go back and check in again&#34;.  This person does not smile and is unpleasant, with the posture of someone who sees the customer is an annoyance. Surely The Cheesecake Factory knows that how one is greeted sets the tone for the evening. The poor treatment by this one individual put a damper on an otherwise excellent meal.

Visited on 26th May. The taste was all ok. However, I had ordered Spicy Chicken with Cashew nuts (Mandarin Style) and am suffering from food poisoning. This is not accepted from such a reputed chain. My friend wanted me to sue.. but who has the time.

One of the best fine-dining restaurants in the area. The food is good and served well. The waiters and waitresses are nice, friendly, and professional. The only negative is that sometimes you&#39;d have to wait a bit before finding a table. The place is not cheap, but prices are reasonable compared to other fine-dining restaurants. Their menu is comprehensive. It&#39;s very unlikely that you won&#39;t find few things that you like from the menu. Also, their dessert are as good as it can get. Though, their plates are big so eating dessert after finishing your meal might be a challenge. Enjoy!

The cheesecake is great, obviously!<br><br>My family, friends and I go there often because of their expansive menu which works for all types of pallets and individuals. <br><br>The entrees aren&#39;t anything special but we consistently come back for the deserts and appetizers.

I love the Cheesecake Factory! I am always satisfied when I leave this place. The bread they give you is absolutely phenomenal. I especially love the four cheese pasta with chicken, the chipotle chicken pasta, the mozzarella sticks, and the vanilla bean cheesecake! I recommend this place to everyone!

Sure ... it&#39;s a chain. Sure it can be considered &#39;family restaurant.&#39; <br><br>Sure doesn&#39;t mean it skimps on quality .. and certainly not quantity! <br><br>The nostalgia this place brings is second to none (think college dinners funded by friends&#39; parents). <br><br>In any case - you always start off with sourdough and honey wheat bread. Wish the butter was soft or at room temp - but they keep it chilled. The bread is usually warmed and fresh &#39;enough.&#39; Doesn&#39;t stop me from usually getting a refill.<br><br>But the refills do pose a problem ... there is never enough room for the rest of the food! <br><br>Start off with Avocado Eggrolls (yum - creamy avocado ... roasted peppers ... crunchy wanton wrapper). I&#39;ve eaten 20 of these in one sitting when I once had Cheesecake Factory catering ... no joke. Or choose the crispy crab wantons - you just can&#39;t go wrong.<br><br>From there - the problem is that everything for your mains is so good. And my own personal problem is that I can usually never deviate from:<br><br>1) Farfalle with Garlic Cream Sauce - Chicken - Pancetta - Peas - Mushrooms. Delicious - creamy - succulent. <br><br>2) Louisiana Chicken Pasta - spicy - creamy - chicken - all colors of bell peppers - fried chicken cutlets (4 for the dinner portion!)<br><br>3) Burger - they&#39;re all delicious! <br><br>4) Cheesecake - Red Velvet for the GF does wonders ... Tuxedo Mousse hits the spot for me! <br><br>Even I can&#39;t finish the food here. But the beautiful thing is - it&#39;s amazing heated up the next day!
Ordered the Buffalo bites, which was mostly bread crumbs and little chicken. They give you buffalo sauce on the side with blue cheese.  Just an average experience.

Came here for dinner with my fiance tonight. Our waiter was very nice and friendly. We got the fried mac and cheese balls which was out of this world. My fiance got the spaghetti and meatballs which he said was good however my Alfredo pasta with chicken was very bland, there was no flavor to it at all. It was not worth the 20 dollars. If we decided to come back I might just stick with appetizers and their cheesecakes.
I stopped coming here because of the circus atmosphere.  Take out was a nightmare.

Delicious food! I love that they have gotten rid of the beepers and now text you when your table is ready. We had a great experience being able to browse the court portion of the mall while waiting, when in years past, we had to sit on the floor in front of the restaurant.<br>Our nachos were amazing as were our entrees. We had a long piece of hair baked into one piece of the cheesecake, and kindly they just comped both slices instead of just the one. Great customer service. Love coming here.

Menu has ALOT to choose from almost too much if that&#39;s possible. Never had a bad meal there. Prices are a little high for the quality of food and cocktail prices are def expensive. But the cheesecake is AWESOME!

Poor Service &amp; Roaches. --- Last evening I took two teens (both with autism) to the restaurant.  The waiter was rude to the boy as he attempted to order his own meal. The waiter stated &#34;Is that it?&#34; 2-3x making the boy even more anxious. Then mocked him when he asked for a plain burger. The bread was hard as a rock &amp; the waiter essentially threw it on the table as he passed by. I spoke with the manager who assured us he would speak to the server about his customer service. The food was ok except my chicken sandwich was barely warm. The last straw was when a ROACH crawled up the wall next to my daughter. She was too frightened to scream but we all moved to the end of the table &amp; began shaking out her jacket. The waiter got the manager &amp; the manager swore this is the first time he&#39;s ever heard of roaches in the restaurant. I doubt it. We tried to take a picture but there were so many cracks in the booth we couldn&#39;t find it. He comped our meal but that doesn&#39;t make up for the experience. We&#39;ve been there a few times before with no issues. I&#39;m very disappointed. We wanted a nice meal, after the movies &amp; what happened was frightening &amp; appalling to the children &amp; I. Sadly, my daughter didn&#39;t get her slice of cheesecake she really wanted because we can no longer trust the cleanliness of the restaurant.
Always have an amazing time here. I haven&#39;t gotten a dish I didn&#39;t like. Cheesecake is always phenomenal. Not bad for prices either.

I got a &#34;small&#34; salad and soup and it was the size of a newborn baby. I had the portabella mushroom - avocado - zucchini fries and they were SUPERB. Thai rolls were good. Everyone&#39;s portion was equal to the size of Olympus, which confirms why America is fat - in a good way (if there is a good way). Ordered an Original and a Key Lime cheesecake to go and it was delicious. I&#39;d come again!

Horrible service. Sat at the high table by the bar ... 5 servers passed by without even making eye contact. After about 10 mins - my server finally came. No water, no bread, no silverware. I should have left!

love the cheesecake. however, i did not enjoy the wait. &#34;5 minutes&#34; turned into 25 minutes for to-go cheesecake????? what???? 25 minutes thats right i didnt stutter. that&#39;s outrageous. cheesecake? more like cheesefake

Not at all pleased with this location.  Place is entirely too dark to even see if there is food on your plate. This is very frustrating and makes me concerned with what is actually on my plate. I ordered a Margherita pizza, what I received is not even close; I have currently in front of me a very bad cheese pizza with a few leaves of what look to be dry basil that were  moistened by the red sludge they are passing as sauce. The center of the pizza is so thin when you grab a piece of crust the center does not move half the time; the time is does move it falls and splatters the plate milliseconds after it has been touched. I now remember why I never go to this chain.

My family and I ate at Cheesecake Factory again last night. Our server was Shane and he was excellent. We have been fortunate to have him as our server on previous visits and he is always courteous and provides great service. Our dinners were delicious as usual. Chicken Romano and pasta. One of the best dishes on the menu! We can&#39;t wait till we plan another shopping trip to the mall  so we can stop in again for dinner.
This place has gone down hill.  The menu has always been too big.  The food there lately has only been okay.  They lost spice and flavor in many of their dishes. Not usually worth the wait.

Dessert was the only thing I liked I got vanilla bean cheesecake and red velvet. Food was ok I got a chicken dish. Not what I expected. But maybe I&#39;ll get pasta next time . Huge menu . Very long wait. Service was ok . I&#39;ll try again during lunch may be it won&#39;t be so busy.

Went here last night with my husband and nephew, it was a Thursday at 6 o&#39;clock. We expected to have a long wait but were seated right away. Our waitress was a bit odd but we received our food and drinks very quickly. I ordered the chicken avacado club and sweet potato fries. Delish! My husband got an American cheeseburger, and my nephew got a chicken Marsala dish we were all extremely pleased and it was huge portions sizes. For desert I ordered the lemon raspberry cheesecake and my nephew the Adams cheesecake yummmmy! Very nice time out!!
Had two meals here during my recent visit to KOP area.  Both meals were great and the service was spot on.  Huge menu with plenty to choose from.  This place does it right.

Went on a Saturday and the wait for a table was 1 hour. Well worth the wait. Food was great and service was fantastic!!!  Had the bacon bacon cheeseburger and it was great!!! Have been there at least 7 times in the last two years and the service and food  have always been fantastic!!!!!

Pretty much the same in every city...delicious, great service, high energy, reasonable prices, comfortable atmosphere, large portions and lots of choices.  I am really enjoying the choices on their new skinny menu.  Had the skinny Asian chicken salad which said less than 590 calories and if that is really, really true...it was delish and satisfying!  It was huge and filling too.  My hubby ordered the club sandwich and it was fresh, huge and also delish!  Really...what is not to love about the Cheesecake factory?  They have something for everyone &amp; prices for every budget.

I visited this location on Tuesday.  This was the worst experience I have ever had.  I took my handicapped mother there.  Was greeted by the hostess who told us it would be 40 minutes.  We waited over an hour for a table.  She seemed to be making up times because I was listening to her give out times to people.  The person behind me got &#39;50 minutes&#39;, the next person &#39;40&#39;.  It went on and on.  They really should train a hostess on how to seat properly.  When we were finally seated we were helped by Shawn.  Here is where it went down hill more.  My mom ordered ice tea.  He never told her it was unsweetened.  So I asked her to bring her a glass of water instead since the ice tea, even with sugar in it, was not drinkable. Ten minutes later, he shows up with a glass of water!!! So then we order our food and I specifically ask to not have shrimp on it.  He said no problem and it will be $17.25.  Out comes the food.  Shawn ordered me the wrong meal.  Awesome!! So my mom starts eating.  After 15 minutes, no sign of our waiter of course, I see another waiter and ask for the manager.  My mom is done eating and I have no food yet.  No manager ever came to the table.  20 minutes later I got my food.  No manager.  I ate it.  Got the bill.  Was charged for shrimp!!! Was so pissed at the whole experience.  Just paid and left.  I live in Florida and I have never had this happen the many times I eaten in that restaurant there before.  <br>I asked for a manager.  None ever came because I got the wrong food, my bill was wrong, we complained when we sat down, the waiter was never seen, the hostess was awful!!!<br>I wrote this same review on Wednesday January 3, 2017 on the Cheesecake website and no one has contacted me.  Goes to show how much they care about customer service!!! <br><br>I just received a call from Chris from Customer Service. He was following up on the experience.  1/8/2017.  I appreciated the call.  Thank you.

Food: 3<br>Decor: 2.5<br>Ambiance: 2<br>Service:2.5<br>Value: 2.5<br><br>I will never understand the suburban obsession with Cheesecake Factory. The cheesecakes are good, yes, but you don&#39;t have to wait in the mall outside the restaurant for an hour and a half to get them. The food otherwise is mediocre and expensive.

I come here all the time. I get the chicken picatta every time I come along with about 3 lemonades. Average service every time (It is constantly packed). This time I went with a  group and myself and had a horrible server, not even sure if she checked on us after  I received my meal 10 minutes after my two friends received theirs The chicken picatta, which I have gotten every time I come, was the worse dish I&#39;ve had. I only ate a few bites and decided this wasn&#39;t a decent meal. I waited for my server 10 minutes for her to return to my table, after everyone else had eaten and finished their meal. I alerted my waitress 10 minutes later that this was nothing like Ive had before and I didn&#39;t want to finish it. She asked if I wanted it recooked and boxed to go since my friends had already finished their meals. While my food was being cooked, the waitress handed my table the bill and I found that my meal was included in the bill. I felt I should not have to pay for a meal I was not able to enjoy with my friends. I alerted the waitress immediately and said I did not want to pay for a meal which I could not enjoy with my friends. The waitress told me then that I had to pay regardless since it was in the process of being remade. Not wanting to pay for a meal I could not enjoy nor wanting to wait for the meal, we asked the one general manager if he could just take the meal off and we would pay the remaining bill. After 10 minutes of waiting for the manager to take the meal off the bill, my group and I went up to the hostess stand and spoke to the FRONT MANAGER Zack. He took care of us right when we discussed our issue with today&#39;s overall horrible server and ZACK the FRONT MANAGER addressed the issue and took care of our whole check. Great experience with Zack the front manager, who convinced my group and I to return, even though we had perviously decided to never return due to the first manager. <br><br>Definitely a bad taste in my mouth. Don&#39;t expect the best of service on a Sunday afternoon! The one FRONT MANAGER ZACK WAS GREAT. Not the other manager we talked to first. <br><br>-I eat at Cheesecake Factory at least 3 times a month

After waiting for 20 minutes, we took our seats and were greeted by our server. We told her nicely that we were there for coffee and dessert, and she pretty much rolled her eyes at us. Needless to say, we ordered our coffee and dessert and ate it quickly. Not sure if I&#39;ll be back.

We got the lunch portion salad and spaghetti and meatballs and it was huge. The caramel turtle cheesecake was incredibly sweet. The caramel cheesecakes and white chocolate cheesecakes are apparently all very sweet, but the regular and strawberry are supposed to be very good. The atmosphere was family friendly and food good for all ages.

We love The Cheesecake Factory &amp; always take advantage of the SLICE OF JOY offered around Christmas when you purchase gift cards &amp; receive free cheesecake. One of the highlights to our King of Prussia visits three times a year is this restaurant. The entrees are very generous &amp; we typically split our fav&#39; the Spicy Cashew Chicken &amp; each get a slice of our favorite cheesecake, Oreo Dream Extreme &amp; the Red Velvet. We have always had good service at this location, but ALWAYS expect a wait - simply because they are packed! Definitely recommend!

The wait was long, about a hour, on a Saturday around 3:00 pm. We walked around the mall to keep ourselves busy, as we knew this would happen. <br><br>The service was good. She (unfortunately I forget her name) was prompt and helpful with questions about the menu.<br><br>The menu/food: Well.. I got the crab cake bites and they were all dough (big disappointment). My boyfriend got the cheese garlic bread and definitely was not worth $9. He was not a fan, I didn&#39;t have an opinion either way. When he he told the waitress he wasn&#39;t fond of it and it wasn&#39;t what he thought it would be, our waitress did not offer him something else. That threw me off, as other places typically ask &#34;is there something else I can get you instead?&#34;. I ordered a martini. A (unknown to me and shame on me for ever ordering it) twelve dollar martini. Holy shit. <br><br>So our food arrives. My pasta is undercooked and still starchy/paste-y and it was a good size portion. I also added shrimp for a six dollar up charge. His steak was ok. Nothing great. We order our cheesecake to go and had it the next day. That too, we were not impressed with.<br><br>Over all, our expectations were high and we were pretty let down. The only reason I am giving it three stars is because of our waitress. To make it worse.. this was our anniversary dinner. We will not be returning.

I have to say I was surprised. Great burgers that were actually cooked to order and not overpriced. <br>Obviously the cheesecake is delicious. We had the Hershey cheesecake that had cake surrounding cheesecake and covered with syrup and chocolate chips.  How can you go wrong with that?

Whenever I am in King of Prussia, I ALWAYS have to stop at Cheesecake Factory! The Kobe burger is always spot-on, and my wife always has to have her Chinese Chicken Salad!! Service is always good when we dine in and the cheesecakes...enough said!!

I know...I know, it&#39;s a Cheesecake Factory! The food was delicious as expected with any of these locations. If I were rating on the food alone, I would have given 4 stars...but I am not rating on just the food. I sat at the bar for dinner as I am traveling for work. There were two bartenders and both were very nice, but if the female bartender called me Hun one more time I might have lost it. I give her credit for being attentive, but she just laid it on too thick for my liking. I don&#39;t know too many people that like much of a fake attitude.

I&#39;m never disappointed by this place.  The worst part is the wait but we got here on a wednesday at 6pm and got seated right away.  I got the Chicken and Avocado Club and Key Lime Cheesecake.  Both were really good.

Went here with my husband, after work earlier this week and it was okay.  The place was crowded, the staff always appeared preoccupied with their tasks, and it was LOUD.  The floor is solid, the ceilings are high, and everything has a hard surface.  Sound just bounces around the room.  We were seated near a server station, so we were (un)luncky enough to hear the servers opinions of other diners, which was not always positive.<br>We didn&#39;t have to wait too long, just 10 minutes, so that wasn&#39;t bad at all.<br>Our server was pleasant. The menu is too large and included ads.  Really?? Couldn&#39;t we cut back on a few menu pages and skip the ads?  It shouldn&#39;t feel like I am reading a magazine - it is a menu!  And everything is in the menu - pages of drinks, pages of lunch items, pages of appetizers, etc.  It just goes on and on.  <br>Drinks were good, service was timed nicely.  But the food - it was okay - but the portions are too large - waaaay too large!  My chicken Marsala was enough for three large meals.  And while it had mushrooms, it would be nice if it was served with a vegetable.  I received a platter of pasta, chicken, and mushrooms (and a stick of parsley that was all stem and one leaf).  Some steamed broccoli or green beans would have been nice visually as well as to balance out the meal.  Needless to say, we had leftovers to take home.<br>We took home some cheesecake...do they really think that after eating such a huge portion of food that people will have room for dessert?? But the cheesecake was very nice.  The Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake had too much whipped layer and not enough cheesecake, but still overall it was a nice chocolate dessert.<br><br>I think that in the future, if I went again, I would get one entree, a side of veg. and some cheesecake (definitely) but I would order it to go.  That would still be a huge meal for two people but I could enjoy it in the quiet of my home. <br><br>Overall, the food was okay, not GREAT but not bad.  <br>Everything seems fresh, and with such a huge menu, that in itself is amazing and must be possible due to the high volume of diners.<br>The prices are high and appear to be somewhat a-la-cart.  If you want a salad or vegetable, you need to order it.  <br>The atmosphere is casual but loud and crowded.
I have been to this one several times, so far no disappointment yet. :P

I love the cheesecake factory so to have an experience like this was very very upsetting to me. My friends and i arrived to the cheesecake factory at KOP around 3:45PM on Saturday. We put our name in, there we&#39;re 6 of us, and we&#39;re told it was going to be an hour wait. After waiting for TWO HOURS we were finally seated. When our waiter came, he sounded absolutely miserable. One of my friends ordered a sprite and when she got it, she said it tasted nothing like sprite and more like very bitter sparkling water. He took our order and we waited about 45min and when our food came my chicken was less than luke warm and tasted like it had been sitting out for the past 20min. I went to go to the bathroom when our waiter came to give out the checks and when i returned i asked him if i could get a piece of cheesecake to go and he looked like I just ruined his day. All in all, i have never been this disappointed with a visit to the cheesecake factory. I get working saturdays is rough but this was beyond brutal for me. I don&#39;t plan to return to this location.
I just want to say i had dinner at the cheesecake factory in willow grove and the food was great however my van bean cheese  cake was out of this world.the service is always wonderful

Cheesecake factory is a star above a chain; great menu and prices with huge (beyond huge) portions.  Their food presentation is great, then the taste is just mediocre. Nothing to wow about, but def good enough to go back. The chicken lettuce wraps were on average of most I&#39;ve tasted. The burrito I got was the size and weight of my chihuahua..really it was, but it was bland and dry. <br>Their artichoke hearts are wonderful.

We were at the movies and decided to dine afterwards. This place is great as it&#39;s on the outskirts of the mall. A little loud, but tasty food with fast, friensly, and attentive service keeps us coming back.

For me this place has been very inconsistent. Sometimes it is decent, better at lunch, but other times it really misses. They don&#39;t seem able to cook a piece of fish  less than extra well done. I just finished a piece of salmon that left much to be desired. It was better for lunch last week but still over done. Perhaps the sandwiches and pastas are better.

Some how I&#39;ve never gotten to dine at a Cheesecake Factory until last week.  I was always under the impression that it was going to be really expensive but boy was wrong.  Everything here is surprisingly affordable.  Oh and by the way, the menu is huge, and when I say huge, I mean enormous. I&#39;m pretty sure there were three pages of appetizers and about 5 pages of entrees.  Incredible.  It did take quite awhile to pick something to eat out of all the options.  I ordered the Cajun Chicken and Shrimp pasta and my fiance ordered the Thai chicken pasta.  Both were pretty good, but what shocked me the most was the size of these plates.  I left with half my meal in a to go box.  Oh yea and the cheesecakes are amazing.  We also left with about half of desserts in a to go box as well.  So much food, not very expensive.  May get crowded, but a pretty good option if you&#39;re in KOP.

Here is an update received a reply from customer relations Craig Gumm  that gift cards are only to be used in locations but Harry and David stores sell the cheesecakes but do not accept  Cheesecake factory gift cards.So basically I still have a useless card.
Very good place to go for dinner, love their buffalo blasters. Always crowded, of course amazing cheesecake.

The food is always delicious and it also had outdoor seating which is a huge plus for the warmer months. What is great is that they are open late on the weekends until 12:30am. The only problem that we ran into late at night is that the staff want to go home and become antsy and it shows. We didn&#39;t get our complementary bread basket and we saw around 12:00 another couple getting seated and the waitress have the hostess a lot of attitude for it in front of other customers. We have never had a bad experience except for that night and that&#39;s why I give it 4 stars.

Expect a long wait but it is worth it once you sit down.  My favorite dish is the crusted chicken romano.  You will easily have leftovers and will be able to get a couple of meals out of it.  The drink selection has a lot of fun fruity vodka choices.  I love their lemonades as I have a strong sweet tooth.  Be warned, the lemonades are sweet.<br><br>Of course, you can&#39;t leave this restaurant without checking out the cheesecakes.  Red velvet is too die for and you might as I have yet to check out how many calories are in it.  Despite the cheesecake choices, the restaurant offers up a fantastic chocolate cake.

Not a bad restaurant. Yes, it&#39;s a chain, but for the couple of times I&#39;ve been here: <br><br>1. Food has always tasted very good and served at the appropriate temperature (which is important because you don&#39;t want soggy french fries!)<br><br>2. Service has been decent.<br><br>3. I haven&#39;t had to wait 2+ hours to be seated (when there&#39;s only 2 people, your chances of getting seated quickly are pretty good.)<br><br>Sure, you&#39;re going to pay $40+ for a meal for two, including a single slice of cheesecake...but if you choose something like the Red Velvet Cheesecake, you won&#39;t be disappointed!

Summer is here (not technically) and I&#39;m really trying to watch my figure. Thanks to The Cheesecase Factory, there are meals like the Weight Management Asian Chicken Salad (which I ordered). Thanks to food that tastes like nothing, I was still hungry after the fact.<br><br>Note to self and others, weight management is for suckers.

My last review of this place was four stars, but I have to downgrade it after visiting it several times since my last review. The food quality and execution is down from a few years ago. My last trip was for lunch and it was a bad experience. I got the Renee&#39;s special, which is a soup, sandwich, and salad. <br><br>My soup was tasteless, except for the overabundance of salt. It reminded me of something I got from the can in the 80&#39;s. The chicken salad sandwich was covered in this greasy bread that had to have a 1/2 of stick of butter in it. Finally, the Caesar salad was way too cold, suggesting it was pre-made sitting in the fridge. To top it off, it was absolutely smothered in cheese. I think there was more cheese than lettuce. Absolutely gross. <br><br>You can do a lot worse than the Cheesecake Factory at the mall, but its not a place I will look forward to going to anymore.

Unimaginative, bland, apathetic food. Portions are oversized. The menu is waayyyyy too long. <br><br>The one good thing is that the urinal geyser&#39;d water everywhere when flushed, which provided far more amusement than the food.

I come here way more often than is necessary, usually at the behest of an overgrown baby suffering from cravings. This location is huge but almost always packed, even during weekday lunch hours. It doesn&#39;t help that they don&#39;t take reservations, so you&#39;re probably going to end up waiting, especially if you come for dinner.<br><br>One thing about the food is that the portions are enormous. Almost everyone here leaves with a takeout box (except for aforementioned giant baby because he eats everything). Try to come for lunch where the portions are smaller and prices cheaper if you&#39;re not a huge eater.<br><br>I do like the miso salmon entree and tuna carpaccio appetizer. The herb-crusted salmon was not so good and aesthetically very unappealing (it looked like a turd, really). The house salad with balsamic vinaigrette is good, but I&#39;m not sure how you can really go wrong with that.<br><br>The cheesecakes are very good, though. I loooove the key lime.<br><br>I&#39;d recommend this place to big eaters who don&#39;t mind waiting or spending a bit. There&#39;s a lot to choose from which can be hard if you&#39;re indecisive. But expect everything to be satisfying, even if it&#39;s not mind-blowing.

Ok. I might get discredited as a Yelper but truth be told, I&#39;m a bit of a fan of The Cheesecake Factory. Yes, it&#39;s a chain store, but they are a chain store for a reason and judging by the crowd gathering here every weekend and the 45~60 minutes waiting time to get a table, a whole lot of people seem to agree with me.<br><br>They have an impressive extensive menu with more than 200 items aiming to please as many specific tastes as possible. Ranges from salads, burger, sandwich, pizza and pasta, to your more exotic appetizers, seafood and more substantial steak and chops, but of course, you&#39;d want to leave room for desserts. <br><br>My all-time favorite dish at the Cheesecake Factory has got to be their Thai Lettuce Wraps. In my rather short lifespan, I have yet to taste a better lettuce wrap. Grilled chicken with peanuts and rice vermicelli wrapped in lettuce with three different and delicious sauces to dip them in. Yum.
